node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: Dirt meets stone here as a road begins its winding journey north along a cut-out hillside shrouded by a grove of trees. Just a few hundred feet north a large growth of reeds forces a jog to the northwest. In a clump of weeds sits a makeshift stone bench and small pile of stones. If it was once a shrine, someone has long since removed the statue and abandoned its care.

node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: Tapping your foot on the ground, the hardness of stone confirms you are on the road. You feel your way about searching for the hillside to the west or the reeds to the east. Once oriented, a sense of calm returns and you consider your options.

The stones of the road fit seamlessly together, locked to each other without mortar. Traces of rust form two paths in this curve where the iron rims of the wagon wheels have paid the price of taking the turn too fast. A bullfrog croaks out his presence somewhere in the tall reeds that line the road. The shade of the trees to the northwest is alluring yet daunting.

node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: Tapping your foot on the ground, the hardness of stone confirms you are on the road. You feel your way about, searching for the hillside to the west or the reeds to the east. Once oriented, a sense of calm returns and you consider your options.

Gnats swarm annoyingly about your head, prompting you to bat at them with your hand in vain. To the north, you can see where the road leaves the shadows and enters the safety of daylight about a half a mile away. Curving to the southeast, the road leads you to the closest exit for this grove. Moss clings to the stones of the road where it meets the water and reeds to the east.

node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: Tapping your foot on the ground, the hardness of stone confirms you are on the road. You feel your way about searching for the hillside to the west or the reeds to the east. Once oriented, a sense of calm returns and you consider your options.

Some reeds have been hacked away close to the road, undoubtedly destined to become someone's new basket. The removal has left an opening in the reeds allowing you to peer into the marsh on the other side which seemingly waits for its next victim. A water beetle that is traveling through the mud stops and waves its feelers at you in what seems to be a challenge before continuing on its way.

node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: Tapping your foot on the ground, the hardness of stone confirms you are on the road. You feel your way about searching for the hillside to the west or the reeds to the east. Once oriented, a sense of calm returns and you consider your options.

The lack of direct sunlight here is daunting. You can't seem to suppress the notion this is the perfect place for highway bandits to ply their trade. Squinting at the deeper shadows, you search the area for possible ambush locations and poke at the reeds just to make sure. A quick glance north and south confirms you are in the middle of the grove.

node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: High reeds create a thick wall to the southeast. A makeshift target is tacked to the closest tree. Someone has been practicing their archery, and on closer inspection you see the arrowheads that are now and forever a part of the tree. To the northwest you see a large bridge now in ruin, which used to span the river. To the south the road heads directly into the shadows of a grove of trees.

node.name: The Marsh, Stone Road
node.description: A large stone bridge that once spanned the expanse of the river here, now lays in ruin. The town of Riverhaven, the bridge's orginal destination, sits on the other side. Gazing at the town, the orange glow of the town's street torches forms an eerie dome in the night sky. To the southeast, a wall of reeds creeps down from a group of trees into the river and attempts to survive the currents of the river.

A large stone bridge that once spanned the expanse of the river here, now lays in ruin. The town of Riverhaven, the bridge's original destination, sits on the other side. Gazing at the town, you notice a haze of brown lingers in the air, no doubt the result of the forges and smoke houses at work. To the southeast, a wall of reeds creeps down from a group of trees into the river and attempts to survive its currents.

A large stone bridge that once spanned the river here now lies in ruins. The town of Riverhaven, the bridge's original destination, sits on the other side. Gazing at the town, you notice that a brown haze lingers in the air, no doubt the result of the forges and smokehouses at work. To the southeast, a wall of reeds creeps down from a group of trees into the river and attempts to survive its currents.

A large stone bridge that once spanned the river here now lies in ruins. The town of Riverhaven, the bridge's original destination, sits on the other side. Gazing at the town, you notice that the orange glow of the town's street torches forms an eerie dome in the night sky. To the southeast, a wall of reeds creeps down from a group of trees into the river and attempts to survive the currents of the river.

node.name: The Marsh, In The Water
node.description: The darkness about you is absolute. Discerning the objects about requires they be inches from your face. Feeling your way about you touch fur, then realize it is cold wet moss. Something bumps into you causing you to jump back ready to defend yourself, then realize you've walked into a tree. Out of the corner of your eye you think you see something move, then realize it's just your mind playing tricks on you in the absence of vision.

Struggling against the suction of the mud, simply walking becomes a challenge of balance and agility. Thick growths of reeds tower about you making it difficult to maintain a direction as you slog your way through the knee-deep water. Ripples in the water announce your presence with each step you take.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: Climbing a small rise, you find a splendid view off to the north. The hills about you slowly flatten, spreading out into a broad, low valley. A large river winds its way through the valley like a deep blue ribbon, bordered by a dense band of marshlands.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: Your passage through the plains disturbs rabbits which bound across the road in front of you. Quail and pheasant nest in the high grass, and hawks and kites drift in silent circles overhead. Tracks in the dirt reveal the presence of deer, skunks, foxes, and even one set of paw prints from a cougar.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A broad patch of low shrubs hugging the ground on the roadside stands in full bloom. Stunning red flowers on yellow stalks stand out against the green leaves. Hummingbirds flit from blossom to blossom, dipping their long noses into each before moving on.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: Sagging wooden fenceposts outline an abandoned farmhouse a short distance away. The walls have collapsed completely, leaving only a peaked shingle roof resting atop a pile of splintered debris. Weeds and grass have overrun and choked the once neat rows of tomatoes, corn and barley.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: An old stone well sits in a secluded glade just to the south. Alongside the well is a broad stone trough for watering horses, with a rail to tie them. A broad flat slab of sandstone beneath the boughs of an old tree looks like a perfect spot to relax for a moment.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: A white trail of smoke rises from a lone cottage atop a nearby hill. The hill itself is covered in a carpet of thick green herbs and plants, interspersed with tall pines and fruit trees. Off to the north and west, the open plains slowly give way to farmlands. Looking southward, you see the open grassy plains, low hills, and far off in the distance, the outline of two massive mountains lost in the clouds.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: Small wooden plaques alongside a myriad of footpaths and trails point the way towards small farms and houses dotting the rolling hillsides. Patches of golden grain and rows of green vegetables stand out between open stretches of tall prairie grass and clumps of trees.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: Long shadowy rows of vines stretch off to either side of the road like darkened corridors. A sweet smell drifts on the evening breeze from the ripe grapes hanging in thick bunches from the vines.

Long rows of vines laden with bunches of ripe purple grapes grow over rows of wooden trellises lining both sides of the road. Here and there, brightly dressed Halfling workers wander through the vineyard, carefully picking and gathering the harvest.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: A sturdy covered bridge stretches across a narrow irrigation channel. The banks are covered in a thick green blanket of ivy, and clumps of tall narrow reeds grow up from the slow-moving water. Farmlands stretch all about you in neat green and gold squares like a patchwork quilt.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: Long, shadowed lines of apple and cherry trees stretch off all around you, their blossom laden boughs dripping in the evening dew.

The low, relaxing drone of bees flitting from flower to flower rises faintly from neat rows of apple and cherry trees. The trees stand covered in pink and white blossoms, pouring a sweet fruity fragrance into the quiet breeze.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: A whitewashed wooden fence stands between you and a cool pond beckoning from beside the road. White linens hanging from a clothesline wave slowly in the breeze behind a nearby cottage, from which wafts the scent of freshly baking bread.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: Rows of tall elm trees planted on either side of the road obscure your view of the country around you. Their leaves rustle softly in the wind, and red squirrels dart through the branches overhead. The sound of bleating sheep echoes from a wooden pen off in the distance.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: Empty wooden stalls line the road, and the grass is crushed in neat squares where tents stood during the day.

Stalls, tents and carts line the road, bedecked with all manner of fresh produce for sale. Local farmers wander about hawking baskets of apples, cherries, cages full of squawking fowl, and a bedazzling variety of edibles. A festive spirit hangs in the air, and the sound of music and dancing rings out over the voices of haggling shopkeepers and hucksters pitching their wares.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: Grey shadows float on the placid surface of a stream running near the road, as a family of geese drifts asleep amid the stars twinkling off the water.

Local folk gather alongside a clear running stream, chatting merrily as they wash their clothes on the smooth stones lining the riverbank. A flock of geese floating regally in the water add their own honking comments to the gossip and chatter on the shore.

node.name: North Road, Farmlands
node.description: The road seems empty and quiet as you travel along beneath the cool night sky.

The busy flow of commerce fills the road with travellers going to and from the ferry crossing to the north. The air rings with the sound of horses and camels, and passersby calling out greetings to friends along the way. Richly-dressed merchants, farmers leading carts full of grain, and fishermen hauling baskets of the day's catch, all jostle together on the busy thoroughfare.

node.name: North Road, Riverbank
node.description: A pungent smell rises from racks of salted fish standing like tattered skeletons against the evening sky. Thatched huts stand in a circle around you, their doors and windows locked against the evening gloom.

A pungent smell rises from racks of salted fish set out to dry amid a circle of small huts. The huts are mostly simple wooden buildings with roofs thatched with river reeds and built on stilts to protect against flooding. A group of children gaze in rapt attention as an old man seated on a barrel regales them with stories of his youth.

node.name: North Road, Riverbank
node.description: This close to the river's edge, dry ground gives way to marshlands. A thick coat of bright green moss grows over many of the standing pools, and on the groups of elm trees rising from scattered muddy knolls. Waterfowl swim lazily on the ponds, diving under the water every now and again for a quick snack. The path runs atop a packed earth dike rising above the sodden ground.

node.name: North Road, Ferry
node.description: A slab of downed cedars, lashed together, rides upon the Faldesu River forming the landing for the ferry's patrons. The nearby splash of a toad and the squawk of distant waterfowl own this place, until the new day brings the drumming of civilization.

A slab of downed cedars, lashed together, rides upon the Faldesu River forming the landing for the ferry's patrons. A number of anxious traders shuffle about in anticipation of some future sale. This simple dock is evidently the commerce bottleneck for Riverhaven.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: The road passes into a broad green meadow covered in pretty white and yellow daisies, with tall grass which nearly covers the remains of a broken horsecart lying abandoned alongside the road.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A wide placid stream flows slowly against the backdrop of a bare stone hillside. The bank nearest you is littered with smooth round stones of all sizes, bringing up a childish urge to pick one up and send it skipping across the still clear water.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: Crickets chirping in the tall weeds provide a musical counterpoint to the sound of your feet plodding along the darkened path.

An ancient ash tree crowns the top of a nearby hillside, spreading its branches outwards like long embracing arms. A brilliant yellow spray of blooming mustard flowers grows beneath, shining like the early sun against the shaded green backdrop.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A roughly carved wooden figure stands upon a polished sandstone slab in the middle of the road, surrounded by piles of drying flowers, food, and other offerings. As you pass by, a family of ravens cackles at you from the branches of an ancient thorn tree.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: The packed earth roadway cuts a visible scar through waist-high dried grasses which cover the land like a shimmering golden blanket. Deep green bands of scrub oak dot the hillsides, and patches of sagebrush growing alongside the road give off a sweet earthy smell as they rustle in the wind.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: You pass from the open air into a low copse of young oak trees. Their interlocking branches and broad leaves form a living canopy over your head which rustles softly in the breeze. To the northeast, the sound of mules and horses comes from a whitewashed wooden barn barely visible through the trees.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A broad path stretches north from the road towards a group of cheery wood buildings tucked beneath the boughs of a glade of tall oaks. Several horses are tethered to a rail in front of the largest structure, and a thin trickle of smoke rises from its red stone chimney.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A stone tower rises above the plains just away to the north, through a sturdy oak door. A broken pile of logs before the tower might once have been a small shack of some kind, and piles of masonry flanking the road look like they once supported a chain or beam to bar the road to travelers.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A cool breeze from the north brings the faint tang of moisture to your parched throat. Low brown grass flanks the road to both sides, and a line of hardy thornbrush follows the course of a small stream off to the east. A flock of vultures floats in lazy circles against the sky.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A rough trail branches off from the main road, towards a small crevice about a quarter of a mile off to the east. Bits of green poking out over the crevice rim look like treetops, but you can't be sure from here. Judging from the ruts and tracks on the trail, it appears fairly well used.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: The charred remnants of a small grove of trees surround the road. The ground is scorched and littered with bits of charcoal and ashes. Most of the trees have fallen into broken piles of burnt logs, but a few blackened skeletons still stand like shadows cast against the sky. Fresh green shoots struggle up through the wreckage, bringing a tinge of hope to the devastation.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: The land all about you is flat, and the plains stretch out as far as you can see to the north and east. Looking west, you can see foothills rising up to the base of the Greater Fist of Heaven. The peak itself rises far above the surrounding landscape, its top hidden by a thick wreath of clouds.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A rickety wooden bridge spans a dry riverbed to the north. Tall clumps of grass and thorny bushes grow along the banks, and dried out patches of reeds dot the bottom. A hawk circles slowly overhead, on the lookout for prey.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A bright splash of purple just off the road catches your attention for a moment. A small patch of wildflowers is growing atop a crumbling slab of reddish stone, their brilliant hue standing out sharply against the greyish backdrop. You pause for a moment, and wonder what generous god it was that created this tiny miracle.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: Small weeds and tufts of grass grow right up to the road's edge, almost obscuring the faint traces of a trail heading westward. The trail appears to head towards the volcanoes, but you can see no signs that anyone has used it for quite a while.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: The sound of running water seems strangely out of place here, and draws your attention to a small stream flowing beside you. Nothing grows along the rocky banks, not even moss, which seems a bit odd on the only open water for miles.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: The bleached skeleton of some large animal lies partially buried in the dust just off the roadway. Its presence serves as a grim reminder of the fate awaiting any who tarry too long in this harsh, devastated land.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: A gnarled scrub oak stands lonely guard off to the side of the road. Looking south, the ground slopes slowly up to a sharp ridge of smooth black stone. Northward, the road bends towards your left, skirting the bottom of the eastern volcano.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: You pause here for a moment to examine the two monstrous volcanoes dominating the northern horizon. The easternmost, known as the Greater Fist of Heaven, stretches from the valley floor up into the sky, its snow covered summit disappearing from sight into the clouds. A faint red glow emanates from the Lesser Fist to the west, lighting up the clouds of smoke pouring from its gaping fiery mouth.

node.name: North Road, Plains
node.description: Turning your back to the massive obsidian wall to the south, you look out over a broad valley stretching below you to the north. For miles around, the bare sterile earth is a dull rusty red, scattered with grey and black boulders of pumice and basalt. Far off in the distance, you can just make out the silvery reflection of water, and even a hint of green.

node.name: North Road, Tunnel
node.description: Your footsteps echo off the glassy black tunnel walls, and light from the openings to the north and south glitters off sharp facets in the carved stone. You carefully pick your way past piles of jagged obsidian shards stacked haphazardly along the floor.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: Your view north is partially blocked by a black obsidian ridge rising from the valley floor. Someone has laboriously chopped through the massive glassy wall, creating a tunnel which you can pass through. You can just catch a glimpse of the road north through the tunnel, where it descends into a broad grey valley, and then curves out of sight to the east. A field of frozen flows of lava stretches out to the south, covered with pools of dull yellow ash.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: The route descends into the dust filled bowl of an ancient crater. The crater is miles across and ringed with a jagged stone edge, as if smashed into the plain by the fist of an angry god.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: Occasional flashes of red light up the clouds of smoke pouring from a small cone to the southeast. To the north, a jagged black ridge cuts across the horizon from east to west. Old scratches in the pitted stone mark the trail through this dead valley.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: A tongue of molten lava creeps ponderously towards the trail from a small vent off to the east. Sporadic sprays of white hot rock burst through the magma's cooling crust and shower the landscape with blistering red rain. Another flow blocks your way north, but it looks older, and cool enough to cross.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: The wind rips a stream of dust from the crumbling face of an upthrust spire of basalt. The spire is weathered and needle thin, and you wonder how long it can stand through the constant tremors and eruptions which rock this shattered valley.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: As the road crosses a low point between two towering mounds of pumice, you are surprised to find yourself wading through slippery knee-deep mud. Some underground spring or perhaps a small stream trickles through here, turning the omnipresent dust into a pool of viscous greasy muck.

node.name: North Road, Canyon Rim
node.description: To the north, the road wends its way between the tall piles of cinders and volcanic rock that comprise the valley floor. To the south, the way is barred by a huge crevice. Gazing into it, you see that part of the wall has collapsed, and you should be able to climb down the rockslide there. The wind blows from the north, bearing away much of the stench from the open pits below.

node.name: North Road, Canyon
node.description: The reek of the gasses escaping the canyon floor is nearly unbearable here. Although the lava you walk on is clearly ancient, it is still disconcertingly warm to the touch. The way west is blocked, but the canyon opens up to the east, and a rockslide appears to offer a way up the northern wall.

node.name: North Rim, Canyon
node.description: Deep fissures in the canyon's floor vent steam and smoke into the air. The haze and stench are so thick you can barely see or breathe, and the cracked uneven surface makes every step a chore.

node.name: North Road, Canyon Rim
node.description: The road north is blocked by a huge chasm carved by some ancient eruption. The smoke rising from the canyon floor stinks of sulphur and ash, but there seems to be no other way to proceed northward. To the south, the land slowly dips into a broad valley, and far off in the distance, you see what looks like a cluster of buildings.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: The land about you is still and lifeless. The silence is broken only by the monotonous sound of your feet plodding through the pools of ash, and a low rumbling coming from under the earth. A plume of thick white smoke rises from the summit of the mountain to the northeast.

node.name: North Road, Lava Field
node.description: Heat rises in palpable waves from the black frozen ocean of lava, making this whole valley seem like some gargantuan oven. Each step you take raises clouds of gritty yellow ash, coating your clothing and skin with a harsh abrasive layer of soot. The only breaks in the bleak landscape are occasional spires of rock jutting through the black stone floor, and the menacing profiles of the great volcanoes off in the distance.

node.name: North Road
node.description: The sound of horses and camels calls your attention to a cluster of stone buildings to the south, bringing thoughts of warm food, cold drinks, and clean beds. To the north, the route climbs over a small hillock of frozen lava and continues onwards toward two monstrous volcanoes barely visible through the dust and haze.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary
node.description: The road runs northwest past a cluster of stone buildings and stables to one side. A narrow path branches off to the east following a rough line of hills while another section continues southeast. You hear the lowing of sheep and the bleating of goats from nearby and an errant breeze brings the smell of something roasting over a fire. Elsewhere, you might wonder just what was being cooked that smells so strongly, but here and now you find you are both famished and in dire need of drink.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary
node.description: You stand amidst a small oasis among the rocks and gullies and blackened hills of this dead land. A large building to one side has all the earmarks of an Inn. Across from it are several outbuildings and what smells like a stable. Behind the stable, a herd of goats bleats dispiritedly in a pen and a few sheep graze inside a small fenced area among some scrawny grass tussocks.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary
node.description: Several small buildings cluster here, huddled against the chill wind. Set some distance away, near the edge of a steep slope, a tiny, unpainted shack stands by itself.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Small Shack
node.description: You stand in front of a building barely large enough to hold even a couple of people. A rickety wooden door dangles on dry leather hinges but does not seem locked. A curious stench emanates from inside and there is a humming of insects as they swarm in and around the little shack.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: Set apart from the other caravansary buildings and away from the hustle and bustle of the Northern Trade Road, this quiet campground provides a peaceful settlement for traders. In the middle of the circle is a community campsite, where cabin owners can meet and discuss the news of the day.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Campfire
node.description: A blazing fire cheerfully crackles in the center of the encampment, surrounded by aged wooden benches and chairs. Set upon a small tower of chiseled stone overhanging the fire is a small grill where an enterprising young cook works to earn odd coin, chatting companionably to anyone who happens by.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: The cabins here have been built right up against the stony mountain face, sheltering them against the harsh winds of the area and providing shade during the long summer months. The face curves slightly away from the northernmost houses and forms a small indentation in the rock behind them.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: Prickly, grey-leaved bushes smother the hill behind the north side houses, their tiny silver blossoms adding a subtle sweet fragrance into the air. A plume of smoke rises to the south from the ever-blazing fire in the center of camp, reminding one of good food and agreeable company.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: An old oak tree shades the houses along this side of the circle as feisty vines tangle around its trunk like young children around their mother's skirt. Wildflowers line the woodchip path, thriving in the rich black soil of the area.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: The cries of large birds of prey can be heard at times coming from the large rocky mountain to the northwest. Occasionally one will take to the air and encircle the campsite, eyeing the central campfire as if attracted by the aromas of food that travel on the wind. Wild roses twist along the edges of a wood-chip path in front of the houses, trailing dangerously out onto the path like mischievous welkins trying to trip or snag passing inhabitants.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: A bare rocky mountain lies to the northwest, curling very close to the cabins and causing large pockets of shadow to loom over them regardless of the hour. Nestled in between the ridges of the mountains as they march towards the northern expanse, this cozy campsite provides a private sheltered area where residents can unwind after a hard day's trading.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: A large sunbleached fence bends around the southern edge, covered with the ropy green vines of morning glories that twist and turn to create a solid curtain of flowers. Several overturned tree stumps have been placed in front of the fence to provide a place to sit and watch neighbors as they pass by on the woodchip path.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rustic Circle
node.description: Tantalizing aromas of food drift in the air from the northwest, mixing with the delicate smell of honeysuckle coming from the wild brush to the east. Young spindly trees rise up through the hardy foliage, jutting out from the dark acidic soil as nature continues to replenish the once ash-smothered land.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary
node.description: Slabs of rock, roughly fashioned but serviceable, form a small barn for the few livestock and the occasional horse to be found here. The roof is solid and seems weathertight. The scent of hay and dried grass wafts from within, a counterpoint to the flinty odor in the wind. Nearby is a larger building for the stables.

node.name: Northwest Road, Volcanic Hills
node.description: The uneven surface of the road bumps and jars at you as you pass among the lumps and furrows made by frozen lava flows. Someone has hacked the outline of a path into the unyielding rock to guide you. To the northwest, you can barely glimpse some huddled buildings that show faint signs of life, judging from the thin trickle of smoke rising from their chimneys.

node.name: Northwest Road, Volcanic Hills
node.description: A raw, new road, scratched from the hard black rock of the hills and mountains, runs straight along from southeast to northwest. Dead trees, charred to short stumps, form a dismal grove to one side of the pathway. Up among the barren mounds of ash and cinders, something dislodges a small shower of stones that clatter loudly in the silent air. A startled bird rises in uneven flight from behind a row of boulders, screeching its outrage and terror at being disturbed.

node.name: Northwest Road, Volcanic Hills
node.description: The road goes ever on, running northwest to southeast along the ragged shoulders of some black hills. Erratic winds sweep down from their bare crests, bringing with them a constant irritation by means of minute particles of sand and grit and dust. It gets in your mouth and you spit out a foul, bitter taste. To one side a ruined cart lies abandoned and stripped of everything useful.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Broken Hills
node.description: Cracked boulders, segments of large stones, and small pebbles compose the hills that rise up to either side of you, jealously guarding the path from the light of the stars and moons. The hills gradually become larger as they march northward, growing into glassy, black volcanic hills that all but vanish into the night.

Cracked boulders, segments of large stones, and small pebbles compose the hills that rise up to either side of you, jealously guarding the path from the light of the sun. The hills gradually become larger as they march northward, growing into glassy, black volcanic hills.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Broken Hills
node.description: The hills to either side are made of the broken remains of rock and debris. You think you hear the skittering of creatures moving amongst them, but when you look up all you see is a tattered leaf being pushed along by the wind. To the south the hills gradually turn into cones of ash and cinder, while to the north they continue on.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Cinder Cones
node.description: The cinder cones crowd in uncomfortably close on either side, their shadows throwing eerie shapes across your path. A fine layer of ash drifts down about you, tickling your nose with its unusually acrid scent.

The shadows of the cinder cones fall down around you, their massive forms blocking the light at any time of the day. A fine layer of ash drifts down about you, tickling your nose with its unusually acrid scent.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Cinder Cones
node.description: To the left and right rise massive cinder cones, the creations of the wind-born fires of Dirge. Clouds of ash stir with every step you take, and you realize that much of what you mistook for hillocks are actually trees and stones so covered with the choking ash that they are nearly unrecognizable.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Burned Forest
node.description: The blackened forms of trees rise up from the cracked earth like skeletons whose feet grew roots. A scrap of cloth, tied to one of the trees, flutters in a cold wind, grey from years of exposure.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Burned Forest
node.description: The scorched remains of trees stand all about you, clawing at the stars as if in complaint of the injustice done to them. A chill wind winds around you and wails through the branches, sounding for all the world like the ghost of a sobbing child wandering, lost, through the night.

The scorched remains of trees stand all about you, their limbs clawing at the sky as if in complaint of the injustice done to them. A chill wind wraps around you and wails through the branches, sounding for all the world like the ghost of a sobbing child wandering, lost, through the dreary grove.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wastelands
node.description: The lone call of a bird startles you, its cry sounding much like a helpless scream of rage and sadness. A fine layer of black dust coats every object or creature that lingers too long here, and toward the north you notice the beginnings of a blackened forest.

The lone call of a bird breaks the stillness, its cry sounding much like a helpless scream of rage and sadness. A fine layer of black dust coats everything that lingers too long here, and toward the north, the beginnings of a blackened forest emerge.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wastelands
node.description: Blackened rocks and sandy soil that will never yield crops or flowers unfolds around you, encroaching like a spreading disease all the way to the horizon. Overhead the sky is black, the celestial light filtered by a heavy haze that turns the clean light into a sickly parody of purity.

Blackened rocks and sandy soil that will never yield crops or flowers unfolds around you, encroaching like a spreading disease all the way to the horizon. Overhead the sky is thick with a heavy yellow haze that turns the daylight into a sickly parody of illumination.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wastelands
node.description: Something has scoured this place of all life, or a harsh god created it with no life at all. The rocks are oddly smooth and darker than normal agate and granite. Nothing moves, no birds, no insects, no weeds or wind. Having looked upon this land, you can easily imagine where evil souls go to when they depart this world.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wastelands
node.description: The land lies blasted, the earth revealed in forlorn despair about you. Silence walks through here freely, accompanied in its journey only by the occasional click of a stone moving.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Stony Plains
node.description: An odd sight awaits you here: a single sirese flower, out of place and struggling to live, growing within the shade of a twisted wiir tree. The tiny plant seems to be surviving on raw defiance alone.
An odd sight awaits you here: a single sirese flower, out of place and struggling to live, growing within the shade of a twisted wiir tree. The tiny plant seems to be surviving on raw defiance alone.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Stony Plains
node.description: The ground is hard and unyielding underfoot, and the moonlight causes the stones to cast eerie shadows you don't like to think about. Out of the corner of your eye you think you see something move, but when you turn to look, there is nothing there.

The ground is hard and unyielding underfoot. The massive cracked boulders of this bare land challenge the sky as they thrust upward toward heaven. A wind sweeps by every now and then, but all it does is stir up a few dustdevils whose only purpose is to remind you of how thirsty you are.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Stony Plains
node.description: Cracked boulders, gravel, and bare earth stretch about you, endlessly gray and grim. Here and there brittle grasses struggle vainly to peek up, only to be choked by the uncaring stone. To the south a dark forest blots the horizon.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Forest
node.description: Moss dangles down from stunted, ill-looking trees, lending the impression that they are weeping. The grass is dry and brittle beneath your feet, and the forest is still and silent, as if in mourning.

node.name: Lava Fields, Narrow Trace
node.description: Close by, a primitive pathway has been scratched out of the hard rock and basalt to the east, where it wanders into grey shadows of dust and floating ash. A narrow road lies between high boulders in the other direction. Faint marks etched into the coarse dark stone point towards the path and away from the caravan road.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Gateway
node.description: Tall untrimmed hedges of bramble and myrtle grow on either side of an oak-bough gateway. A neatly carved sign is mounted near the top of the gate's arch. Tufts of dried brownish grasses poke out in random clumps along the otherwise barren ground.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: The evening sky draws her cloak over the rocky path, iridescent bits of cooled lava glittering like stars caught in the earth. Tiny motes of dust swirl as mottled light from the sky catches them in mid-air.

Dried lava lines the roadside, the ground beneath your feet speckled with iridescent flakes of the cooled molten rock. The dusky stone winds northwest to a distant volcano, and eastward back to the main road.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Atop Gateway
node.description: From atop this arched portal, a dry field of ash and smoke, where verdant lands once lay, is all that is visible. Except for signs in the dusty ground that someone has climbed down the gateway recently, a search for traces of life yields nothing. Nearby, a pillar of thick, ash-filled smoke from a fumarole climbs into the air. Waves of intense heat radiate from the active vent.

node.name: Sicle Grove, West from Fumarole
node.description: Thick layers of ash paint the surrounding landscape in a palette of shades of gray. Each footstep sends a cloud of dust into the air and obscures the already limited view of the lifeless terrain. From the east, waves of intense heat radiate from the smoking vent as it belches forth black, noxious gases. Towards the north and northeast, rectangular earthen mounds stand out on the otherwise featureless plain.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Low Rise
node.description: As you wander around, the loose ash crunches as it engulfs footprints, leaving almost no visible traces of your passing. A dry, hot breeze picks up bits of ash and dances with them in small, dusty whirlwinds. From this vantage point, other mounds can be seen on the other side of the smoky plume of the fumarole to the east.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Low Rise
node.description: The grade of the rise levels out, but walking does not get easier as your feet sink into the thick layer of volcanic dust. Small whirlwinds dart about and trace sweeping arcs in the loose ash, giving the bleak landscape an eery artistic quality.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Low Rise
node.description: A large depression in the ash occupies most of the area. Walking around its rim causes the surrounding cinders to shift towards the pit's center with a low hissing sound. From the funnel-shaped hole's size, you do not believe it was dug by hand, but rather is a sinkhole resulting from the cave-in of an underground cavity.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Low Rise
node.description: Each footstep falls silently and sinks into the layers of dust and ash that have settled in this area. On the western horizon, smoke-shrouded mountains, the twin volcanos called the Fists of Heaven, dominate the landscape.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Low Rise
node.description: Dust clouds the air and casts ominous shadows against the distant horizon. The ash-filled terrain continues, but nearby, a heavy wooden beam stands out in the otherwise monotonous, gray landscape.

node.name: Sicle Grove, North of Fumarole
node.description: A slight breeze from the south carries the black exhaust of the fumarole through this area, making the air hot and heavily tainted with sulphurous fumes. This stifling mixture makes breathing difficult and all but eliminates visibility. Ash from the vent's plume settles to the ground in deep layers and forces one to take careful steps to keep from falling in the loose material.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Northeast of Fumarole
node.description: While the air is warm by its proximity to the smoking fumarole, it is made warmer still by the the heat coming from a glowing fissure that cuts through the area. The ground gives slightly as you explore, but is otherwise stable. A low mound with a small shack standing on it lies towards the east.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Low Mound
node.description: Smoke drifts in on hot gusts of air smelling of sulphur and burnt wood. Steadily-falling ash blankets the area in a constant attempt to bury the landscape and a small shack in its grey embrace. A faint footpath leads upwards.

node.name: Sicle Grove, Dusty Mound
node.description: Dust and ash hang heavily in the air and limit the distance one can see. A solitary brickwork chimney rises above the level of the loose ash and is the only notable feature on this mound. Its size indicates that whatever lies below is more than a simple dwelling.

node.name: Cookhouse, Kitchen
node.description: Silence strangely pervades this normally busy room. Whomever was here has left everything behind. Soup pots sit quietly upon a cold brick hearth and piles of chopped vegetables and herbs lay dried out and discolored on an oak table. A putrid smell fills the air. Most of the effluvium comes from a cast iron stewpot whose contents has scummed over with a foamy, brownish-red crust.

node.name: Cookhouse, Common Room
node.description: Smoke fills the air, not enough to stifle one's breath but enough to cast ominous shadows. Tables, usually filled with hungry patrons, lay in smoldering pieces. The hearth's mantel is burned through its middle as if the flame had escaped its brick confines. The walls are discolored by scorching save for a spot along one wall where the wood grain still shows through. The damage done to the room seems to have removed all of Penelope Burrows' touches that made this a cheerful place to eat.

node.name: The Shelter, Consultation Area
node.description: A gaping hole in the ceiling, the result of a heavy, wooden beam falling, lets in a stream of dust which blankets the room. A cushioned bench lies snapped in two after taking the brunt of the fallen ceiling rafter, while several others lay scattered about by the impact. Glass cases, formerly attached to the wooden walls, rest in shattered heaps.

node.name: The Shelter, Supply Nook
node.description: This small storage closet seems to have survived the disaster better than the rest of the building. Except for a few jars broken on the ground, the remaining jars of herbal remedies and boxes of bandages are still somewhat in order on narrow wooden shelves. Lard candles and sprigs of dried coneflowers remain hanging from a peg rail. Fresh globs of wax upon the floor prove someone was here recently and perhaps even took shelter in this room.

node.name: The Shelter, Dayroom
node.description: Gloomy silence fills this place where patients would wait for healing from the empath Timothy. Decorative blue glazed globes lay in shattered heaps, their contents of willows branches and daylilies trampled and wilted. A potbelly stove lies prone with large rents in its sides as though something held inside had forceably escaped. Several needlework hangings covering the rough wooden walls remain in place but are now marred by singeing, their designs obscured.

node.name: The Shelter, Recovery Room
node.description: Where once divided into separate alcoves by curtained walls, the whole area is now a single room, the curtains in tatters. The beds lie upturned. Several have their batting ripped out and another is stained with blood. A colorful patchwork quilt, hanging from an overhead beam, strangely remains untouched amidst the rest of the damage.

node.name: The Shelter, Children's Wing
node.description: Stopped at the entrance to the wing by a wall of debris from the cave-in of the ceiling, there is no way to proceed further into this wing. Even with careful listening, no cries or other sounds can be heard from within. A stuffed animal with a pale, motionless arm wrapped around it is barely visible but out of reach deep within the rubble.

node.name: Under Watchtower, Tunnel
node.description: Supported by rotting timbers, this dank tunnel cuts through the earth to the east. A small ladder, in surprisingly good shape, leans against the wall. At the back wall of the passage, nearly hidden in the shadowed darkness is the statue of a thin raven.

node.name: Escape Tunnel
node.description: The packed earth that surrounds the tunnel is relatively dry, but a cold chill still runs through the dark passage. Occasional bits of dirt and chips of timber support fall to the tunnel floor.

node.name: Escape Tunnel
node.description: The tunnel tightens a bit here, enough to give even the non-claustrophobic a cold sweat and sudden shiver. The path opens a slightly to the west and levels off, while it drops towards the southeast. The walls of this cramped space abruptly turn from stone to dirt here, which would have definitely made the digging easier for whomever built this passageway.

node.name: Escape Tunnel
node.description: Sporadic drops of water fall from the stone ceiling. A damp coldness permeates the passage, but a faint light glows to the east, and perhaps warmth.

node.name: Under Oasis, Tunnel
node.description: Bored through the granite, this tunnel has been handworked - not a natural occurrence. Its entrance hidden behind the wild growth at the oasis suggests that its maker did not want it to be found.

node.name: North Road, Oasis
node.description: Within the crevice is a green oasis, hidden below the barren plains above you. Water trickles from a spring in the gully's face, collecting in a series of crystal pools in the rock. Reeds and a few small trees grow up around the water's edge and rustle in the cool moist breeze. An old firepit built in the shade of the overhanging granite walls shows that you are not the first to seek shelter in this small paradise.

node.name: Blackened Hills, Barren Path
node.description: A faint ruddy glow lights the scape with a bloody aura. Despite the night air, the wind that blows around you is warm and almost balmy. Layers of shadow cover the ground, stripping it of life and leaving for the blasted earth's only inhabitants the dried out, brittle stalks of what once were plants.

A thin top layer of sifted black and russet brown soil covers the earth, sterile and void of life. Withered remains of what once were plants litter the ground, and browned stalks of lifeless weeds protrude from the wasted earth, casting long, harsh shadows.

node.name: Blackened Hills, Barren Path
node.description: A shadowy black lump of a hill broods on the horizon, like coal waiting in a child's Midwinter Day stocking. A sere and scorching wind entangles itself with the air, parching your lungs and reminding you just how thirsty you are.

node.name: Blackened Hills, Barren Path
node.description: Scattered ashes and mounds of unidentifiable burnt paraphernalia lie scattered around the path which, oddly, appears to be swept clean. Heat comes up in waves off the ground, causing the air to shimmer.

node.name: Blackened Hills, Barren Path
node.description: A looming hill rises to the north, its shadow falling heavily over you. Covered in ashes that look as fine and thick as a new layer of snow, a deep channel of lava carves its way down one side of the hill, finally vanishing behind a steep embankment.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Blasted Path
node.description: A hill rises to the east, covered in ash and casting a long shadow over everything. Blasted skeletal structures are all that remain of a handful of small homes that crouch against the hill and beside the road as if they were waiting in ambush. Broken bones lie scattered within the empty homes, silently relaying the unspeakable.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Blasted Path
node.description: The path gradually rises to the northeast, sloping upward as it winds around a flat-topped hill. Smooth waves of hardened lava lash out amongst shadowy remains, the basalt shining glassily against the backdrop of night.

The path gradually rises to the northeast, sloping upward as it winds around an ash-coated flat-topped hill. Smooth waves of hardened lava lash out amongst the ruins of what once were buildings, the basalt glittering coarsely in the sunlight.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Blasted Path
node.description: A warm breeze blows dust off the blasted path that skirts the hill, tingling the flesh and parching the lungs. Silence pervades all around, and here and there the trail is marked by runnels of frozen black that can only be old lava flows that hardened into basalt.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Winding Path
node.description: The path slopes upward to the southeast and winds gradually downward as it heads around a bend to the west. Slick rivers of glassy black stripe the hill, darkening the path in a glittering runoff of cooled lava. A sulfrous tang spikes the air, tracing the inside of your mouth with a metallic flavor.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Winding Path
node.description: The path steepens sharply as it climbs the hill, eventually vanishing from sight as it dips over the flat summit. Slick smears of obsidian basalt make walking difficult, causing the path to become as treacherous as any ice-bound slope.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Winding Path
node.description: The path is almost totally consumed by black basalt, making climbing it a horrendous task. Waves of frozen lava slip over the sharp lip of the flattened hilltop, creating waterfall structures that give little purchase and would be much more dangerous to clamber over if the slope were any steeper.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Blasted Hilltop
node.description: A desolate scape of scorched shadows and piles of wreckage rolls out around you. Flattened by forces at present unseen, everything is lit by an eerie, demonic red light the color of blood. Remains of houses lie in restless piles amongst pools of frozen lava, skeletons of the former village of Crook.

A desolate scape of shattered ruins scorched and covered in a thick layer of ashes rolls out all around you. Flattened by forces at present unseen, a pale ruddy glow flows up through cracks in the hilltop, filling the air with a demonic light. Wrecks of houses rest in peace amongst pools of frozen lava, skeletons of the former village of Crook.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Blasted Hilltop
node.description: The flat ground is covered in a thick layer of glass that would be hard to maneuver over were it not for the ashes that cover it, supplying purchase to an otherwise frictionless surface. A vast view of the lands to the east spreads out before you, unfurled like a map.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Gate of Souls
node.description: Rising in a snubbed tower, the collapsed hill that broods in the center of Skeleton's Crook hilltop is covered in black basalt. A strong ruddy light seeps from the arterial cracks breaking the mound's surface, each line connecting to one or the other until they form an arch-like pattern reminiscent of a doorway on the hill's north-facing side.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Ruins
node.description: A small circle of skeletal buildings are all that remains of the tiny village of Crook. Blackened wooden beams now dig their foundations into a thick layer of cooled basalt and scorched earth, and the eyesockets of the skulls of those who did not escape the agony of the lava eruption stare blindly up at you. Toward the west rises a second hill, gleaming dully with the everpresent ruddy glow of the shattered landscape.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Ruins
node.description: The hill slopes down toward the southwest, too treacherous and glassy-slick to dare without risking breaking a few bones. Fine clouds of ashes rise up around you when you walk, filling your nostrils with grit and the stench of death. A steep channel of lava pushes its way down off the side of the hill, dusted with just enough grit to afford some moderate purchase.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Ruins
node.description: The hard black glass that covers the surface of the earth is cracked in several places, releasing a faint red glow that spills out and up, creating a hazy veil of blood-colored mist. A black hill rises to the east, a cancerous lump waiting to be excised.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Blasted Hilltop
node.description: The blasted remains of homes and their denizens lie scattered about you. Composed of cinder and ash, the path of the lava can be clearly followed as it swept over the helpless villagers, incinerating them instantly and capturing what remained in rigid black glass.

node.name: Skeleton's Crook, Ruins
node.description: A hazy red nimbus lights the horizon in a pale glow. Emanating from a small black hill that flows up to the northwest, the light is steady and slightly evil looking. A slick lava channel carves its way down the hillside to the southwest, looking just coarse enough to make it difficult but not necessarily dangerous climbing.

node.name: Hill Slope, Lava Channel
node.description: Walls and floors of solid, glittering basalt rise and fall around you, creating the sense that one is walking on a completely still lake of pure liquid black. The sides sweep up to the northeast and northwest in treacherous channels that look as if they would be harder to climb were it not for the fact that they were dusted in a fine layer of grit that lends friction to their surface.

node.name: Hill Slope, Lava Channel
node.description: Roughly halfway between the top and bottom of Skeleton's Crook hill, this steep channel is made even more treacherous by the thick coating of hardened black glass that covers the ground and walls. Large bubbles of cooled lava burst up to the surface in places, and a few are shattered, revealing fragments of razor sharp basalt.

node.name: Lava Channel, Basin
node.description: Roughly halfway between the top and bottom of Skeleton's Crook hill, this steep channel is made even more treacherous by the thick coating of hardened black glass that covers the ground and walls. Large bubbles of cooled lava have burst up to the surface in places, and a few are shattered, revealing fragments of razor sharp basalt.

node.name: Faldesu River, South Bank
node.description: A high, rocky bank supports the remains of a large stone bridge which once spanned the river. From across the wide river the sounds of Riverhaven carry. Further to the east, the swift waters slow near the tall reeds of an encroaching marsh.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Outhouse
node.description: Only the cold dry air prevents this tiny outhouse from being unusable. Set over a simple open pit that slopes away down a steep hill, it offers nothing in the way of comfort or decency. The seat is merely a rough plank swung across the noisome space above the refuse. Spider webs hang thickly from the joists overhead waiting for the many flies that buzz about the squalid shack.

node.name: The Noble's Barn, Central Walkway
node.description: The large double doors of the barn have been removed and lead into a cobbled walkway between two lines of shops, the walkway opening to the road on one side of the structure and a whitewashed carriage house on the other. Seasoned cedar vaults the roof supporting the building, the only evidence remaining of its previous life housing animals instead of the merchants who once owned them.

node.name: The Noble's Barn, Quaint Exteriors for Posh Cabins
node.description: Wood and stone samples line the cedar panel walls. Behind an open counter piled with plain, hand-sized house models is a courteous Halfling standing on a sturdy wooden stool, greeting everyone who enters while seeing to the various needs of his customers.

node.name: The Carriage House, Handcrafted Cases
node.description: Gentle breezes drift through the large open windows that cross the wide room. The sound of footsteps echoes in the air as customers and the shopkeepers walk upon the plank pine flooring, bare and unpolished in appearance. Displays of weapon racks, armor racks and cases cater to those in the market for home interiors.

node.name: The Noble's Barn, Exquisite Interiors
node.description: Wall and floor samples line the outer edge of the shop. Across the length of a beautiful riverstone floor, partially covered by an elegant ivory rug with platinum-banded tassels, is a plain oak desk filled with work orders.

node.name: The Carriage House, Loft, Elite Additions
node.description: Lamps hanging from the ceiling light up the small loft, pouring wan light onto the lovely merchandise offered.

node.name: The Noble's Barn, Fanciful Fireplaces
node.description: The floor has been lined with riverstone concrete and the walls covered with brick, creating the feeling of stepping inside the hearth of a fireplace. A tickling hickory smell lingers in the room in an attempt to fill the customers with thoughts of cozy, comfortable moments beside a flickering fire.

node.name: The Noble's Barn, Fit for Royalty Furniture
node.description: Pristine marble floors with handwoven burgundy runners accent the fine furniture displayed around this corner of the barn. Heavy velvet drapes line the windows preventing any light from getting in so as not to fade the lovely floor models. Instead, a dozen standing candelabras, situated to bring out the color in the show items, light the room to a soft white glow.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Rocky Indentation
node.description: Neverending shadow looms at the base of the mountain where a small area has been cleared of vegetation and debris. Under a small overhang next to a smoothed wall of the mountain stands an armed and burly Dwarf, leaning casually against the side of the mountain and eyeing everyone who approaches him.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Barn
node.description: Wooden slats overhead provide a minute hayloft to store what little excess the barren lands here can offer. While you have seen grander edifices, this is at least dry and clean and out of the weather.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Hayloft
node.description: A series of planks have been laid across the stone walls of the lower stalls to form a cramped hayloft. The sweet smell of the hay clashes with the ever present sulfur dust as well as the odor of manure piled somewhere below. It looks as if someone has slept here of late, perhaps to avoid the tariff at the inn or simply to escape notice.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Stableyard
node.description: The outdoor section of the stables is nothing more than a level patch of bare ground roughly fenced off with stonework augmented with a few warped and burned wooden planks. Several dispirited horses wander about cropping at the few tufts of grass that can find root. A feed trough holds the remnants of some hay as well and there is a good supply of water. A wooden gate leads into the stable itself.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Stables
node.description: This is a low stone building holding half a dozen or so stalls used by individual travellers who can pay to have accommodations for their mounts. There is no sign of recent use and you wonder when the last lone traveller might have come by. A roofless stone-walled pen juts out from one side of the building.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Clean Stall
node.description: This clean stall in the far corner of the stable has been converted into a small office with an old sturdy desk and fresh hay on the floor. Painted red hinges mark where the stall door once was, and on the walls are amateur paintings of open pastures filled with colts and their mares.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Stable Pen
node.description: This is a stone-walled pen meant to hold a caravan's camels apart from the horses, The ground is dusty with dried manure that rises in clouds as you move. An old watering trough sits at one end with a few inches of dirty liquid still in it. There was once a slatted roof overhead for shade but the wooden slats have long since been taken for other uses.

node.name: North Roads Caravansary, Furrier
node.description: The stench of untreated furs drenches the outpost, coming from the strings of pelts that dangle against the walls on strips of rope. Sitting on the dirt floor is a heavy counter, piled up with odds and ends of every type of animal imaginable.

node.name: North Roads Inn, Foyer
node.description: A tiny foyer leads from the entrance into the common room. To one side, a small counter serves as front desk and, apparently, dry goods storage. A steep stairway ascends to the upper story where the sleeping facilites are. Under the stair, a narrow door leads into the back room of the inn. The foyer is bare and long in need of paint but, in this wild land, it seems almost cheerful.

node.name: North Roads Inn, Common Room
node.description: The main room is almost cheery and cozy after the grim atmosphere of the surrounding areas. A small fire, carefully tended, dispels the worst of the chill and sheepskins cover several wooden benches to give a modicum of comfort. A stone table awaits the next meal and the air is full of the smell of roasting goat. The proprietor, a sour-looking Dwarf, makes a show of disdain, though he seems most surprised to actually have guests and bustles about, brushing off the worst of the dust from the seats.

node.name: North Roads Inn, Alcove
node.description: This narrow room, almost an alcove off the common room, is meant for those requiring a quieter spot to converse. Given the overall lack of noise, you must assume there was once a time when the inn was a tad livelier. An uneven table of crudely shaped stone and a rickety wooden bench provide some small comfort.

node.name: North Roads Inn, Upper Floor
node.description: Much of the upper floor is one open room. A line of bunks provides a place to sleep and a tiny iron stove gives off a feeble heat. One small area has been partitioned off to allow a bit of privacy for those caring to pay the higher fee. A small washstand with a cistern and some rough towels are the only other amenities besides a pair of slightly better beds.

node.name: North Roads Inn, Private Room
node.description: This small room is minimally furnished. A window is covered with a panel of thick, oiled leather. A wide but thin mattress stuffed with fresh straw is supported by a few leather straps from the rafters overhead so that it sways and rocks to a gentle touch. An iron tripod supports a small brazier that has some coals burning in it to remove the worst of the chill from the room at the cost of a thin deposit of soot everywhere.

node.name: Before the Gate of Souls
node.description: Coarse black grit blows in swirling eddies around the mouth of the cavern, stinging the eyes and clogging the throat. The ruddy glow of the lava field beyond lends a surreal quality to the rock walls around you, playing off the glistening edges of basalt shards. Once, a river of lava flowed northwards through the passage. Now, time and erosion have left just enough room to squeeze through the tunnel known to locals as the Gate of Souls.

node.name: Beyond the Gate of Souls, Blasted Plain
node.description: The landscape shimmers as heat rises from parched soil. In deserts or in grassland, the effect is usually caused by the sun baking the earth, but here, glowing streams of lava flow slowly across the blasted plain, gradually cooling and forming mounds of pumice, only to branch off into a new path. Travel is difficult as it is frequently impossible to retrace your steps in the harsh environment.

node.name: Beyond the Gate of Souls, Blasted Plain
node.description: The earth rumbles underfoot as tremors ripple through the arid soil. Over time, old fissures, worn by the elements, close and new ones open, releasing the restless pressure of the lava to flow in shifting red-gold streams across the plain. Hot as an inferno during the day, night offers no relief from the hammer blows of heat pounding against skin and scale alike.

node.name: Beyond the Gate of Souls, Blasted Plain
node.description: Waves of heat blast against skin and scale, fur and flesh, sapping energy and dulling senses with its constant hammering. Around you, glowing threads of lava criss-cross the parched plain, slowly cooling to a dull black in some places, only to break free in others. The paths that skirt the molten rock are forever shifting in response.

node.name: Beyond the Gate of Souls, Blasted Plain
node.description: Waves of heat blast against skin and scale, fur and flesh, sapping energy and dulling senses with its constant hammering. Around you, glowing threads of lava criss-cross the parched plain, slowly cooling to a dull black in some places, only to break free in others. The paths that skirt the molten rock are forever shifting in response.

node.name: Before the Temple of Ushnish
node.description: Stable is a relative term, as the ground beneath your feet quivers with tiny tremors deep within the earth. Yet the lava is held in abeyance beyond the tumbled walls which surround the sandstone temple. Tall columns in the shape of rearing vipers support the roof, but the massive tiles of the floor are cracked by years of neglect and dizzying vapors rise to swirl around you.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Northern Colonnade
node.description: Concentric rows of columns support the carved sandstone pediment of the Temple of Ushnish. Oval in shape, the building features carved images of gold and scarlet vipers twisting in an intricate knotwork pattern at the base of the columns around the entry. The massive bronze doors have been knocked askew by the earth's fretful motion, leaving just enough room to slip past the guardian statues poised on either side.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Northern Entry Hall
node.description: Flaking patches of paint and plaster fall from the murals adorning the temple's once-grand entry, gathering in little piles along the base of the sandstone walls. The stone is warm to the touch, though still cooler than the searing heat that marks the blasted plane outside.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Library
node.description: Charred wooden boards lean against each other at odd angles, supporting the ashen remains of scrolls and books. Nothing remains now save a few scraps of leather binding or metal scrollcaps, twisted and deformed by heat. A wrought iron lantern sways at the end of a fallen pole in the midst of the wreckage.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Common Room
node.description: Searing skin and scale alike, a vague breath of air moves ponderously about the room, nudging feathers fallen from torn silk cushions and briefly swirling piles of dust before moving on. Once upon a time, this must have been a pleasant room with high golden sandstone walls and wide windows. Now, all lies abandoned to the elements.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Infirmary
node.description: Low cots, just high enough for easy cleaning, rest on the bare sandstone floor. High ceilings allow heat to rise which, combined with the once water-filled urns mounted between each bed, would have kept the air near the patients at a comfortable temperature despite the baking temperatures outside. The wide shuttered windows provide ventilation as well as a view of the dried vines clinging to the walls of the temple.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Healer's Chambers
node.description: An outstretched hand holding a wreath of healing herbs is picked out in the stained glass window of the Healer's quarters. Some of the glass fragments have fallen, allowing gentle beams of moonlight to illuminate a workbench that remains relatively free of the clouds of dust which mark the rest of the temple.

An outstretched hand holding a wreath of healing herbs is picked out in the stained glass window of the Healer's quarters. Some of the glass fragments have fallen, allowing bright rays of sunlight to pour through the window and illuminate a workbench that remains relatively free of the clouds of dust which mark the rest of the temple.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Meditation Chamber
node.description: Dried reeds bound by once-bright blue cords cover the floor of the chamber, trapping dust and grit between the ridges. A few gnawed scraps of prayer rugs or cushions are visible near a central table on which rests a red glass lamp etched with a knotwork design of serpents against a backdrop of flames.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Monk's Quarters
node.description: High arched ceilings and sandstone walls keep the sleeping quarters cool in the hot climate. Little remains to give clues to the personalities of the residents - a carved serpent pendant fallen from a broken leather thong, mounds of anonymous robes heaped upon the foot of one of the beds. The cloth is tattered by the ravages of mice and insects.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Novice's Quarters
node.description: Moonlight streams through a broken skylight. Birds have made their nests in the rafters of the dormitory, leaving behind the mute evidence of their presence. White blotches mar the cots and the pinkish-gold sandstone floors, while piles of cracked bones tangled with rodent skins and a few stray feathers litter the corners of the room.

Sunlight streams through a broken skylight. Birds have made their nests in the rafters of the dormitory, leaving behind the mute evidence of their presence. White blotches mar the cots and the pinkish-gold sandstone floors, while piles of small bones tangled with rodent skins and a few stray feathers litter the corners of the room.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Chamber of Serpents
node.description: Away from the massive bronze doors at the north end of the once ornately decorated hall, the air cools slightly, making each breath somewhat less of a burden. Intricately carved knotwork borders painted in shades of crimson and vermilion form abstract images of serpents and lava along the base of the walls. The tessellated floor tiles have been pushed up at irregular intervals by the restless movement of Ushnish's wrath.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Scriptorium
node.description: Worm-eaten wooden tables lie in splintered ruins scattered about the remains of the Temple's scriptorium. Faint remains of ink stains are still visible in the wood, as is an occasional shattered clay inkpot left behind when the priests were unable to appease the wrath of Ushnish. Sooty streaks mar the ceiling and wall over the eastern door, but the fire seems to have left this room mostly untouched.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Anteroom
node.description: Toppled benches, cracked and splintered by the heat, line the walls of the empty chamber where once visitors waited to consult the famed oracle of Ushnish. Tall terra cotta urns stand sentry on either side of a passage to the southeast, their gold leaf accents peeling away from the graceful pottery curves.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Western Hall
node.description: In times past, temple maidens clad in filmy gowns tended the serpents of the god. Murals along the outer curve of the hallway depict them offering up meals on gilded platters, or dancers weaving their way along a snake-covered floor. The theme is echoed in the hall's floor, where tessellated serpents intertwine in uneven sandstone tiles.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Western Hall
node.description: The murals in this part of the hallway depicts the rituals of appeasement, from offerings of the harvest to the sacrifice of mortals to the gaping maw of the volcano in attempts to turn aside the wrath of Ushnish. While the offerings were accepted, given the shifting lava fields surrounding the temple grounds they were not necessarily acceptable.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Anteroom
node.description: A single uncomfortable-looking bench remains in the anteroom of the High Priestess' office. Baked by long exposure to the hot dry air, the wood is splintered and rough. A faint, lingering fragrance drifts from the broken shards of a pierced terra cotta incense holder.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Guest Hall
node.description: Lumpy straw mattresses line the floor, once the communal bedding for wayfarers spending the night at the temple, now merely a tattered nesting place for mice and small lizards. A few wisps of frayed straw float through the air from time to time to gather in dusty piles along the corners.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Dining Hall
node.description: Mounds of melted wax lie twisted into deformed puddles atop the baked oak surface of a refractory table. One of several, judging by the worm-eaten fragments of wood chips along the floor, this is the only one to survive the years since the temple's abandonment. Oddly enough, half a dozen three-fingered handprints are branded deeply into the wood.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Kitchens
node.description: Mice and other rodents have long-since devoured any remains of food stored in the pantry, leaving behind only the scattered remains of bones and a few tufts of fur. An iron cauldron sways from a swinging metal bracket over the open fire pit. Though hinges creak with each movement, the metal shows no trace of rust in the hot dry air.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Oracle's Chamber
node.description: Dizzying vapors rise from vents in the floor to swirl about the ceiling. Rough carved sandstone and a low roof give the room an oppressive air of closeness, as if the earth enveloped those who sought the wisdom of the god. The only illumination is a sullenly glowing basalt cone jutting up from the floor, surrounded by blood-streaked offerings.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, High Priest's Chamber
node.description: Unlike the sandstone walls of the rest of the temple, the High Priest's chamber has been plastered and painted a deep shade of red. Darker rectangles along the walls mark the spots where once paintings would have hung. Most of the furniture has been removed, either by the priests or by looters after the abandonment of the temple, but a single prayer lamp still sways from the ceiling.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Central Altar
node.description: The central altar is austere, lacking the carvings found in other areas of the temple. No vipers coil along the sandstone walls, no elaborate paintings adorn the chamber. All attention is focused upon an upthrust slab of polished black basalt veined with a natural serpentine pattern of deep green olivine.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Southern Hall
node.description: A hot, dry breeze from the south stirs up whorls of gritty dust that spiral about in dense clouds before subsiding. Thin layers of grey-white powder coat the walls and obscure the vibrant colors of the murals beneath. Elusive hints of sandalwood perfume the air, though the source of the fragrance is not apparent.

node.name: Temple of Ushnish, Southern Colonnade
node.description: Twisted fragments of bronze hinges cling to one side of the sandstone doorframe, though the door itself lies in ash-covered splendor upon the floor. Crumbling columns continue to support the roof over the wide colonnade, though each shifting movement of the earth renders that support more dubious.

node.name: The Fangs of Ushnish, Lava Field
node.description: Jagged shards of obsidian thrust up from the parched earth at odd angles, formed by the shifting lava flows. Faint hints of olivine streak the glassy surface. The sharp edges and poisonous green color give rise to the local name for this area, the Fangs of Ushnish. As lava cools, it hardens, only to break out again in another location. The path through the field is never constant as nature's wrath, or that of the god, makes itself known in molten rock.

node.name: North Road, Caravansary
node.description: A sprawling ranch-style house sits nestled beneath the boughs of a grove of tall old oaks. The smell of fresh baking wafts invitingly from its open door. Beside the house lies a small, carefully tended garden, with vegetables and herbs lined up in neat rows around an old stone well. The sound of whinnying horses rings out from the broad doors of a red painted barn to the east.

node.name: Caravansary, Barn
node.description: A long stone trough runs along the center of the barn, between two rails for hitching horses and camels. Light slanting through the wood slat roof falls in shining pinstripes on the neat dirt floor and glistens off the hay stacked in feeders along the walls.

node.name: Caravansary, Workshop
node.description: A small sign on the door bids you welcome as you enter Dokker's workshop and trading post. The scent of freshly tanned leather hangs in the air like musty perfume. The walls are hung with racks of finely crafted backpacks, belts and pouches, and the floor is covered with crates of hides and boxes of trade goods. A catalog sits atop a cluttered workbench.

node.name: Caravansary, Common Room
node.description: Light from a grey stone fireplace glistens off rows of copper pots and pans hanging from the whitewashed walls of the large common room. Piles of clean warm furs lie stacked in the open area before the fire, where tired travellers may lay down for a good nights sleep. Long wooden tables with benches alongside await the hungry guest, and the promise of delicious food and refreshing drink drifts through the air from the swinging kitchen door.

node.name: Greater Fist Footpath, Large Boulder
node.description: Cinders, ash, and mud mixed with rocky debris have collected at the base of the footpath. Once past the mounds littering the trail, the path continues towards the summit of the volcano, twisting amid the cooling flows and ruined vegetation.

node.name: Burrows Dwelling, Sleeping Loft
