node.description: This dusty loft overlooks a main room. A wooden cupboard bed, built into one corner, remains the upright item in this room. A writing desk and bow-backed chair lay overturned across the room. Some rag rugs, formerly covering the bare planks of the floor, lay heaped in a single pile in the corner. A bloody stain on the floor indicates that someone was grievously injured but there are no signs as to who was hurt.

node.name: Burrows Dwelling, Main Room
node.description: Normally this would be a quiet place to rest after a long day of work but now all is in disarray. Hand-carved toys, laying on the dust-covered floor, tell of a hasty departure. A crushed rocking chair and fragments of yellow earthenware lay beneath an upturned wooden cupboard. Gusts of wind coming down the hearth's flue stir clouds of dust into the hazy air. A closed, wooden door bows inward, as though under a strain and shows signs of charring around the edges of its jamb.

node.name: Dismal Grove, Paper Mill
node.description: Surrounded by boulders and jagged rocks, a small wooden paper mill sits in the center of the circle of dead poplars, appearing to be relatively newly built. Several younger trees near the building struggle valiantly against the harsh environment, providing patches of green that sharply contrast the barren landscape.

node.name: Paper Mill, Entrance
node.description: The paper mill's high walls are crafted from planks of untreated wood, held together with bare nails in even rows. Wooden beams hold up the high ceiling, and sawdust is scattered over the dirt floor. The building has an unfinished air about it, as if aesthetics were sacrificed solely for function.

node.name: Paper Mill, Narrow Hallway
node.description: The smell of sawdust hangs heavily in the air, and a fine wooden powder covers everything. A boarded-up window on the western wall lets in light through a few cracks, and motes of dust float lazily through the air. An eerie silence hangs over the mill, punctuated occasionally by the sound of rustling paper.

The smell of sawdust hangs heavily in the air, and a fine wooden powder covers everything. Light from an old gaethzen orb flickers above a boarded-up window, the aged sphere constantly threatening to go out. The sound of crickets occasionally breaks the silence, and occasionally a rustle of paper echoes through the mill.

node.name: Paper Mill, Drying Chambers
node.description: Enormous sheets of white paper hang from wooden dowels over narrow troughs of water, arranged in diagonals to make the most of the mill's space. The ceiling rises high, occasional lines of light from outside shining through cracks in the untreated wood. A faint chemical smell hangs in the air, mixing with the constant scent of sawdust.

node.name: Paper Mill, Drying Chambers
node.description: A constant drip, drip, drip sound comes from a slanted tin panel hanging over a trough of water. Apparently set up as an attempt to remove moisture from the drying area, the mechanism is attached to a fist-wide drainage pipe that leads outside. In the southern portion of the expansive room, freshly made sheets of paper hang from wooden dowels, waiting to be moved.

node.name: Paper Mill, Chemical Baths
node.description: Steel troughs filled with steaming water line rows of thick shelves, each long basin delivering an acrid smell into the air. Softening wood chips line the bottom of each one, preparing them to be turned into pulp for paper. Shallow puddles mar the floor next to the troughs, slowly sinking into the dirt floor, while small piles of sawdust lie discarded in the corners.

node.name: Paper Mill, Chemical Baths
node.description: An enormous pile of wood chips dominates the eastern side of the room, underneath a large chute fixed in the ceiling. Stuck halfway into the mound is a rusty shovel, apparently made for shoveling the wood chips into nearby troughs filled with water and chemicals. The scent of sawdust hangs heavy in the air, and the chirping of birds can distantly be heard from outside.

An enormous pile of wood chips dominates the eastern side of the room, underneath a large chute fixed in the ceiling. Stuck halfway into the mound is a rusty shovel, apparently made for shoveling the wood chips into nearby troughs filled with water and chemicals. The scent of sawdust hangs heavy in the air, and the occasional hooting of an owl can be heard from nearby outside.

node.name: Paper Mill, Working Stations
node.description: Towering stacks of square wooden frames filled with thin layers of wood pulp take up most of the floor space in this warehouse. Set out to begin the curing process, each of the frames is large enough to make a full yard of paper. The plain floor is simply hardened dirt, packed tight and scattered with a fine layer of sawdust.

node.name: Paper Mill, Working Stations
node.description: The center of the room is dominated by a pair of rollers, apparently used to squeeze chemical-laced water from freshly made paper. Nearby a wide, shallow vat filled with water holds several large sheets of paper, sitting ready to be put through the wringer. The walls and equipment show some signs of neglect: spots of rust appearing on the metallic parts of the equipment.

node.name: Paper Mill, Sawdust Heap
node.description: An enormous pile of sawdust mixed with bits of bark, metals and discarded paper makes a huge heap in this corner of the scrap yard, apparently unsuited for creating paper. The mixture spreads over the entire yard, choking what little grass there is and mixing with the dirt underfoot. A few barrels have been shoved next to the building, giving off a somewhat chemical smell.

node.name: Paper Mill, Scrap Yard
node.description: Sheared scraps of discarded bark, broken and rusty equipment, crumpled paper and other waste line the edges of the yard. A relatively clear path leads east, where an enormous sawdust pile can be seen. A compost bin has been shoved into the corner of the room, the rotting greens casting off an earthy smell.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Birder Lane
node.description: One of the gates of the Crossing lies before you to the northwest, and a steady stream of adventurers flows by. You notice a high proportion of wizards, grey-bearded and fierce-eyed, leaning on staves or muttering to themselves or their familiars. A small lizard barely escapes death underfoot, and you pay more attention to where you tread, lest you inadvertently do in some Mage's favorite pet.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Outside Northeast Gate
node.note: Northeast Gate|NE Gate to Crossing|Gate to Crossing|Kraelyst start point|travel start point
node.description: You are before the Northeast Gate of the Crossing, surrounded by wayfarers and adventurers also in mid-journey. Above, guardsmen stare down from the thick stone wall that encloses the city, wary for hostile visitors. Whether they travel to destinations in town or farther west, or to the north and east, they all appear to be seeking something beyond themselves.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Bramble Thicket
node.description: A small, thin path meanders through an otherwise daunting thicket of brambles here. Directly to the north is a dark, slate outcropping, while east lies a tall, attenuated tower. The exterior of the tower is covered with carvings of fantastic and legendary beings and creatures, whose awesome and powerful visages you can discern even from this distance. Through the foliage, you see the town gate to the west.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Birder Lane
node.description: Flocks of screeching ravens cloud the sky overhead, and wrens, larks and other feathered creatures seem to be hovering about as if awaiting something. An enormous black crow stoops and whooshes past your ear, only to land on the head of one of the more hideous gargoyles projecting from the facade of the black tower due east. The crow appears to be watching your every move.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: The once pristine tower of the Warrior Mages is now no more than a memorial. The stresses of the great fire have shattered the crystalline spire. The building stands broken and raw against the sky. One onyx door tilts wildly to the side, its hinges melted to slag, while the other has been reduced to rubble.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: The tower's immolation has opened the area to new lighting where once the mighty shadow lay. A profusion of new growth will thrive amongst the rubble. The circle of life repeats itself, creation from destruction.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: The small path skirts the shattered remains of Arhat's tower to the west, and branches off to the east. The low mound that forms the ruins of Motte Fort lies to the southeast, and just east of that the solid stone walls of the Keep of the Ughtensgard. Another tower, capped with a gleaming crystal dome, is visible farther southeast.

The small path skirts the shattered remains of Arhat's tower to the west, and branches off to the east. The low mound that forms the ruins of Motte Fort lies to the southeast, and just east of that are the devastated walls of what was once the Keep of the Ughtensgard. Another tower, capped with a gleaming crystal dome, is visible farther southeast.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: The narrow path here is bounded on the south by mats of decomposing water plants and swamp grasses. The stench of marsh gas and the thrashing of slimy, watery things in the rotting reeds keep you from exploring in that direction.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: The small path curves slowly northwards, heading farther and farther away from the protection of the Crossing's gates. Arhat's tower, once home of the Warrior Mage Guild, lies in a crumbling heap of stone to the west.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: Rising above the surrounding lands, the stone walls of Arhat's tower end in jagged edges that pierce the sky. The small path continues to the north, leading towards a larger tower of freshly-cut silvery-grey stone.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grimsage Way
node.description: An enormous tower of grey marble rises imposingly from the ground, its stones fitted so closely that it appears to be one seamless spear of earth. The top of the tower gleams brightly, the light reflecting from the panes of a skylight set into the roof. A set of gleaming ebonwood doors inlaid with gold lead into the tower.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Foyer
node.description: Slate grey walls span the tower interior, faint reflections fading in and out of its glassy sheen. A long steep staircase cut into the walls spirals its way up the tapering interior. Two gruesome and fierce-countenanced dvarapalas stare sullenly at a set of gleaming ebonwood doors leading outside. Set precisely in the center of the floor is a large golden wheel engraved with the crest of the Warrior Mage guild.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Gauthus' Office
node.description: A pink marble arch connects the office with the foyer of the guildhall, allowing Gauthus to keep a watchful eye on visitors and apprentices alike from his seat behind a bare pine desk. Gazing about with impartial interest, a red-banded hawk moves restlessly on her wooden perch, shifting from foot to foot or ruffling her feathers. High transom windows along the walls provide ventilation and light in what might otherwise be a small, airless room.

A pink marble arch connects the office with the foyer of the guildhall, allowing Gauthus to keep a watchful eye on visitors and apprentices alike from his seat behind a bare pine desk. Gazing about with impartial interest, a red-banded hawk moves restlessly on her wooden perch, shifting from foot to foot or ruffling her feathers. Gaethzen spheres sway in the breeze from the high transom windows, providing light for the small room.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Landing
node.description: The second floor landing is paneled in softly-colored woods that start at a pleasant gold at the north and south, and shade gently to a pale pink at the east and west. A large goldenwood door to the north blends perfectly with the paneling, and is flanked by two archways of pale pink marble to the east and west.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Library
node.description: Pale pink marble walls and ceiling, a luxurious white carpet, and an abundance of comfortable but unadorned furniture are the only features of this pleasantly warm room. A large rosewood shelf lined with tomes of history and lore matches the pale pink marble of the archway to the east.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall of History
node.description: Thickly woven tapestries adorn the dull granite walls, each depicting something different. Iron sconces shaped like human hands, each holding a brightly lit gaethzen sphere, are affixed to the walls at regular intervals around the hall. A few mages read quietly in plush, high-backed chairs sitting atop the thick, bright red carpet.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Landing
node.description: The slate grey walls of the tower end, and large panes of glass taper to a point above, creating a massive skylight and window to the heavens above. Five archways ring the room, each one etched with a curious symbol at its apex. Dangling from the skylight, a wooden ladder hangs almost directly over a spiraling staircase that leads into the floor.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Earth
node.description: This small cavern, held secret within the depths of the earth, seems to pulse with the very heartbeat of Elanthia. Phospherein lines the ceiling, emitting a steady, pearlescent green glow. Roots of various plants, some ancient as the Gods themselves, entwine together to form a small couch upon the ground.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Fire
node.description: Walls of obsidian blackness reflect the light from a fire-pit in the center of this room. Smoking braziers of flame-kissed gold line the walls, filling the room with pleasant heat. Spiderweb traces of rhodonite line the ceiling, glowing in the firelight with the stylized image of a flame.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Steel
node.description: This plain white room is unadorned, save for a large map of the realms upon the northern wall, and a small weapons rack. Several rows of benches cluster about the map, obviously used for strategy sessions, and war games.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Electricity
node.description: An anticipatory hum resonates through the air, as though everything in this room were filled with the power of a lightning strike. Columns of pure ilmenite line the walls, glowing from within with pent-up force. All traces of metal are conspicuously absent from the room's furnishings.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Air
node.description: Dominated by the translucent panes of the massive skylight, the roof of the tower provides an unparalleled view of the lands around the Crossing, including the shattered remains of Arhat's Tower to the south. Fickle breezes and gusty gales swirl about the stone, causing the tower to resonate in a never-ending song of change glorifying the dance of the winds.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Water
node.description: Perpetually frozen, a great stalactite of ice hangs from the ceiling, reaching almost to the floor. As the end slowly melts, drops of water fall into a pool below and flow along cracks in the stone to form an intricate lattice-work beneath. Fog slowly rolls off of the ice, cooling the air and settling into a dream-like haze upon the blue marble.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Aether
node.description: Silvery-blue wall hangings cover the base stone walls of the room, matching the cushions scattered about the floor. Floating in the center of the room is a sphere of white-gold which glows with an inner fire. Undefined patterns of light and color swirl about the wall hangings, as though this room were not entirely within the Plane of Abiding.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Chamber of Reflection
node.description: From the peaked ceiling hangs an enormous gaethzen sphere which casts a bright, white light onto the room. Polished marble walls intensify the light, creating an aura effect around everything. In the center of the floor sits a fountain where a tall marble statue of a robed Elven male sends water arching into the pool below from cupped hands. Large, fluffy cushions circle the fountain, creating a comfortable spot to rest.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Target Range
node.description: Blackened marks mar the surface of the grey stones which form this room. The charred remains of a tapestry hang on one wall, now only a narrow border of blue surrounding a black-edged hole. From time to time, young apprentices sidle in to practice their magic upon one of the constructs, only to hurry off to classes. They leave behind new pits in the stone walls, though perhaps not much damage to the construct they had aimed at.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Archery Range
node.description: A wide marble archway opens up into a spacious room. Grey stones form the vaulted ceiling and smooth walls, giving this space a somewhat austere feel. Affixed to the front of a bale of hay is a small target. The target has been sloppily painted on a square of canvas, streaks of paint running down onto the hay. Some paint has been splattered liberally on a tree branch from which the canvas hangs.

node.name: Arhat's Tower, Foyer
node.description: Scorched walls span the tower, and faint reflections of emerald green onyx are visible beneath the ash. A long steep staircase has been cut into the walls, spiraling its way up the tapering interior. A soot-blackened door, hanging precariously from one hinge, leads out.

node.name: Arhat's Tower, Workshop
node.description: Very little is recognizable from the workshop's original contents. The walls are broken off at half their intended height and the area lies open to the elements. The only obvious sign of the room's prior function, odd glowing stains marking the floor, are most likely the result of past experiments gone awry.

node.name: Forest, A Quiet Path
node.description: A cool wind twists through the air, carrying the crisp scent of pine. A generous carpet of needles and loam lines the ground, churning up dust that offsets the sharper smells with a sweet mustiness. In the distance, a sparrow whistles, calling out an ancient melody that only others of its kind can recall the words to.

node.name: Forest, A Quiet Path
node.description: Solitary and overbearing, the trees of the forest loom over all they behold. Caught in a game of one-upsmanship, the trees clump in groups that attempt to outgrow the other. One particular tree, a massive blackwood, overtowers them all, its boughs extending outward in an embrace that gathers up the forest with arms of shadow and leaf.

Solitary and overbearing, the trees of the forest loom over all that they behold. Caught in a game of one-upsmanship, the trees clump in groups that attempt to outgrow the other. Through the dimness of the night, you can make out the blurred lines of a massive blackwood, its boughs extending vastly outward, and its crown brushing back the stars to occlude the sky and moons with thick black leaves.

node.name: Forest, Thinning Trees
node.description: A scattering of trees marks the edge of the forest as it fades away into a wide field to the north and thickens to the south. Clumps of grass and wildflowers grow in smooth rolling hollows and hillocks of green, and a pleasant breeze cools the air to an amiable degree.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: Tawny grasses wave in a breeze rendered vocal by the whisper of the stalks rubbing together. Here and there the field has been tramped down by the passage of careless feet, making paths that wind through the grasses in mazed patterns. To the south a forest edges up against the horizon, clamoring for attention from the sky they would swallow whole.

The moonlight turns the gold of the tall grasses of the field into silver. Here and there the field has been tramped down by the passage of careless feet, making paths that wind through the grasses in mazed patterns. To the south a forest edges up against the horizon, clamoring for attention from the sky they would swallow whole.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: The subtle scent of hay and butter-yellow blossoms infuses the air with a fragrance that brings to mind summer breezes. Crushed and tattered grasses form a ragged path through the growth, and the constant hum and buzz of insects lends a sense of drowsy solitude to the empty lands.

The subtle scent of hay and jes-rose blossoms infuses the air with a pungent scent. Crushed and tattered grasses glimmer in the pale light of the stars as they form a ragged path through the growth. The sense of solitude and emptiness is overwhelming.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: Tiny, annoying gnats and flies whirr through the field, flying into faces and darting quickly away before they can meet their doom. From time to time you catch a flash of movement as one of the local avians zooms in to snatch any particularly attractive or plump-looking bugs, but the sense of poetic justice is quickly erased as another buzzes in to take the place of the one that was consumed.
Cool breezes sweep the fields, visiting unto the parched vegetation release from the naked heat of day.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: The grass stirs in slow patterns as a breeze -- the only permanent resident of the empty hinterland -- swirls over it. Like a wave searching for a shore, the wind pushes back and forth over the changing shades and hues of the growth, hunting for a haven it will never find.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: An ocean of grass edges around the beaten-down path that curls precariously through the field's vastness. With the wind steadily running its fingers through the grasses, the stalks rise and fall in a continual show of motion as inexorable and reflexive as a heartbeat.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: The soft chirr of insects hidden in the tall grasses mingles with the trilling of the nesting field larks that make their homes in the protective shade of the narrow-bladed but profuse growth. You can catch glances of the tiny dun-colored creatures, their soft brown eyes peering up from between the criss-crossing stalks and their voices twittering questions that remain forever unanswered.

The inquisitive chirring of grasshoppers and the floating brilliance of glowbugs mingles in a complex dance through the air. Moving to the sleepy tune of drowsing field larks, you can catch nothing but glances of the tiny creatures, their forms rendered shadowy and supple by the curtain of night.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: Great, rolling fields swallow up the world from one end of the sky to the next. The natural perfection of the pristine grass is only marred by the paths that have been grudgingly trodden through them by the heavy feet of adventurers and their prey.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grove
node.description: Leaves dance in the swirl of a cool breeze as tall oaks and slim pines crowd against one another in a race for light and space. Fallen pine needles and grass form a luxurious carpet, muffling footsteps and releasing sharp, clean scents into the air.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grove
node.description: Vines curl around the trunks of the trees, displaying glossy green leaves with powdery grey underbellies. The branches of the aesaigos shirk against one another, a mysterious sound.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Grove
node.description: Slender aesaigo trees link their limbs and leaves together to form a loose screen of shade against the light. The grass fades from amber to emerald as it sweeps west to east, its changing surface dotted with starflowers and buttercups.

Slender aesaigo trees link their limbs and leaves together to form a loose latticework through which the moonlight slips. The grass is darkened to a monotone shade of grey, the flowers that dot its surface closed for the evening.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: A sea of multi-hued grasses rises and falls all around. From the deep greens of serrated seregrass to the tawny spun gold of common stalks, the panorama of color is incredible to consider, the palette of a crazed and yet highly imaginative painter.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Washing Well
node.description: Couched amidst a bed of shrubbery is an old stone and mortar well. A rusted winch assures that the bucket that last descended down into the construction's depths remains a permanent resident. Grasses grow up to spill down in streams around it, gathering in a thick crescent. A small pool of water is cupped by the lush growth that collects at the foot of the well, the gossiping grounds of housewives long since gone.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Fields
node.description: Weathered beams of wood poke up through the grass like children peering cautiously around for signs of a malevolent bully. Bits of cloth and paper still cling to the greyed and splintered wood, remnants of a happier time now long gone.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Farmlands
node.description: Rich farmland surrounds the road on both sides. The fresh scent of the tilled soil rises all about you. Southward, the walls of a fair-sized city rise near the banks of a glistening river. A faint haze of smoke hovers over the town, blurring the outlines slightly. To the north, distant hills rear up against the grey-blue horizon.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Farmlands
node.description: The scent of freshly-tilled earth rises from the farms on both sides of the road. Heavily-loaded wagons and carts brimming with produce wend their way southward towards the walls of a city set near a glimmering river. You note an amazing variety of races and types that are driving their goods into the town.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Farmlands
node.description: Neatly planted rows of grain mingle with tidy plots of vegetables covering the rich earth of well-tended farms along the wide road as it wanders across the land. A farmer waves at you as he toils along behind a yoke of sturdy oxen that pull a heavy iron plow through the fertile soil.
Empty fields lie sleeping beneath the blanket of night. The scent of plowed earth mingles with the fragrance of fresh growing things.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Farmlands
node.description: Open grassland mingles with small farmsteads as the wide road passes through a cut where a low hill rises. The road is edged with tall hedges, apparently to keep cattle from wandering into the orchards and vegetable plots you see beyond the heavy, guarding branches. Some distance to the south, you see the smoke and haze of a city of some size. Northwards, low hills rise against the sky.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Grasslands
node.description: Cattle wander aimlessly across the road as they crop at the rich grass growing in the rolling fields. You spy a lone cow-herd nodding under a shade tree off to one side as his charges amble into your path in large numbers, enormous brown eyes gazing soulfully at you as they pass.
Dark shapes of cattle stand, outlined against the night sky, as they huddle together in sleep. Somewhere nearby you hear the bark of a dog -- the herd has not been left unguarded.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Grasslands
node.description: Open grassland mingles with a thinning forest from the north. Here and there among the trees cattle wander. They casually dine on the lush grass and occasionally reach up to consume the delicate leaves on the lower branches of the trees. To the north, low hills rise up gently from the plains. Southward, a heavy haze or smoke can be made out.

Open fields to either side can be dimly seen. Faintly, there comes a trace of woodsmoke, perhaps from the campfires of local herdsmen warming themselves against the night chill. Nearby, a rounded shape proves to be that of a sleeping cow.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Forest
node.description: Trees to both sides of the road thin out southward where the land changes to open grassland. Large grey squirrels leap across the road overhead from branch to branch and chitter down at you as they regard you with curious eyes.
Trees rise dimly along the roadway and you can faintly hear a quiet chittering, perhaps from sleepy squirrels annoyed at your disturbing their rest.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Forest
node.description: Trees grow tall here, but they are scattered enough to allow sunlight and a good view of the sky. Northwards, the land rises into low hills that disappear against the black sky of the night. To the south, a gentle plain opens outward. A soft breeze rustles the leaves in the boughs overhead in a pleasant susurration.

Trees grow tall here, but they are scattered enough to allow moonlight and a good view of the sky. Northwards, the land rises into low hills that disappear against the black sky of the night. To the south, a gentle plain opens outward. A soft breeze rustles the leaves in the boughs overhead in a pleasant susurration.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Woods
node.description: Widely scattered trees stand aloof, like strangers at a party, barely noticing one another's presence. Northwards, the open land nearby changes into a few low, rolling hills. Like a bare head rising above thinning hair, the hills stand out from a fringe of trees about their base.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Rolling Hills
node.description: The road winds among low, rounded hills barely deserving of the name. Clumps of trees around the base of the hills thin out rapidly as bare rock rises out of the good earth. The ragged summits are worn and weathered with age.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Rolling Hills
node.description: The road crests the highest of the low hills, wandering among the cracked and worn rocks scattered across it. Removed from the road and set gently upon a hill, like a princess on her ivory pedestal, stands a rough circle of tall stones arranged in two concentric rings. Rising unsteadily from the crown of the hill, many of the stones lean against one another or are completely toppled. Perhaps a place of worship in ancient times, not even legend recalls who came here or what gods they served.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Rolling Hills
node.description: Winding north and south over the brow of a low hill, the road is partly blocked by several roughly shaped stones that appear to have tumbled down from the hill crest above. Small curls of a deep green vine have begun to wind the fallen stones into their embrace, and the tiny white flowers scattered among the leaves brighten the dull blue-grey of the stone.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Rolling Hills
node.description: A series of low hills, barely worthy of note, rise to the south while northwards, wide open grasslands run unhindered into the distance. Far off to the north, at the edge of the horizon, the faint shape of distant mountains can just be made out.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Rolling Hills
node.description: Low hills to the south rise up from marshy land to the north. Clouds of insects and tiny birds feeding upon them dart here and there. The whine of millions of quivering wings combines with the thin rustle of the darting birds to form an annoying, discordant noise.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Marshy Meadows
node.description: The ground underfoot squishes with each movement, and moisture oozes into the traces left. Low rocks set in ragged rows appear to mark a path along the swampy ground. Gnats and midges clog your nostrils and fly into your eyes and ears in an endless cloud. The air is thick with rotting vegetable matter and less identifiable odors.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Marshy Meadows
node.description: You travel in the midst of a boggy meadow. The air is thick with a chill mist that blurs the outlines of anything not close by. Pale rocks set along the path show the safest way to go among the almost trackless wastes.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Marshy Meadows
node.description: The ground beneath you is boggy and soft. Swarms of flies close about you, and some land to drill into your flesh for a morsel of blood and to leave a stinging welt as a souvenir of your visit to their lands. Northwards, the ground rises from the bog into open lands, while southward a mist obscures the view.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: Southward, the road dips into a boggy lowland, while to the north, open grasslands stretch. No sign of habitation breaks the rippling waves of grass that grow shoulder-high to a tall Elf. The air is alternately fresh with the smell of growing things and thick with the stench of the bog, as the wind veers aimlessly across the open land.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: Thick grass grows up to the edge of the road. Despite the isolation and empty land, the road itself is in surprisingly good shape. Large paving stones rest on a level bed, each one tightly fitted to its neighbor so that nary a weed or seedling can force a way between them. Perhaps some vanished town lay near here that knew the value of good roads.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: The road runs straight as an arrow through the endless sea of tall grasses. An occasional ripple among the stalks moving counter the wind shows there is life hidden beneath the green and gold surface. The desperate flight of a covey of birds, as they break cover and scatter, shows that peace here is a shallow illusion. For always the hunter awaits the careless and the weak.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: A ruined building sits alongside the tidy stone road. The remains perhaps of an ancient tollhouse or inn, it lies at the edge of a forest that rises up from a wide swathe of grassland.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Forest
node.description: The trees grow about you in abundance, their tops brushing the sky, their leaves shimmering with the breeze. The chirping of birds flows on the wind and there seems to be an almost sentient life to the wood, as if someone or something smiles beneficently on all the denizens and events that occur within the forest's boundaries.

The trees grow in abundance about you, their tops brushing the dark sky above, their leaves flittering against each other in the night breeze. The soft sound of wings alerts you to the presence of a night hunter, and the broken-off cry that follows tells you that the hunter's prey has been found once more.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Forest
node.description: Low-lying taffelberry bushes grow about the tall deobar trees of the forest. The scent of loam hangs thick and sweet in an almost tangible cloud. The floor is carpeted with fallen leaves in the process of returning to the elements from whence they came, and some of the trees show evidence of having had their branches chopped off.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: The trees cluster close, weaving a dark green canopy through which light slants cautiously, making tiny pools that flaunt dancing motes of dust. The air is heavy and still, thick with silence without even a birdsong to break the enclosing stillness.

The trees cluster close, weaving a dark green canopy through which no real light penetrates. The eerie echoing cry of an owl as it hunts for prey threads through the latticework of the trees, shattering the deceptive peace of the forest.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: This is the heart of the wood, where the trees are the thickest and the outside world of skies and unforested land is the farthest away. The trees grow close to each other, their leaves whispering back and forth, their crowns bowed in quiet conversation. The silence is broken only by the sounds of a squirrel or similar creature's movements and the rush of a river coming from somewhere in the distance.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: Deobar trees tower over you, their leaves rustling in time with the sounds of the river to the north. Quiet and serene, this part of the forest has a rich scent to it, the overlapping canopy making pools of gloom that collect beneath the trees.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Meadowlands
node.description: The forest to the south is thick and dark, a stark comparison to the open meadow around you. Short, springy grass grows in soft mounds over hillocks and hollows. Tiny white wildflowers peek out amongst the greenery, their petals open to accept the sunlight.

The forest to the south is thick and dark, a stark comparison to the open meadow around you. Short, springy grass grows in soft mounds over hillocks and hollows. Pale jes-roses dot the greenery, their sweet, nightblooming fragrance creating a heady perfume.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Meadowlands
node.description: The land here is open and welcome, the grass thinning on the western horizon as it makes way for a farmstead. Nearby you can hear the babble of a river, and the vegetation shows signs that something, probably cattle, has been here recently to grab a quick snack. The air is clean and sweet, inviting you to take deeper breaths.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Farmstead
node.description: Vast, empty fields lie fallow about you. The remains of an abandoned farmhouse dominates your view to the northeast, its doorways gaping, its windows wide open like empty eye sockets. Nearby, a plow lies rusting, its blade sunk a good two feet into dirt whose only future crop will be grass. To the south the land is gradually returning to the meadow it originally was, the edge of creeping green vivid against the bare brown of exposed earth.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: The darker colors of the serrated wirgars grasses that grow in this particular part of the plains stand out against their lighter cousins. You catch the scent of sirese on the wind, the fragrance of the tiny wildflower wrapping around you. To the south the land turns a rough brown, shifting abruptly from plains to farming land.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: Blue sky and sweet winds mingle with vibrant greens and yellows to create a place that seems blessed by Hodierna herself. Restless clouds chase each other through the sky, and the blithely cheerful songs of birds create a natural, if chaotic, symphony to be enjoyed by all.

The sky overhead creates an inky canvas upon which stars have been liberally splattered. An evening wind, fragrant with the scent of night-blooming flowers, ruffles your clothing and cools the air. Somewhere, a nightingale sings, whistling for its lover.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Kaerna Village Outskirts
node.description: The grasslands shimmer slightly, the gentle hand of the wind running its fingers through the plant life. Here and there colorful wildflowers dare to peep their heads up through the endless browns and greens of the plains. Dominating the gentle sighing of the grass can be heard the bustling sounds of the tiny village of Kaerna, surrounded by a wooden town wall which masks the village's graceless sprawl against the northern horizon.

node.name: Hilltop, Road
node.description: A peaceful valley, sheltered by the surrounding hills, is laid out before you like a patchwork quilt of flowery meadows and neatly arranged farmland. Centered in this multicolored vista is a small village. You pause on the hilltop to enjoy this delightful view. A meadowlark circles overhead for a moment, warbling its song to you, before swooping down toward the village, following the line of a well-traveled road.

The moonlight reveals a small valley stretched out between the surrounding hills. You can see a multitude of tiny lamplights twinkling in the darkness below, and faroff sounds of laughter and singing hover in the sweet evening air. The faint outline of a road descends down into the night-cloaked valley.

node.name: Hillside, Road
node.description: A gentle breeze, carrying the sweet earthy scent of fresh herbs and flowers, rustles through the grass in the valley below you, making it flow like waves on an ocean. A well-traveled road winds like a ribbon from a small village up to the top of the hill.

node.name: Valley, Village Gate
node.description: A large gate stands here, usually open to welcome travelers -- but wisely capable of closing to defend the residents within. Traders, adventurers and farmers from the surrounding valley mingle here, moving in or out of the village at a leisurely pace, many of them Halflings. A wooden wagon, carrying racks of freshly-baked meat pies, trundles into the gates, followed by several yapping dogs. A neatly painted wooden sign is displayed in a prominent place.

node.name: Northwall Trail, Open Forest
node.description: Growing in the shade of towering oak and fir trees, azalea bushes add bright splashes of color to the brown-green gloom of the forest. Tangles of ivy creep alongside the trail and cloak the trees in jade filigree.

The darkness of night grips the forest tightly, like a black-gloved fist holding back the light of dawn. The staccato questions of owls echo from the boughs far above, while lower to the ground the cries of unseen creatures ring through the trees.

node.name: Outside East Wall, Footpath
node.description: Under the shadow of eastern section of The Crossing's stone town wall, this footpath serves as a shortcut. Barely wide enough for one person, thick brambles and brush allow passage in single file. A few crevices in the wall make adequate handholds as you squeeze your way along the uneven ground and past thorny branches.

node.name: The Crossing, Northeast Customs
node.description: Here stands the Northeast Gate, two massive doors of steel-banded ironwood securely attached to the masonry of the town walls. The traffic here is thick with travelers, and the Customs Officers are alert to any sign of trouble.

node.name: Northeast Vineyard, Farmhouse
node.description: Nestled at the base of a terraced hillside, a small stone farmhouse seems caught in a struggle with the tendrils of ivy which seek to pull it down. Though the farmhouse survives, the outcome of the battle is really not in doubt. The ivy has already pulled over half the chimney, now a pile of rust-colored bricks lying in an untidy heap on the west side of the house. To the north, a path leads to a small building behind the house, while a trail to the south leads back into the forest.

node.name: Kaerna Village, By the Well
node.description: The Northern Trade road runs like an arrow through the small town of Kaerna. Composed mostly of ramshackle daub and wattle houses, the most distinguishing feature of Kaerna is its inn, which looms protectively over the other, smaller establishments. Less a town and more a waystation than anything else, the tiny wooden-walled village hugs the road with a tenacious determination.

node.name: Kaerna Village, Intersection
node.description: Even in the cool of the night the village remains active. A soft, cheery glow shines from the windows and open doorway of the Gilded Unicorn Inn, and a few traders are yet about checking their camels, inspecting their wagons, or preparing for the morning's excursions to come. The stars overhead seem to stretch on forever, the moons smiling benevolently down on the sleeping village.

The main activity of the town seems to be concentrated here where traders, villagers, and travellers from afar gather to exchange information or engage in a bit of bartering. Presiding over all of this is the Gilded Unicorn Inn, the largest building in the village as well as the best kept. Far from the bustle and turmoil of the big city, its doors are always open, a lantern or candle always lit.

node.name: Journalai Route, Kaerna Outskirts
node.description: The grasslands lap like waves at the edge of Kaerna Village to the east. The small, dun-colored houses of the town endure silently, islands in a sea of green. To the west the land begins to take on a more rolling form, an abrupt and unusual change from the endless plains that stretch to the north and south.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Kaerna Outskirts
node.description: The wooden wall surrounding the tiny waystop of Kaerna is a visible line drawn between the plains and hamlet. Thick grasses and shrubs growing against the protective barrier seem intent upon reclaiming the village's side-by-side buildings for the prairie. Off to one side stands an abandoned militia shack, a silent casualty to the ongoing war between civilization and nature.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: The wind rushes through the grass, making a soft shirring sound. Occasionally you catch the crackle of movement or the twitterings of birds, but any sounds of civilization generated by something other than yourself seem like the sort of thing you would think up in a dream.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: Miles upon miles of uncivilized land lie before you, devoid of any sign of humanity. A shifting sea of brown, green, and tan grasses rises about you, rustling with the movement of the occasional bird or butterfly that dares to plunge down into the vegetation. A line of dark mountains rises to the north, shadowed and gloomy, they climb abruptly from the grasslands.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Foothills
node.description: The road rises along the curve of a low hill that slopes down to the south into open grasslands. The rocky crest of the hill rises sharply above you as you toil along the well-kept roadway. Local stones from the hillside have been smoothed and shaped to form the roadbed and the footing is good. Northwards though, the hills shift quickly into steep mountains.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Foothills
node.description: You crest a low hill that gives a far-reaching view. To the north a line of mountains rises steeply from the surrounding hills, while southward the hills fade out to forest and plain. Far to the south, a heavy haze obscures the view, but you glimpse the occasional flash of open water.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Foothills
node.description: You travel through a small dell that rises northwards into a narrow pass. You follow the path with your eyes until it fades from view among the steeply rising mountains. Southward a low hill rises, bearing the roadway along its shoulders. A Trader's Guild outpost sits alongside the stony trail.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Mountain Trail
node.description: The roadway is made from cracked stone that seems to have fallen from the steep rocky shoulders of a mountain whose flank forms a boundary along your path. Rising steeply to the north and falling away to low hills to the south, the road cuts a narrow path among the mountains.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Mountain Trail
node.description: You edge along a steep drop as the road narrows sharply in order to work its way along a narrow ridge of rock. Snow-capped peaks tower overhead and an occasional eagle or hawk can be seen soaring on the high-road of the sky far overhead. You envy them their direct routes as you gaze over the lip of the road and note the crumbling stone along its rim.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Mountain Pass
node.description: The road passes onto an almost level area as you work your way through a narrow gap in the mountains. Huge boulders that have tumbled loose from the escarpments above you cause you to keep a wary eye out for more such unwelcome fellow-travellers. A tiny roadside shrine has been erected here, perhaps by someone who made a lucky escape from such an avalanche of stone.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Mountain Trail
node.description: A huge boulder blocks much of the road, but room remains to squeeze by between it and the mountain wall. One broken and shattered bone shows you that someone or something was far less fortunate in times past. You look nervously up at the rock-strewn slopes above you and mutter a short prayer that the boulders rest easily these days.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Mountain Trail
node.description: The road rises sharply to the west as it wends among the steep mountains. Eastward, it falls away into a narrow, heavily-wooded valley. Evidence of frequent landslides shows in the piles of rock and small boulders that make passage here uneven and slightly risky.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wooded Valley
node.description: Thick woods grow heavily along the shoulders of the roadway, blocking both the sky and your sight after a short distance. You spy several sets of wolf tracks in the heavy leaf mould under some of the trees and you cast a nervous eye about you. Travelers' tales you've heard rise unbidden to trouble your mind as you pass among the close-set trees.

Thick woods grow heavily along the shoulders of the roadway, blocking both sky and sight after a short distance. Several sets of wolf tracks are evident in the heavy leaf mould under some of the trees. Troublesome travelers' tales describing the forest's dangers come to mind as the journey continues through the close-set trees.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wooded Valley
node.description: You come upon a small clearing in the heavy woods that allows a view of the sky. A faint path can be made out that wanders into the trees, but it fades off before you can wonder about where it might lead. There is an unnerving quiet here, even the wind seems to have died. You feel a stranger in this wild place, perhaps an unwelcome stranger.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Wooded Valley
node.description: Tall trees grow close along both sides of the road. Small animals skitter among the branches overhead and dart among low-growing shrubs that eke out an existence in the deep shade of the forest. Something taller than you has clawed the bark off a tree trunk several feet overhead and you wonder just where the beast that wore such claws is currently.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Foothills
node.description: Tall trees grow thickly to the south as the road climbs into a narrow valley. Northwards, the land opens out into rolling hills that fade off into the looming shadow of several sharp mountain peaks, each distinct from the other.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Foothills
node.description: Heavily wooded hills rise on both sides as the roadway winds among them. The air is dead and stale, any breeze is blocked by the trees and hills. Clouds of gnats and worse seem to follow you, getting in your mouth and hair. There is a faint smell of damp earth and rotting vegetation.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Rolling Hills
node.description: Massive flocks of small black birds wheel and dive among the low hills on either side. They seem to be feeding on the dense swarms of midges and other insects that lurk in the heavy air. A miasma of musty smells and unknown odors roils in your nostrils. The ground to the north descends into a faint mist or cloud in the air.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: Eroded wagon ruts cause you to notice that this road was once travelled with a greater frequency than it is now. While safe from becoming overgrown by the dying grasses of the plains, this part of the trail is crumbling from disuse and the encroaching dust.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Grasslands
node.description: The winds veer around you, catching the grasses and your clothing in their grip and tugging like beggars vying for attention. Flowers, closed for the evening, bob along in time with the lonely music the breezes create with the plains. You can hear the babble of rushing water coming from the north.

The winds veer around you, catching the grasses and your clothing in their grip and tugging like beggars vying for attention. Flowers nod in the breeze like dancers moving to an unheard rhythm, their brightly colored heads catching your eye. You can hear the sound of rushing water coming from the north.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, River's Bank
node.description: A narrow river rushes past you on its way southwest, its turbulent gray waters creating a deafening roar. To the north the land changes dramatically from plains to the darker, more verdant green of meadows. To the south stretches a narrow strip of grassland. A sturdy wood and stone bridge spans the river, allowing safe passage.

A narrow river rushes past you on its way southwest, its turbulent grey waters creating a deafening roar. To the north the land changes dramatically from plains to the darker, more verdant green of meadows. To the south stretches a narrow strip of grassland. A sturdy wood and stone bridge spans the river, allowing safe passage.

node.name: Stream Bank
node.description: Smooth rounded pebbles, bleached by the sun to a pearly white, line the rocky bed of a sparkling stream. Not much wider than a strong leap could carry you, the brook flows gently over clean stones, occassionally parting for a large rock thrust from its center. Green clumps of reeds prospering along the grassy bank offer a safe haven to the shy water creatures which make their home here.

node.name: Silvery Pool, Waterfall
node.description: Cool tendrils of water slip down the rough surface of the mammoth stone outcropping, cascading to the rock's base with a sibilant whisper. Water dances and leaps jubilantly beneath the waterfall, before rippling away in great waves, to finally die away and lie still at the pool's farthest reaches. Along the banks, tall vilt reeds provide privacy for modest swimmers.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, On the Bridge
node.description: The deafening roar of the Journalai River below you drowns out all other sound as you make your way across the bridge. Droplets of water hit your face, and every now and then the flash of silver scales in the water catches your eye.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Meadowlands
node.description: The grass is a thick, dark green carpet that spreads over the land in rolling abundance. A few holes, large enough to admit a small animal, mar the landscape, creating openings that lead down into the dark home of burrowing creatures. A river runs to the south, over which spans a sturdy wood and stone bridge.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Meadowlands
node.description: The tips and edges of the grass are slightly yellowed, and you get the vague feeling that there should be more flowers here. To the south the meadows gradually shift into the lush emerald they should be, and to the north you see the beginning of a treeline.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Open Forest
node.description: The land has suffered from something malignant judging by the yellowish tinge to the grass and leaves of the trees. Even the resilient deobar are having trouble in these conditions, and most of the trees are stunted, a sickly hue creeping through their bark. The only thing that appears to be thriving is a grey-green woodmoss that covers the trees in abundance.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: Chalky green woodmoss drapes from the trees of the forest, falling in tiers that bring to mind waterfalls or a crone's hair. There is a disturbing lack of birds and animals about.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: The trees grow close together, as if in fear of something. The trail is free of debris and a tree, fallen across the road, has been carved through that the trail might continue despite the obstruction.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Forest Clearing
node.description: Jagged-edged grass grows thick about you, brushing and clinging to clothing and skin. A fire ring has been built by the side of the road, evidence that someone felt the flat ground and relative safety of this area would make it the perfect place to stop and rest.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Forest Clearing
node.description: The grass is flourishing here despite the apparent blight of the rest of the wood. Facing east beside the road is a squat stone monolith with an indentation in its top. Some carvings adorn its polished gray surface, and an odd rust-colored residue stains it.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: The trees rise about you like looming tombstones in a graveyard, each one draped in shawls of sickly gray lichen. The air is thick with a pressing sense of gloom, and you get the distinct impression that you are being watched.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Deep Forest
node.description: Heavy, still air hangs in pockets about you, weighing down sound and movement. Silent in their misery, the trees hunch over each other, their boughs and trunks hidden by clinging moss. They pull the sickly-colored stuff about them the way a Human child hides under a security blanket.

node.name: Kaerna Village, By the General Store
node.description: A few residences huddle here, alternately shouldered up against the back of the Gilded Unicorn Inn and the sides of the general store. The store is squat but neat, its exterior newly whitewashed and a small garden carefully cultivated outside it.

node.name: Grek's Food and Supplies
node.description: This store is larger on the inside than it seems from the outside, its wares proudly displayed on the walls or stacked neatly in corners. Seated behind the counter on a specially-made stool is the proprietor, Grek the Dwarf. He gives you a wary look as you enter, then seems to relax, the Dwarvish equivalent of a smile on his face.

node.name: The Militia Shack, Inside
node.description: Not much is left of this building except mice and a few ratty blankets. It seems well and truly abandoned, of no significant notice whatsoever.

node.name: A Dark Tunnel
node.description: Were it not for some lanterns that someone has hung from the ceiling of this burrow, you wouldn't be able to see a thing. The total silence that pervades this underground tunnel isn't helping much, either. What little you do see of the architecture is expertly made, possibly even Dwarven in construction.

node.name: A Dark Tunnel
node.description: There is a strong light leaking in from a hole above you, and weaker lantern light to the east. Roots stick out from the wood-braced dirt walls, the glittering minerals in the earth catching what little light there is and reflecting it back.

node.name: Near Kaerna Village, A Dirt Path
node.description: Here a dirt path leads to a dark grove of trees. A tree stump, its trunk featuring a sizable hole and the base covered with odd carvings that would appear to be symbols, stands where the trail terminates.

node.name: Near Kaerna Village, A Dark Grove
node.description: Around you grow trees in a circle so even and perfect they warrant suspicion. In the center of the grove is a deep pool, its surface smooth and glassy, undisturbed by the wind. Sunlight slants through the leaves and falls in dappled pools of light. A nest has been built in one of the tallest trees, its occupant a sleeping night owl, its head tucked under its wing.

Around you grow trees in a circle so even and perfect they warrant suspicion. In the center of the grove is a deep pool, its surface smooth and glassy, undisturbed by the wind. Peering into it, it takes you a moment to realize that your face is not reflected in the pool and another to realize that neither are the trees. In fact, the only thing that can be seen are stars -- thousands and thousands of endless stars, some of which you know you have never seen in the sky above you.

node.name: A Dark Grove, A Deep Pool
node.description: The sand below your feet is soft as silk and as black and absolute as night. The waters are deathly cold, causing you to shiver. All is still, and even the ripples your movements cause soon fade back into pure, untouched water.

The sand below your feet is soft as silk and as black as the night about you. The waters are colder than death, causing you to shake violently. A deep stillness enfolds the obsidian waters, which seem to close about your body like enveloping folds of the thickest onyx velvet.

node.name: Wilderness, Overgrown Path
node.description: A faint trail fades to nothing more than a thin break in the undergrowth, but seems to faintly curve east to southwest. The heavy brush scratches and whips any exposed skin with each step forward. An occasional rustle from areas unseen is a soft reminder that the solitude of the area is only an illusion.

Though deep, the darkness isn't complete and the chirring sounds of insects fills the air. Pressing in all around, a thicket of scrub and brush make passage difficult. What little light there is comes from the east. All other directions stare back with an opaque blackness as thick as tar.

node.name: Foothills, Stony Incline
node.description: Taking the opportunity to examine the distant countryside, large green forests in the southwest, flatlands to the south and the large ocean expanse to the southeast all catch the eye. All seem more attractive than the forbidding set of cliffs up ahead.

node.name: Lairocott Brach, Entrance
node.description: Placed in the wall of the sheer cliff that stands before you is a large stone door, currently blasted open. Two large lifelike sentinels, one on either side of the door, have been scorched black.
Placed in the wall of the sheer cliff is a huge stone door with an arched top. Two large lifelike sentinels, one on either side of the door, stand at attention in silence.

node.name: Foothills, Abandoned Road
node.description: The path underfoot is overgrown with weeds and almost completely covered with dried, fallen branches yet still feels surprisingly firm. A few pine saplings off to one side struggle to push up through the heavy soil.

node.name: Silvery Pool
node.description: Sunlight sparkles over the pool like a thousand tiny gems among the ripples. The cool water laps against your skin in a soothing repetitive rhythm, relaxing your muscles and drawing you out of the shallows. Beneath your feet the pure white sand is smooth and clear of weeds. A lulling, meditative aura settles over the water.

Cool tendrils of water slip down the rough surface of the mammoth stone outcropping, cascading to the rock's base with a sibilant whisper. Water dances and leaps jubilantly beneath the waterfall, before rippling away in great waves, to finally die away and lie still at the pool's farthest reaches. Along the banks, tall vilt reeds provide privacy for modest swimmers.

Moonlight dances over the pool like a thousand stars among the dark ripples. The cool water laps against your skin in a soothing repetitive rhythm, relaxing your muscles and drawing you out of the shallows. Beneath your feet the pure white sand is smooth and clear of weeds. A lulling, meditative aura settles over the water.

node.name: Forest Path
node.description: The trees seem to hold an aura of fragility about them, as if the burden of the moss that drips from their boughs weighs them down to the point of snapping. Odd carvings have been hung from the branches of the trees, their stone and wooden visages stirring on the wind and clattering against one another.

node.name: Journalai Route, Open Grasslands
node.description: The grasslands here are caught between the presence of rolling hills to the west and the small village of Kaerna to the east. To the north and south is nothing but empty plains, wind-twisted and long ignored by humanity.

node.name: Journalai Route, Foothills
node.description: A set of rolling green hills rise up to the west, gradually flattening out into grasslands to the east. A barricade blocks off further passage toward the east along the Journalai Route.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Bramble Thicket
node.description: The bramble thicket is not very dense here, and its tangled, matted shrubs seem to shrink back from the north side of the clearing, almost as if shunning it. Just beyond the clearing rises a massive gate. Sere vines and dead vermin are scattered about its base, but nothing, not even moss, mars its surface.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Lich Gate
node.description: The ground beneath your feet is black and dead, as though it had once been engulfed in a great inferno. Oddly enough, the Lich Gate before you appears pristine and intact, unscathed by the apparent waste and desolation that surround or perhaps radiate from it.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Inside Fence
node.description: A cold breeze blows through the area changing its direction when you turn, as if guided by some unseen force. Several paths lead off to the north into the trees. Along the perimeter, a low wrought-iron fence serves as a token boundary for the cemetery.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Winding Footpath
node.description: The path begins to weave its way through dense trees, snaking around small burial sites that contain several old stone grave markers. The grounds have been kept clear and the grass is cut low around each tombstone. Someone must visit this place regularly.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Winding Footpath
node.description: Just beyond the iron fence that runs along the path to the southeast, you hear something moving about in the underbrush. Faint pinpoints of light fade in and out of the trees and you would swear the temperature just dropped. The outline of a square structure lies to the south, while a faint trail heads northwest through low-hanging trees.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Graves
node.description: Each of the graves in this part of the cemetery is marked with a simple wax candle. Despite the constant breeze, the flames of every candle continue to burn and flicker, lighting the ground with an eerie orange glow.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Before Mausoleum
node.description: The trees have given way to a mausoleum crafted from white marble. The entrance is marked by two smooth columns and perched just above, a solemn-looking stone gargoyle surveys the surroundings.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Worn Path
node.description: Branches reach out towards you, groping at your clothing. Just beyond the path, misty vapors weave their way between the trees, seeking unknown prey. A worn path bends around from the southwest to southeast. To the northwest, you spot some sort of clearing.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Cenote
node.description: You are standing on the edge of a deep sinkhole, about eighty feet wide and perfectly round. Peering into the deep hole, you find that it's filled with water, the surface about thirty feet below you. Judging from the smoothness of the walls and a skeleton still clinging to the rocks below, you surmise that jumping into this cenote might be a bad idea.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Shady Path
node.description: The trees hang low over the path along the westward curve, forming an eerie tunnel of foliage. From somewhere in the darkness, the hoot of an owl echoes through the woods.

node.name: Hilltop Cemetery, Ring of Stones
node.description: The tunnel of trees opens up into a round clearing where eight gravestones have been placed in a circle. The stone markers face inward, towards a small stone altar resting in the center. There are ash marks across its surface, leading you to believe something was once set aflame upon it.

node.name: Graveyard, Inside Crypt
node.description: A low stone altar heaped with dried flowers, old rotted offerings of food and streaked with ancient pools of melted wax, stands opposite the heavy iron gateway which leads out of the crypt. The walls are lined with closed graves, sealed with heavy marble facings, each bearing a polished bronze plaque with the name of one of the departed. A lone flickering candle standing atop the stone fights a precarious battle against the heavy oppressive darkness of the crypt.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: The ceiling and walls are mostly dirt aside from one bright patch of cracked marble overhead. Two burning torches fixed to the ceiling in heavy iron brackets light up the tunnel with a deep reddish glow, glinting off bits of ivory bone and old wood in the walls. The tunnel slopes downwards and to the east, fading into inky blackness beyond the light.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: The flat bottom of a wooden coffin hangs down from the ceiling overhead, glistening darkly in the torchlight, with a dark ragged hole ripped in its side. The floor is damp and slimy with mud and deeply rutted, as if someone or something has been dragged through it.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A gaping hole branches off from the main tunnel to the north, an inky blackness against the dark walls. The black earth is scattered with tiny pale flecks, like stars on a cloudy night. An ivory shard juts from the wall, standing out in the flickering light.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: Tiny trickles of mud drip down from overhead as if disturbed by your passage. This section of tunnel seems more freshly excavated, and the earth less packed down. The dirt roof overhead is uneven and pitted with holes.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: This branch of the tunnel dead-ends in a nightmare tableau revealed in the tenuous light. Someone or something has piled stacks of polished bones into neat sorted piles, along with bits of stained rotting cloth.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: Dark dripping branches hang down from the low earth ceiling like knotted, grasping fingers reaching towards you. Tiny rivulets of dirty water run in narrow branching grooves, pooling in strangely distorted tracks in the hard packed mud.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: The musty cavern air clings to the ground like a thick blanket of decay and old death. Black glistening insects hang from the walls, grown fat and complacent living off the rich bounty buried overhead.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: Glistening pearly snail tracks paint luminescent stripes along the underside of a stone slab forming part of the ceiling. Although the slab is still unbroken, deep gashes along its surface reveal the labors of some clawed would-be intruder.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: Matted branches tangled together like worms form a living roof overhead, seeming almost to wiggle in the flickering light. Pale patches in the dark walls reveal the location of ancient graves, so old that nothing remains but a faint ivory taint to the soil.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: An old wooden coffin sticks part way out of the southern wall, its side ripped open and its contents gone. Bits of wood and less identifiable things lie strewn about, sticking up like thorns from the muddy cave floor.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A sickening stench of decay rises from a noxious pool formed in a dip in the tunnel. Bits of unidentifiable something float over the oily surface of the water, and somewhere in the darkness something makes a splashing sound. The muddy tunnel floor rises to the west and southwest.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: The tunnel branches off in three directions, bent and forked like a lightning stroke through the damp dark earth. The constant wet dripping from the walls forms tiny rivulets which flow down the sloped branch to the east.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: The tunnel makes a sharp bend, skirting the edges of a huge limestone boulder which looms over the passage to the west. The stone's face is slick with sickly growths of dank moss. To the north, the tunnel narrows quickly and dead-ends in solid rock. A narrow crack in the stone looks passable.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A line of ants climbs along the tunnel walls, passing busily in and out of a dark hole dug into the dirt. Several other pits have been dug into the moist ground, but seem to have been picked clean of anything they might once have contained.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A hollow thump echoes as you travel down the tunnel, sounding strangely muffled against the dry earthen walls. Looking down, you realize you are standing on a coffin lid, half buried in the dirt beneath your feet.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: The narrow tunnel walls change abruptly here, as smooth ancient limestone to the east gives way to packed earth. Jagged shards fallen from the wall litter the floor, forcing visitors to step carefully. A blazing fire to the east casts a faint reddish light over the whole area.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A faint scratching sound out of sight sets your teeth on edge, as if tiny claws were scrabbling across a wooden table. Staring yellow eyes flicker by the firelight and vanish quickly as half-seen shadows darting across the tunnel.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A natural cavern in the surrounding limestone forms a great bowl overhead, lit by a huge bonfire towards the eastern side. The firelight glows red off an onyx slab piled high with unmentionable offerings set before a carved niche in the stone. Piles of old gnawed bones are stacked in haphazard fashion along the northern wall, ending in a rounded opening heading west.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnel
node.description: Towering walls of greenish stone rise to either side and seem to press inward as you make your way through a natural crack in the stone. Misshapen muddy tracks on the stone floor look almost like rat tracks, but are far too large. Some of the tracks are smeared as if something had been dragged over them.

node.name: Graveyard, Tunnels
node.description: A broad round slab of polished marble dominates this tiny niche, covered in strange runic inscriptions. The walls are made of chiseled granite blocks, clashing with the natural limestone of the cavern outside. The floor around the slab is scratched and gouged, as if some burrowing animal has been digging at it.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Workshop
node.description: The stench of sulfur vies with the tingling effect of ozone in this cluttered workshop. An eclectic assortment of arcane ingredients line the cabinets and shelves. Odd glowing stains mark the floor, most likely the result of past experiments possibly gone awry, reflecting the light from twin gaethzen spheres set on marble pedestals.

node.name: Jadewater Mansion, Rear Entrance
node.description: A single heavy iron door breaks the monotony of the massive town wall. The triangular and flat rooftops of the north side of The Crossing rise above it, crowning the mansion directly beyond the wall in a dramatic cityscape. A narrow trail winds its way through patches of weeds and grasses into the northern wilds. There is a small window near the bottom of the wall, but the glass is covered in dirt.

node.name: Baearholt's Farmhold
node.description: Just off the Northern Trade Route stands an ivy-covered small brick building which houses Baearholt's Tavern. Part of the family farmhold, it is renowned for its meads and ale, all of which are brewed on the premises under Ivor Baearholt's exacting supervision.

node.name: Dense Copse
node.description: The branches of pine and birch trees loom overhead, overlapping to create a canopy that nearly chokes off almost all light from hitting what little green undergrowth is here. Dried needles and dead branches crackle underfoot with every step, the only sound that can be heard save those of the forlorn cries of a wood thrush in the distance.

node.name: Ruined Tollhouse, Interior
node.description: Heavy stone walls lean drunkenly on each other, like tipsy soldiers staggering into the night. Somehow, the roof has remained mostly intact, providing a modicum of shelter and warmth. The remains of a fire, now cold and lifeless, show that others have sought refuge here as well. A broken stone table is the only furnishing yet left to this abandoned station. In all, a sad reminder of busier times on this ancient road, when traffic and trade must have been much heavier.

node.name: Northeast Wilds, Handfaster's Glade
node.description: The soft, subtle fragrance of pine and roses mingles in an intoxicating cloud that perfumes the air and lingers in hair and clothing. A luxurious carpet of dark green unrolls within a circle of trees, the glowing reds, golds, and butter-yellow of dayroses adding color to the sea of emerald. A small path winds away from the glade and back toward a small well that seems as far away as a dream.

The soft, subtle fragrance of pine and orchids mingles in an intoxicating cloud that perfumes the air and lingers in hair and clothing. A luxurious carpet of muted green unrolls within a circle of trees, the glowing white of moonflowers adding flecks of creamy ivory to the sea of emerald. A small path winds away from the glade and back toward a small well that seems as far away as a dream.

node.name: Handfaster's Glade, Shrine to Saemaus
node.description: Soft-scented air fills the glade where patches of blooming tulips splash color against velvety grass tailor-made for bare feet. A lattice arch, covered with the pink blooms of jasmine honeysuckle, embraces and frames a small altar created from a living plant. Benches of polished wood invite couples to stop and bask in the beauty of the area and the warmth of heart's devotion.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rolling Hills
node.description: The old, abandoned Journalai Route runs through the rolling hills outside of the village of Kaerna like a winding brownish-green ribbon someone dropped and forgot. A few stones that might have been road markers still remain, cracked and weathered and lying, forsaken, to one side of the road.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rolling Hills
node.description: The Route continues to the east and west, while to the north you notice a dirt path that looks to have been tread by the passage of feet, not the passage of wagons. A trickling stream passes over the road, leaving mud and muck in its wake as it vanishes into the grasses of the surrounding hillside.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Trickling Stream
node.description: A dirt path cuts its way along the grassy bank of a thin stream, winding northwards to untamed hills, and southward back to the Journalai Route. The size of the stream's bed suggests that it must have been bigger once, but upheaval has changed it to a fraction of the size it used to be.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Trickling Stream
node.description: The stream splashes its way southeast, springing forth from underneath a set of rocks that jut out of the hill in front of you. A hollow log lies next to the creek, looking a tad out of place in this mostly treeless land.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Inside the Log
node.description: It is pitch black in here, too dark to see anything but light coming from a round hole to the south that is probably one end of the log, and a hole in the roof that leads up into dim light.

The log is surprisingly large inside, big enough for an Elf to crouch in without being cramped. The faint scent of rot that fills it does not make it a pleasant place to stay, however, and you feel oddly relieved that it is too dark in here to tell exactly what it is you are stepping in that squishes so.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Clear Pool
