node.description: The hills close in about you, monuments to greenery and life. A pool is cupped at the base of one of the hills, its surface constantly moving from unseen currents. A good-size hole opens up in the ground by one of the largest, steepest hills. It leads down into darkness, giving no hint of where it might go.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Grassy Knoll
node.description: The hills rise like frozen waves of cooled lava, their slopes leading down to a grassy knoll, as if in homage to something or someone. A ghostly night breeze gusts down from the high, untouched hilltops, creating a lonely song that whistles eerily through the night blackened stones of the knoll.

The hills rise like frozen waves, their slopes leading down to a grassy knoll, as if in homage to something or someone. A brisk breeze gusts downs from the high, untouched hilltops, creating a lonely song that whistles through the stones of the knoll.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Green Slope
node.description: Drained of their color, the hills display several hues of gray that ripples over them, creating a shadowy illusion of movement. The side of the hill you stand on slopes downward toward a tiny vale, while to the east it climbs back toward a dip where several hills meet.

Dazzling green hues spread over the surrounding hillside, creating a rippling illusion of movement. The side of the hill you stand on slopes downward toward a tiny vale, while to the east it climbs back toward a dip where several hills meet.

node.name: Rolling Hills, A Sheltered Vale
node.description: The grass grows thick and lush beneath your feet, while above you rise tall wiir trees in full flourish. The only disturbances are a set of large, unusual footprints that have crushed the tall grass, and the long marks, as if something heavy had been dragged through here, that accompany them.

node.name: Rolling Hills, A Sheltered Vale
node.description: The grass grows in a dark, soft circle here, inviting you to rest and relax, while tall wiir trees make a ring around the patch of green, their boughs intertwining in defense against the wind and rain. An opening in a set of rocks piled up by the side of a hill creates a cave-like shelter to further protect you from the elements.

node.name: Rolling Hills, A Sheltered Vale
node.description: The night leaches the grass of all color, turning everything to the color of ashes. Hillocks that rise up from the ground look strangely like corpses that have been covered in weeds and dirt, slowly boiling up out of the earth in shades of gray.

The grass grows in lush clumps beneath your feet, carpeting the tiny hillocks that rise up from the ground. A butterfly floats through the air as it makes its way from wildflower to wildflower, its wings bright and vivid.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Rocky Slope
node.description: The ground is sprinkled with bits of gravel and stone, making this steep slope an adventure in and of itself. Split boulders strewn across the ground prove to be good for catching your balance when dexterity gives way to gravity and the slippery mixture of skree and grass.

node.name: Rolling Hills
node.description: The hills shoulder the Route, observing all that passes down its fading trail with silent, unseen eyes.

node.name: Rolling Hills
node.description: Mountains to the west loom protectively over their smaller siblings, the hills. Somewhere to the northeast you can catch the occasional splishing sound that signals the presence of a river or stream nearby.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rockslide
node.description: A massive rockslide has cut off any further western passage along the Journalai Route by caravan, and the slide itself looks too unstable and massive to climb safely. You can catch a glimpse of sweeping forested mountainside just beyond the barrier, the caps of the peaks frosted with eternal snows.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rocky Hills
node.description: The ground is extremely stony here, and the sides of the hills are dotted with the broken remains of boulders. To the west you see mountain peaks, broken-edged etchings against the sky. Patches of grass grow sporadically amongst the gravel and stones through which you pick your way, and it is hard to distinguish where the sides of the Route end, and where the hills begin.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rolling Hills
node.description: Large stones crop out from the sides of the hills, bones jutting from the round flesh of the earth. Wild shrubs climb over the hillsides, their thorny vines tangling into one another. A gentle breeze rustles their leaves, passing like a ghost between the slopes. It is not enough, however, to dispel the faint tinge of rot that seems to hang in the air.

Large stones crop out from the sides of the hills, bones jutting from the round flesh of the earth. Wild roses climb over the hillsides, their bushes tangling into one another, and their fresh scent encircling you. It is not enough, however, to dispel the faint tinge of rot that seems to hang in the air.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rolling Hills
node.description: Slender, willowy trees grow along the side of the road on this part of the Route, their boughs intertwining to form a wild, beautiful arch of leaf and branch. From somewhere in the trees you hear the soft twitter of a single bird, the first you have heard in your entire time here.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rolling Hills
node.description: From here, the top of one of the tallest hills, you can see the lay of the land, rising and falling before and behind you. The Route winds onward to the east, and dwindles slowly toward the west.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rolling Hills
node.description: The silence here would be peaceful, if it weren't so intrusive. No birdsong, no movement of wildlife, just an empty, all-encompassing stillness, as if the green, wild hills that rise about you were holding their breath.

node.name: Rolling Hills, Inside a Small Cave
node.description: The floor of the cave is sandy, while the back of it seems to be made of dirt. It is relatively small, but well-lit, its opening leading out into a lush vale. A small firering composed of blackened stones and cold ashes occupies the center of the cave.

node.name: A Clear Pool
node.description: Around you stand the high hills of the countryside, their broken reflections rippling in the pool, while all about you spreads cool, cold water, running deep and moving slowly with unseen currents. From time to time a bubble pops on the surface, creating a gentle stir over the water.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rocky Pass
node.description: High walls of stone rise up on either side of the rocky pass as this hidden spur of the Journalai Route branches off toward forested mountain slopes. Small clumps of heather find unreliable purchase alongside the road where time and nature have pulverized the fallen boulders to ragged piles of gravel.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rocky Pass
node.description: Westward, the high stone walls close in more tightly overhead, completely blocking the view of the nearby mountains. A chance avalanche would be disastrous for anyone passing along the road.

node.name: Journalai Route, Rocky Pass
node.description: The walls are barely shoulder-width here, closing out all but a narrow strip of sky above. Shattered slabs of fallen granite clog most of the path and stray breezes bring showers of tiny pebbles and stone dust from above. The faint light makes maneuvering difficult as the fallen boulders appear no more than vague shadows within the gloom.

node.name: Journalai Cavern, Narrow Fissure
node.description: Squeezing through the small gap is hard going as the rough walls seem to grasp for exposed skin at every chance. The fissure extends back a good distance into the northern cliff, then vanishes around a corner.

node.name: Journalai Cavern, Abandoned Camp
node.description: Someone has used this small hidden cavern as a refuge in the past. There's a circle of stones containing the remains of a campfire and a narrow vent in the ceiling provides ample ventilation for escaping smoke.

node.name: Journalai Route, Shadowy Cul-de-sac
node.description: The road ends in this dark cul-de-sac, providing no visible means of escape for anyone caught unaware from behind. Scattered bones from some unidentifiable victim gleam softly in the darkness. Deep shadows surround the perimeter of the area and the faint scent of burning charcoal hangs in the air.

node.name: Journalai Route, Dim Passage
node.description: The dim passage is a good deal larger than it looks from a distance. From the texture of the walls and the chips of granite covering the floor, it's apparent the tunnel is not a natural formation. Someone carved a trail between the cul-de-sac and whatever lies beyond the wall.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Dim Tunnel
node.description: The path underfoot is treacherous and strewn with gravel chips painstakingly carved from the rock wall. This end of the tunnel opens through a granite arch onto a limestone valley. The scent of burning charcoal is much stronger here.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Granite Arch
node.description: A granite arch opens into the base of an unusual stone wall. Nearly thirty feet tall, the granite wall is encrusted with shimmering quartz crystals. Although the crystals have been removed as high as can be readily reached, the remaining strip extends along the southern wall of the valley in brilliant display.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Crystal Wall
node.description: The crystals end abrubtly at the eastern wall of the valley, refracting pinpoints of light against a limestone backdrop. The slight inward tilt of the limestone cliffs precludes any possibility of scaling them.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Eastern Wall
node.description: The greyish-white wall leans in over the tar pit where the path narrows to a few feet across. A fine rain of chalky powder continually drifts down from above, dislodged by stray breezes.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Northern Wall
node.description: Thin striations of pure pink marble can be seen embedded in the limestone. The veins are scarce, but time will create a rich harvest for future miners.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Marble Gate
node.description: A tall arch is carved into the wall and set with a solid marble gate. Although there's no apparent locking mechanism, the gate is solidly closed. Fresh air drifts through the narrow crack around the slab carrying a hint of pine.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Northern Wall
node.description: The skeleton of a mid-size feline lies here in disarray and several large chunks of limestone are shattered beneath the remains. It appears the edge of the cliff gave way while the luckless animal investigated the valley from above. A far quicker death than the slowly suffocating fumes of the pit.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Western Wall
node.description: The path here is thick with spatters from the pit, making each step a challenge. An extremely large bubble of tar hisses and burbles, slowly releasing a steady stream of gas and black ooze.

node.name: Limestone Valley, Marble Vein
node.description: Between the crystal-encrusted granite and the chalky lime runs a thick vein of pure ivory marble. An ambitious Halfling miner was unsuccessful in attempts to reap some of nature's bounty before being overcome by the fumes. Nothing but a skeleton and a few tattered scraps of clothing are left.

node.name: River's Bank, Eddy
node.description: An outcropping of rock juts into the river, breaking the flow of the current just enough to create an eddy. Over time, a small sandbar has formed at the base of the stone bridge and occasionally catches floating debris. High grasses along the bank nearly hide a small path that leads up and around to the top of the bridge on the southern bank.

node.name: Kaerna Village, At the Well
node.description: The well has been craftily made of smooth interlocking stones. A closer look reveals that no mortar was used in its construction despite its circular shape. A wooden roof protects it from dirt and debris, and a fruitless modwyn vine twines all around. Dappled shadows created by the moonlight give this place a sense of mystery and wonder.

The well has been craftily made of smooth interlocking stones. A closer look reveals that no mortar was used in its construction, despite its circular shape. A wooden roof protects it from dirt and debris, and a fruitless modwyn vine twines all around. The grass beneath you is springy and soft, inviting you to lie down and dream the days away in the warmth of the sun.

node.name: Kaerna Village, Near The Well
node.description: Meandering eastward from the village well, a grassy footpath follows a gentle decline away from the bustle of the Northern Trade road and through a small copse of oak and aspen trees. Wildflowers grow in abundant banks on either side of the path, their delicate blossoms evolving with the seasons in an endless, ever-changing cycle of color and fragrance.

node.name: Kaerna Village, A Grassy Footpath
node.description: A chattering brook traverses the footpath in a stony bed, its crystal waters dancing and sparkling over smooth grey rocks and the deep brown remnants of long-fallen logs. Embedded in the soft earth either side of the stream, a broad ironwood plank forms a narrow bridge, allowing visitors to balance across the brook and continue eastward toward the village gate.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Gate
node.description: A low sandstone wall runs around Lower Kaerna, the modest proportions of the perimeter suggesting the villagers have few enemies other than the occasional adventurous bovine. The village gate struggles with the attentions of a voracious ivy that pokes its brazen fingers into every nook and cranny of the surrounding stone and clings determinedly to the pristine paintwork. An ironwood plank leads west across a nearby stream.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Green
node.description: The gate opens onto a charming village green surrounded by quaint cottages and tranquil rural lanes. In remarkable contrast with the fervent activity of Kaerna's west end, the rustic simplicity of Lower Kaerna envelopes the senses and blots out any memory of life on the trade routes. No matter what activity might be taking place on or around the green, nothing here is done at any pace greater than an amble.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Green
node.description: The village pond occupies the best part of the northwest green, its brown waters rippling with the fussy antics of ducks and the occasional splash of a jumping fish. Around the edge of the pond, tall bulrushes sway gently in the breeze, parting just enough to grant a glimpse of moorhens and a pair of haughty swans nesting silently in the shallows.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, High Street
node.description: Overlooking the lilies and willows growing in and around the village pond, the homes here have a sleepy look about them, their light curtains blowing softly from the wide-open windows which typify this safe and peaceful hamlet. There is little activity to disturb the tranquil silence, save for the intermittent chirp of a bird or a soft splash of fin or feather in the quiet waters.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Lady Alice Drive
node.description: A narrow, cobbled lane leads off from the quiet end of High Street and forms a gently arcing crescent from one side of the tiny village to the other. Lined with quaint thatched cottages and charming sandstone dwellings, Lady Alice Drive meanders through the serene village like a lazy smile, encouraging travelers along its sedate curve to adopt a pleasureable, unhurried gait.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Lady Alice Drive
node.description: The drive narrows to little more than a carriage width here, squeezing between two matching whitewashed cottages that stand aside the passageway as if expecting to take tolls from passers-by. A lush modwyn vine climbs recklessly up the side of each building, attracting a wide variety of dazzling butterflies and tiny birds to the deep tangle of its foliage and slender branches.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Lady Alice Drive
node.description: A constant, fresh breeze slips around the crescent, its long journey down from the mountains and moorland beyond Kaerna drawing to a close in the sleepy hamlet. From time to time, the sharp fragrance of pine and the peaty smell of damp earth wends its way into the village, giving a gentle reminder that there is indeed a wider, wilder world outside the encircling walls.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Lady Alice Drive
node.description: The tantalizing aroma of fresh-baked bread and cakes wafts about on a light breeze regardless of the time of day, as if many of the locals spend most of their time steadfastly producing confections in industrious and cozy kitchens. A trestle table standing in the garden of one cottage bears a tempting selection of the day's culinary produce, proudly offered to passers-by for the sampling.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Lady Alice Drive
node.description: Carefully planted in evenly spaced rows of fat wooden buckets, miniature fir and poplar trees line the drive with splashes of deep green. Complementing the neat display, oaken planters bursting with seasonal blooms adorn the windowsills of many of the homes, combining the beauty of the wild with the modest gentility of the village.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Lady Alice Drive
node.description: Just north of the comparative bustle of Fourways, Lady Alice Drive begins its easy dawdle around the upper end of the village. Countless rows of neat cobbles run the length of the lane as it curves past immaculate cottages and snug lodges, each home a picture-perfect tribute to the houseproud families who populate this tiny town.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Fourways
node.description: By Lower Kaerna standards, Fourways is a throbbing thoroughfare, given that the only two roads of any size meet here. Even so, the pace of life is relaxing to say the least, and those few folk who do choose to pass a moment here do little more than watch the world go by. A small bronze statue on a stone pedestal occupies the central point of the crossroads.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Green
node.description: Overlooking the carefully-tended lawns of the village green, a row of smart stone and thatch cottages enjoys a pleasing, scenic location. Four vast oak trees stand aside the narrow road at the edge of the green, their thick trunks and spreading boughs dark with age. Rooks' nests form a rambling roost along many of the branches, sending forth the occasional raucous squawk as one feathered resident disputes territory with another.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Green
node.description: An old wagon wheel idles in one corner of the Green, as if to remind visitors to leave their work behind them and succumb to a more placid way of life. Between its spokes, the green-keepers have planted a variety of low shrubs, the contrasting hues of their foliage creating a fascinating monument to indolence resplendent with different textures and colors.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Green
node.description: Running along the south side of the green, a narrow path leads past a group of tiny cabins that almost disappear into a thick copse of aspen and sweet chestnut trees. Despite their modesty, each humble dwelling appears spotlessly clean and diligently maintained, their secluded location in the village's only uncombed spot is clearly a careful choice made by fastidious and discerning people.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Blythe Lane
node.description: Between a pair of whitewashed lodges, the rustic beginnings of Blythe Lane lead off from the green to bring a pleasing impression of the surrounding countryside into the village. The lane itself is actually a narrow, stony path bordered by vigorous cowslips and flowering nettles which flourish in cool, verdant banks outside snug homesteads and at the feet of overhanging sycamores.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Blythe Lane
node.description: Enclosing the path, a tall hawthorn and beech hedge thins out periodically to allow passage through to the cottages and cabins which nestle peacefully in their woodsy lots. Thin plumes of blue-grey smoke drift from squat chimneys and waft across the lane in a faintly shifting haze, bringing to mind reassuring memories of hearth and home.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Blythe Lane
node.description: Blythe Lane draws to a drowsy close inside the village wall, where a bank of aromatic thyme and lavender grows strong and robust beneath the vine-clad grey and yellow sandstone. Several of the homes in this area boast a similar display of scented herbs in their front gardens, infusing the air with a memorably pungent perfume reminiscent of a warm, dewy morning in the countryside.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, High Street
node.description: High Street continues its gentle progress to the east, its smooth sandstone paving diligently swept free of any dust and debris which might settle for half a moment. The homes which claim this part of town are slightly larger than the average Lower Kaerna cottage, and each owner clearly takes great pride in preserving the superiority of the neighborhood.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, High Street
node.description: Many of the homes here have matching curtains and gardens displaying identical selections of shrubs and blossoms, suggesting the sense of community in Lower Kaerna is particularly strong. Large, wrought-iron flower baskets hang from tall blackwood poles at intervals along High Street, their lively displays of trailing ivy and seasonal wildflowers adding a simple yet elegant adornment to the street.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, High Street
node.description: High Street draws to a close in a crescent following the curve of the village wall. A half-circle of homes occupies the spacious turnaround, their sparkling windows and glossy paintwork a gleaming reflection of their owners' pride. A box privet hedge borders the walkway around the crescent, intermittently giving way to numerous white gravel paths that lead to the front door of each dwelling.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, High Street
node.description: A row of neat homes runs across the northern side of the green, the grandly-named High Street more of a country lane than the major artery its nomenclature might suggest. Each dwelling here seems to take great pride in its prime location, presenting to the public a meticulously maintained facade complete with colorful curtains and window-boxes brimming with seasonal blooms.

node.name: Lower Kaerna, Village Pond
node.description: A group of wooden benches sits at the edge of the pond beneath a swaying willow that dabbles its long fingers in the shallow waters. Broad lilypads cover the surface of the pond, their white and purple flowers smiling up at the sky. Fat fish swim lazily among the trailing mass of roots and reeds under a rickety jetty, taunting local anglers with the intermittent flash of light on silver scales.

node.name: Village Pond, The Old Jetty
node.description: Jutting out from a marshy section of the pond shore, an elderly jetty hovers over the water. The wobbly, uneven surface of the walkway, and the occasional gap where one plank has fallen away completely, conspire to make an unplanned trip into the dark waters a distinct likelihood. Bits of old bait and scraps of fishing line have attached themselves determinedly to splinters in the ancient wood.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, Entry Hall
node.description: A front desk manned by a young Elven woman is all that composes this corridor-like room. She smiles gently up at you from where she is working on embroidering a linen tunic with simple but bright flowers. A sign behind her states the inn's fees for lodging, and stairs to her right lead up to the inn's bedrooms.

A front desk manned by a small Elven boy is all that composes this corridor-like room. The boy nods at you as you enter, his elbows on an open ledger book and a bored look on his impish face. A sign behind him states the inn's fees for lodging, and stairs to his right lead up to the inn's bedrooms.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, Tavern
node.description: Spacious and open, the tavern allows for plenty of breathing room. Axes, swords, and shields decorate the walls, all scratched with the wear of battle and all safely nailed in place that a patron might not grab one in a fit of drunken rage. Situated behind the bar is a tall, muscular Elven woman with long red braids. Judging from her demeanor and the way she handles the people who work and eat here, this can only be the owner, Savrin Kaerna.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, Private Room
node.description: Small but comfortable, a cheery fireside takes up a good part of the eastern wall. The floor is covered with fur throws and a few overstuffed chairs complement the feeling of security and warmth.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, Secluded Booth
node.description: This booth has been set aside from the rest of the tavern for those who wish more intimate conversation. There is a clean table with a vase here, and padded seats for the weary. Someone has gone to the trouble to make sure that there are real candles to light the otherwise darkened corner, and every now and then a server comes over to check the wicks and replenish the ones that are beginning to gutter.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, Quarters
node.description: This room is so tidy it is militant. A small iron stove provides warmth, and a few cots in a corner are set up for sleeping purposes. Someone has carelessly left a doll lying on the floor.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, Top of the Stairs
node.description: Plain instead of fancy, this corridor of rooms is spotless, the wood solid and slightly gray from the wear and tear of time. You can just make out the sounds of the tavern proper below you, the noise creeping through the scuffed floorboards and faded red carpeting.

node.name: The Gilded Unicorn, A Cozy Room
node.description: This room is set up with the intent of making one person comfortable and two people snug. The floor is wooden but freshly swept, and a set of faded yellow curtains have been drawn back from the window. A dresser with a water-filled basin set on top of it and a bed are the only pieces of furniture here, but you get the feeling that any more would have left the room cramped and cluttered.

node.name: Drathrok's Cave, Dance Training Area
node.description: A pungent animal odor pervades this somewhat cramped cave, with its moist dirt floor and undulating rock walls. Several timbers placed end to end mark off a mounded patch of earth at the widest point in the room, where the light of several dim torches also reveals deep claw markings in stones leaning against a long, narrow table.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Village Gate
node.description: A picturesque village extends north from the town gate. Quaint buildings, built specifically for those of short stature, border the lanes. A kaleidoscopic array of color is displayed in every direction ... in the clothing of the Halflings, the painted buildings, and the lushly-hued blossoms covering the neatly tended beds and flowering trees. A house, constructed to accommodate the hired Human guard, is situated next to the gate. He stands at ease, casually perusing the incoming traffic.

node.name: Marja Tee, Tula Veraja
node.description: A well-worn road winds its way through the valley, between a small town and the adjoining farmlands. A proliferation of berry bushes crowds the edges as if trying to reclaim the portion of land heavily rutted by wagon and cart wheels. To the north a village gate beckons weary travelers.

node.name: Marja Tee, Tula Veraja
node.description: Berry bushes and green shrubs grow between the trunks of elm and birch trees. Overhead, the soft hoot of an owl calls to its mate. Numerous golden lights of a small community flicker to the distant northwest.

Berry bushes and green shrubs grow between the trunks of elm and birch trees. Sparrows flutter out of the high branches to light gracefully on a twig, grab a ripe berry, and wing back to their perches. In the distant northwest a small village can be seen.

node.name: Marja Tee, Musikaz Masi
node.description: Tracks left by wagons laden with heavy cargo mar the road with deep ruts. A multitude of blackberry bushes, full of plump berries, mingle with a few scattered trees that line each side of this wide byway.

node.name: Marja Tee, Musikaz Masi
node.description: The road crests a small hill covered with ripe blackberry bushes. Dozens of squashed berries have been imbedded into the packed earth by the wheels of overloaded wagons. Occasionally a bird swoops down to greedily grab a tiny black treasure from a mature bush.

node.name: Marja Tee, Orjamakaz Niitto
node.description: Small shrubs growing in tight clumps line the road on both sides. Nestled in the brush are dense clusters of briarberry bushes with tiny berries hanging from woody stems.

node.name: Marja Tee, Orjamakaz Niitto
node.description: Meandering gently through a dense meadow, the road is evenly covered in tiny stones laid to smooth the rough terrain. Endless rows of briarberry bushes, cultivated and harvested for their woody roots, border each side of the wide road.

node.name: Marja Tee, Orjamakaz Niitto
node.description: The road continues its trek through the lush meadow. Flowers of all kinds grow haphazardly among dense groupings of briarberry bushes filled with bright red berries. Irrigation ditches filled with rainwater line both sides of the road.

node.name: Marja Tee, Orjamakaz Niitto
node.description: A wooden cart filled with freshly dug briarberry bushes is parked on the side of the roadway. Coveted for their woody roots in the making of tobacco pipes, briarberry bushes are carefully harvested annually by the local Olvi families of the area.

A wooden cart filled with freshly dug briarberry bushes is parked on the side of the roadway. Coveted for their woody roots in the making of tobacco pipes, briarberry bushes are carefully harvested annually by the local Olvi families of the area. Deep in the meadow, you can see a small group of Olvi thinning the denser clumps.

node.name: Marja Tee, Orjamakaz Niitto
node.description: The road narrows a little here, as briarberry bushes laden with heavy plump berries mingle with wild cinnamon shrubs that fight to reclaim this well traveled byway. Scattered amidst the dense brush are a few birch and elm trees, with occasional clumps of pink clover peeking through the heavy brambles.

node.name: Marja Tee, Girio Masi
node.description: Hardy, wild cinnamon shrubs grace both sides of the road as the path widens. Their leathery leaves offer an open invitation to a mass influx of butterflies that migrate to this area in the spring. Occasionally, the sound of small wildlife can be heard scurrying beneath the compact bushes.

node.name: Marja Tee, Girio Masi
node.description: The road crests a small hill flanked by dense clumps of wild cinnamon shrubs. The shadowed bushes resemble tiny gnomelike creatures tottering imperceptibly as the night breeze causes the leaves to gently sway.

The road crests a small hill flanked by dense clumps of wild cinnamon shrubs. A multitude of migrating butterflies can be seen fluttering amidst the bushes, their beautifully colored wings complimenting the deep green of the leathery leafed shrubs.

node.name: Marja Tee, Marja Poosa Sappa
node.description: A shallow gully runs across the road at the bottom of a small hill. Thick walls of bushes grow wildly like untamed hedgerows bordering the road.

node.name: Marja Tee, Marja Poosa Sappa
node.description: The road here snakes through some of the thickest bushes and brambles. Fragrant cinnamon mixes with sweet raspberry in a panoply of earthy, spiced scents.

node.name: Marja Tee, Marja Poosa Sappa
node.description: Bushes and vines grow wildly, high enough to block out most of the sky. The road dips and weaves through high bushes and snarls of vicious brambles.

node.name: Marja Tee, Marja Poosa Sappa
node.description: The narrow road rises up to the peak of a small hill, rife with tangled bushes. A broken, berry-stained wooden pail lies shattered on the side of the road.

node.name: Marja Tee, Marja Poosa Sappa
node.description: The path glides gently down a low rise toward the open ocean. A small step ladder stands to one side of the road, overcome by creeping vines of bramble and raspberry.

node.name: Marja Tee, Kaber Jise
node.description: A soft breeze carries the faint scent of the sea from the east. The road begins to widen as if to hasten travelers towards the shore. Interspersed with bramble and berry bushes are wild sirese flowers, their bright blooms swaying gently in the wind.

node.name: Marja Tee, Babukaz Masi
node.description: Dozens of wild raspberry bushes intermingled with clumps of sweet woodruff attempt to encroach upon the widening road. Small woodland critters scamper beneath the brush, knocking ripe berries to the ground.

node.name: Marja Tee, Babukaz Masi
node.description: Atop a small hill, the road crests just high enough to see a bay to the east. The fresh smell from the sea is strong and mingles with the scent of ripe raspberries that hang from the many bushes attempting to trespass upon the widening road.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Busar Saaf
node.description: A small harbor with several brightly painted docks cheerfully greets seafaring visitors to the small community of Arthe Dale. A few seagulls can be seen greedily pecking at ripe berries pilfered from the many bushes that flank a road leading westward.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Taffelberry Path
node.description: Taffelberry Path, named after the favorite food of the Arthe Dale residents, is a straight, well-kept lane that heads further into the village to the north and back to the village gate to the south. A group of rollicking Halfling lads passes you, laughing and elbowing each other, as they move eagerly toward an attractive red building to the east.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Taffelberry Path
node.description: Open areas flank both sides of the path at this point. A charming little park extends to the west, and an open-air marketplace is situated to the east. A Halfling pushing a wheelbarrow filled with fresh vegetables heads toward one of the market's wooden stands.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Greensward
node.description: This charming park is alive with a medley of brilliant colors and sachet scents coming from the beds of primrose, hollyhock, larkspur and delphinium. An iridescent green hummingbird darts from flower to flower, trying to avoid a group of giggling Halfling children who are rolling and somersaulting in the grass. The carved garden bench looks like a pleasant spot to sit and enjoy the scene. You can see a small shrine to the west, while a thumping sound comes from beyond the bushes to the north.

The park takes on a special magic at night when the tall spires of white delphinium and the beds of evening primrose luminously reflect the moonlight with a silvery glow, adding a delicate perfume to the night air. A young Halfling couple passes you, strolling hand in hand and whispering softly to each other. A carved garden bench provides a peaceful place to sit and enjoy the pleasant stillness of the night.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Taffelberry Path
node.description: The path continues north and south, lined with a row of colorful sicle trees to the east and low bushes to the west. A small meadow mouse, alarmed by your approach, scurries through an opening in the bushes.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Crossroads
node.description: The village's three main paths meet at this intersection. Attractive shops with brightly colored awnings line Glaysker Lane to the east. The quiet, shrub-bordered Tanglefoot Row heads north to the residential section, and you can see the village gate at the end of Taffelberry Path to the south.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Tanglefoot Row
node.description: Tall, neatly-pruned hedgerows line the street, providing some privacy for the homes beyond, where Halfling residents move about, absorbed in domestic chores. On one side a small woman hangs freshly washed pink and yellow sheets from a line, and on the other a man works at whitewashing a fence. A small dragonfly whirs past you, alighting on one of the hedges briefly before continuing on its journey.

Tall, neatly-pruned hedgerows line the street, providing some privacy for the homes beyond, where warm lights glow in the darkness. In one window, you can see a small man playing a fiddle, and a foot-tapping tune is carried down the lane with the breeze. Another frames a Halfling couple standing in a lit doorway, lovingly gazing at their sleeping children. A radiant firebug hovers in front of you for a moment before continuing on its journey through the night.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Tanglefoot Row
node.description: A small dwelling has been built into the side of a hill here. White curtains flutter in the windows that open out from the sod-covered walls. Several small carving tools have been left on a wooden bench, and bits of wood shavings lay discarded below it.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Tanglefoot Row
node.description: The lane ends to the north at the eccentric home of Arthe Dale's oldest, largest and wealthiest family, the Tanglefoots. A freshly-painted white picket fence surrounds the property, and you can see a large well-tended yard beyond it.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Cul-de-sac
node.description: The path circles around a bed of dark green ivy that has grown up over a white statue standing in the center. A bright yellow building with blue shutters and colorful flowerboxes faces you. There is a painted sign mounted next to the open doorway. A Halfling female, her nose stuck in a notebook, wanders by, almost bumping into you as she heads toward the building. She absentmindedly knocks on the sign (for luck?), as she enters the doorway, still concentrating on her notes.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Greensward
node.description: This section of the park is an unadorned grassy strip, edged with low bushes. At the far end a painted target has been set up. A large number of rocks lay discarded at its base. A Halfling man whirls his sling and sends a stone hurtling toward the target, hitting it dead center with a loud thunk.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Shrine
node.description: A simple shrine has been erected in the niche of a large stony outcrop. Moonflower vines climb the column, twining their way around the opening, their brilliant white blossoms providing a festive border. A carved figure of Glythtide has been set inside the niche.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Greensward
node.description: A giant oak tree stands erect here, its massive branches reaching out to form a canopy over the local swimming hole. Some sort of wooden structure is nestled in the foliage high up in the tree. The grassy area surrounding the swimming hole appears to be a perfect spot for picnicking or lounging.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Tree House
node.description: This wooden house has been constructed in the upper branches of the old oak tree as a play area for any of the village children daring enough to venture up to this height. A colorful rug braided from strips of yellow, blue and green cloth covers the floor, and several plump pillows are scattered around it. One wall opens out to a narrow ramp that extends along a heavy branch.

node.name: Tree House, Ramp
node.description: The narrow wooden ramp extends out from the tree along one of its branches. Oak leaves rustle softly around you, and through them the lights from Arthe Dale's homes twinkle like bright fireflies. From somewhere off in the distance, the sweet melody of a lone flute hovers in the air. Suspended high above the swimming hole, the branch is a good place for making an impressive dive into the water directly below. An open doorway behind you leads back into the treehouse.

The narrow wooden ramp extends out from the tree along one of its branches. Oak leaves rustle softly around you, and through them a panoramic view of Arthe Dale is spread out in all directions. Suspended high above the swimming hole, it occurs to you that you could make an impressive dive into the deep water from this height. An open doorway behind you leads back into the treehouse.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Swimming Hole
node.description: Clear water fills this natural swimming hole - cool and briskly refreshing, it ripples over the smooth rock bottom. Rays of moonlight filter through the oak tree's branches that form a leafy roof overhead.

Clear water fills this natural swimming hole - cool and briskly refreshing, it ripples over the smooth rock bottom. Rays of light filter through the oak tree's branches that form a leafy roof overhead.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Swimming Hole
node.description: A flowering crabtree grows beside the pond, stretching out its branches over the still waters and casting its pale pink blossoms in the breeze. Tall hedges edge the swimming hole here, blocking off the view of the surrounding greensward.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Swimming Hole
node.description: Tiny brown pondskippers hop along the cool clear water, creating ripples of outwardly expanding circles. Tall hedges edge the swimming hole here, blocking off the view of the surrounding greensward.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Swimming Hole
node.description: Creamy white water lilies float lazily along the surface of the water, emitting a sweet, heady scent in the air. Tall hedges edge the swimming hole here, blocking off the view of the surrounding greensward.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Inn Courtyard
node.description: This is the courtyard of an old-fashioned country inn, stoutly constructed of red brick. Beds of cheery marigolds border the building, while a colorful signboard hangs from a sunflower-yellow awning above the door. Sounds of laughter and happy conversation drift from an open window. A little dirt path curves around toward the rear of the inn.

The door of this stout brick building stands open, and warm light pours out invitingly. A large signboard hanging from an awning sways in the breeze, making creaking noises that accompany the sounds of laughter, singing and merriment coming from an open window. A little dirt path curves around toward the rear of the inn.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Farmers' Market
node.description: The Arthe Dale market is bustling with activity day and night. Early morning travelers often stop in to chat with other adventurers, as they look over the local farmers' bountiful displays of fresh produce and home-baked treats, while late night visitors to the adjacent inn's common room usually come by for a sobering cup of hot coffee before heading home. Plain wooden tables and benches offer a place for snacking, rest or conversation.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Caravan Stable
node.description: The fresh smell of hay and the sounds of snorts and whinnies fill the immaculately-tended stable. The ponies belonging to the guests and the Burdock family are diligently looked after here by young Nubbin Burdock. The young Halfling boy pauses in his grooming chores to pull a sicle fruit from his pocket and feed it to one of the ponies.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Community Garden
node.description: Row upon row of cabbages, carrots, potatoes and turnips have been planted in this garden plot. The industrious Halflings of Arthe Dale have maintained it well. The rows are neatly arranged, and there is not a weed in sight. A tiny ladybug flutters from plant to plant, sometimes thrown off her course by the gentle breeze.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Community Garden
node.description: A large section of the garden plot has been set aside for the small shrubs of deep green glossy leaves that bear the village's beloved taffelberries. The branches of the low-growing bushes are laden with juicy black berries.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Community Garden
node.description: A modwyn vine arbor stands on the eastern edge of the garden. Heavy clusters of grape-like modwyn fruit hang temptingly, waiting to be picked. A large, low vat sits off to the side of the arbor.

node.name: Farmer's Market, Refreshment Stand
node.description: The mouth-watering aroma of baking dough and cinnamon makes your stomach rumble as you examine the tempting treats displayed in the glass case. A Halfling lass adds a tray of freshly baked crullers to the tantalizing array.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Front Room
node.description: The Arthe Hollow Inn has a warm, homey atmosphere, accentuated by the comfortably low ceilings and the acanth wood paneling. The murmur of conversation and a ripple of laughter come from an open archway. Wilibald Burdock, the exceptionally short (even by Halfling standards) and completely round innkeeper, is carefully polishing the paneling to a glossy finish.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Secluded Corner
node.description: A pitted brass sconce bearing a sputtering candle casts a cheerful glow upon this cozy niche. Nestled close to a small oak table is a wooden chair with a colorful soft cushion tied to the seat with bright orange twine. Securely attached to the acanth wood paneling is a sturdy shelf.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Hallway
node.description: The small low hallway leads to some of the guests' chambers. Judging from the height of the ceiling, only a Halfling would enjoy a stay in this section of the inn. A round green door leads to one of the rooms.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Sicle Room
node.description: The apple green walls of this cheerful room are accented with three still-life paintings of bright red sicle fruit. A small feather bed is covered with a soft down comforter, and a canary yellow chair sits next to a round window. A bowl of fresh sicle fruit has been placed on a small table next to the chair.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Corridor
node.description: The upward sloping ceilings and tall doors make this area more comfortable for the guests of a larger size. The acanth wood paneling from the front room continues down the hall, and the walls above it are painted a creamy pale yellow. A carved wooden door is trimmed with a flowery design.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Rose Room
node.description: A sizable four-poster bed, covered with a deep green flowery comforter, is the focal point of this tasteful room. A wing chair, upholstered in the same forest green print, sits in the corner next to a mahogany end table. The walls are the palest doeskin tan, and the windows are draped with milky white fabric. A rosy water pitcher in a matching ceramic bowl has been placed on the table.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Common Room
node.description: The room is filled with jovial conversation, laughter, much toasting and a layer of smoky haze. Guests of all races mingle at the long, low tables. A Halfling holding a very large mug of beer jumps in front of the stone fireplace, lets out a whoop and bursts into a spontaneous song. Daisy Burdock, the inn's waitress, maneuvers adeptly through the crowd carrying a tray of mugs and occasionally glancing out the window. A menu is posted at the archway next to a prominent sign.

The room is filled with long, low tables and stools, where several people sit eating hearty bowls of Arthe Hollow's popular lamb stew. A large stone fireplace dominates one wall. Daisy Burdock, the inn's cook and waitress, crosses the room carrying a precarious arrangement of bowls and plates. She stops briefly to tease and joke with a regular customer or glance out the window. A sign is posted prominently next to the archway.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Dance Hall
node.description: This low, snug hall is filled with music and laughter at all hours of the day and night, as the village residents never seem to lose their passion for dance and drink. Silk streamers dyed with vibrant reds, blues and yellows drape out from the center of the ceiling and hang down the walls. Lively music is provided by a group of Halfling minstrels, and the heady aroma of roasted meat wafts through the air.

node.name: Arthe Hollow Inn, Cellar
node.description: Candle sconces light the stone cellar, revealing walls lined with wine racks and rows of beer kegs. A worktable takes up the center of the room, and a wooden cabinet sits nearby. Despite the dimly lit dampness, the room is immaculately neat with not a cobweb in sight.

node.name: Swotting Hall, Public Foyer
node.description: Traders mill about in the foyer, dressed in fine clothing of colorful silken or woolen fabrics sparkled with gleaming gold and jewels. You pick up bits of conversation about the current prices or the quality of goods in various areas, as the tradesmen wander past you. Occasionally, a young student, notebook in hand, moves meekly among them with a wide-eyed, awed expression.

node.name: Small Dwelling, Main Room
node.description: The walls of this one-room cottage are painted a dappled pale blue and white. Woven blue-green fabric shot with pale peach covers the bed and adjacent loveseat. The white curtains on the window rise and fall gently with the breeze. A carved walking stick rests on a workbench surrounded by tiny curls of wood.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Front Yard
node.description: This long, low building is a strange and fascinating sight to behold. Enlarged over the years by various creative builders, it contains several add-on sections, each constructed from completely different materials and each displaying its own oddly-shaped windows in the forms of circles, crosses, crescents and stars. The many clashing parts manage to merge together into a whimsically enchanting whole. A painted sign is mounted on the carved wooden door.

Bright shapes of circles, crosses, crescents and stars glow mysteriously, floating in the darkness in front of you like a row of jack-o-lanterns. You notice the dim silhouette of an oddly shaped building behind them, and you realize that the glowing shapes are brightly lit windows. A sign has been mounted on the door of the house.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Living Room
node.description: This cheerful room might once have been considered pleasantly decorated. The lustrous sheen of the dark wood paneling and the artfully carved trim can still be seen in places, but much of the pleasant decor has been obscured by the incredible collection of souvenirs, knick-knacks, and various odds and ends that fill every nook and cranny. As a result, the room has the same comfortable, thrown-together appeal as the outside of the house. Several chairs are gathered cozily in front of a stone fireplace.

The glow from the burning fireplace fills the room with a warm light. An incredible collection of souvenirs, knickknacks, toys and various odds and ends fills every nook and cranny of the room, casting peculiarly-shaped shadows on the walls.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Woolly's Room
node.description: This austere room belongs to the head of the Tanglefoot family. A narrow bed covered with a brown flannel blanket and a plain wooden table and chair are the only furnishings here. An old worn duffel bag sits in the corner, unused for years, but never forgotten. A small sword is mounted on the wall above a wooden rack holding several hand-carved pipes.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Nursery
node.description: This is the room that houses the youngest of the Tanglefoot clan. The ceiling has been fancifully painted sky blue with fleecy white clouds. There are several short beds here, each neatly covered with a colorful quilt. A large wooden cupboard takes up most of one wall, and occasionally a tiny Halfling child rushes into the room, grabs something from the cupboard, and bounces out happily. Star-shaped windows overlook the garden, and stalks of snapdragons peek over the sills.

This is the room that houses the youngest of the Tanglefoot clan. There are several short beds here, each neatly covered with a colorful quilt, and each quilt covering the form of a small sleeping child. A large wooden cupboard takes up most of one wall.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Dining Room
node.description: A huge oaken table dominates this large room. This is the gathering place for the entire Tanglefoot clan. A large assortment of straight-backed wooden chairs surround the long table, and a white runner edged with embroidered yellow butterflies and blue morning glories spans the length. White ceramic candle sconces with the same butterflies and flowers are spaced regularly around the walls at a convenient height.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Kitchen
node.description: This cheery room is kept immaculately clean. Round windows, curtained in bright yellow gingham, open out to the garden. A reed basket, overflowing with crisp lettuce and bright red radishes, has been placed on a trestle table in front of the windows. A brilliant blue pitcher filled with yellow tulips sits next to the basket. The delicious aroma of baking bread wafts from a large oven.

The kitchen is quiet and dark at this time of the night, but there are signs of someone's late snack left next to an old ice box. The windows are open, and an evening breeze ruffles the curtains. Ingredients for tomorrow morning's bread have been neatly arranged on the trestle table.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Kitchen Garden
node.description: A small kitchen garden is set conveniently close to the back door of the house. Neat rows of lettuce and spinach fill the plot with alternating stripes of pale and deep greens. Off in the corner, you can see old Woolly Tanglefoot's personal crop of pipeweed. A stone path curves from the door around to a small wooden shed.

The bright moonlight reveals row after row of leafy plants in this orderly little garden. A large snail leaves a wet iridescent trail across the back door stoop. In the corner of the yard you can see the vague outline of a squat shed.

node.name: Tanglefoot House, Shed
node.description: Neatly arranged hoes, rakes, spades and other garden tools line the walls. Woven gathering baskets, some empty, some filled with bags of seeds, occupy one corner of the shed. A wooden wheelbarrow has been left next to the door. Bunches of drying herbs and flowers hang from the low ceiling.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Glaysker Lane
node.description: The pale lavender-pink glaysker flowers that have been planted along the length of this cobblestone street breathe a subtle sweet fragrance into the air. Your eye is caught by an attractive display in the window of a simple white cottage with a thatched roof and a light purple awning.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Glaysker Lane
node.description: A curious arrangement of objects has been grouped on either side of the doorway of a building, which is almost completely obscured by the entangled maiden's tress vines that grow up the sides and over the roof. Stuffed animals, stone statues, pieces of furniture, a sundial, and assorted carved walking staves form a bizarre tableau. A statue next to the door holds a plaque.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Glaysker Lane
node.description: Small shops line the lane that bends from the northeast to the west. A shamrock green awning tops the doorway to a yellow building with a matching green sign mounted on the wall. A single pure note from a melancholy flute floats out from the doorway.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Glaysker Lane
node.description: As you pause for a moment on the cobblestoned lane, your eye is caught by the entrance to a squat stone building with a blue awning. A dazzling silver sword has been securely mounted to the arched entryway above a small engraved plaque.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Glaysker Lane
node.description: The festive glaysker blossoms that edge the lane provide a striking contrast to a homely wooden shack that sits unadorned and colorless at the side of the path. A plain wooden signpost stands at the shack's entrance.

node.name: Phoebe's Fashions, Sales Room
node.description: Racks and shelves are filled with a kaleidoscopic display of small clothing for men and women. Phoebe Woodcock, talented village seamstress, is standing in front of a rack methodically arranging shirts according to color. She pauses to give a flirtatious smile to an attractive male Halfling customer.

node.name: Quellia's Thread Shop, Sales Room
node.description: Sturdy white fabric hangs on three of the walls in the shop, displaying colorful designs and patterns of embroidery stitchwork, and long swatches of masterfully dyed thread display a myriad of colors. Nearly hidden by fabrics and patterns piled on the counter is the shop's catalog, embellished with a delicately embroidered cotton cover.

node.name: Odds 'n Ends, Sales Room
node.description: A gilded birdcage containing a wind-up parrot is suspended near the doorway. Glass cases line the walls, displaying practical items alongside rare oddities. A stuffed leucro head, which has been mounted on the wall, stares down at you with its sharp teeth exposed. The owner of the shop, Rufus Tanglefoot, looks up from combing his foothair and smiles at you expectantly.

node.name: Barley Bulrush, Bardic Ballads
node.description: The walls of this small shop are lined with pigeonholes filled with scrolls. The proprieter, Barley Bulrush, sits at the back behind a desk that also serves as a counter. A carved wooden flute sits on the countertop, always near to him. A thick black curtain behind him marks the division between the shop and the owner's dwelling.

node.name: Feta's Kitchen, Fresh Dairy and Baked Goods
node.description: A tidy room more reminiscent of a country kitchen than a shop, this is a bright and cheerful place filled with the aroma of fresh cheeses, breads and other foods. Attached to one wall, a straw basket of fresh flowers brings a splash of color to the room. An open window reveals a clean, straw-filled stable.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Taffelberry Trail
node.description: Large oak trees line this well-traveled trail as it winds its way towards a secluded community nestled among the surrounding low-lying hills. Wind-borne glaysker seeds have found a cozy home at the base of some of the trees, growing in an array of lavender and pink blooms. Clay pots of carefully tended taffelberry bushes sit at measured intervals along the path.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Taffelberry Trail
node.description: The hills encircle diminutive knolls clustered about a small village green within the valley. The hardened earth of the trail forks to meander its way past humble homes constructed within each knoll. The scent of ripened berries wafts on the breeze.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Loganberry Place
node.description: Simple white arbors stand at the entrance of each path to the knolls. Plump purple loganberries dangle amongst the deep green leaves of the bushes. A copse of oak trees lines the back of the lots, creating pools of ever-changing shadows upon the ground.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Loganberry Place
node.description: The stone-lined road continues from the northeast to the west, separating the grass-covered knolls to the south from an enormous tree at the center of the community. Yellow and orange mums circle around the base of a a smaller oak at the side of the path, bobbing their bright, flowery heads in the breeze as if dancing in a merry child's game.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Strawberry Way
node.description: A strawberry patch has found its way from a nearby home to a white picket fence that borders the east side of the village green. Weaving their way around each wooden picket, the strawberry vines create a tapestry of bright red teardrop fruits nestled among deep green leaves.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Strawberry Way
node.description: The scent of sweet strawberries fills the air surrounding the stone-lined path. A cord of wood sits neatly stacked by one of the colorful round doors that decorate the surrounding knolls. Near the woodpile, a hatchet sits partially buried in a stump, awaiting its next call to duty.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Olallieberry Circle
node.description: A large, round hill separates this exclusive part of the community from the daily hustle and bustle nearby. The deep green grass on this side of the hill is carefully manicured to the perfect height, nary a blade poking above the heads of its neighbors. An olallieberry bush with its large, ruby-red fruits weaves itself through a picket fence that borders the brick path.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Olallieberry Circle
node.description: Ornately carved round doors mark the entrances to the affluent homes set in perfectly manicured knolls of dark, grass-covered earth. Well-tended gardens filled with an abundance of flowers hug closely to each doorway, showing a year-round display of bright colors and pleasant scents.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Olallieberry Circle
node.description: A paved brick road circles around the large hillside to meander through this affluent portion of the village. Trained to grow over a pristine white wood arbor, a nearby olallieberry bush tempts passersby with its brightly colored fruits dangling amidst bright, green leaves.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Boysenberry Crest
node.description: Brightly painted round doors mark the entrances to the grassy knolls that border the northwest side of the road. A single boysenberry plant in the corner of one yard has been trained to grow as a tree, its tangled branches reaching down to sweep along the ground.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Boysenberry Crest
node.description: Skirting along the southwest base of a large hill, the road curves its way easterly past peaceful dwellings as it continues to wrap the edge of the village green. Small tended gardens of herbs and flowers snuggle up to the walkways of the homes within the knolls.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Village Green
node.description: An immense oak tree shelters a clear, sparkling pond beneath its leafy branches that canopy the village green from the weather. The thick roots of the tree have broken through the compacted earth in several places, lending themselves as places of rest to the local citizens. Stone-lined dirt pathways, like spokes of a wheel, venture toward the surrounding knolls.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Blueberry Lane
node.description: Thick groves of oak trees lightly forest the surrounding hills of the valley. Neatly trimmed blueberry hedges line this quiet lane that runs along the west side of the village green. A thick carpet of lush green grass encases the cozy knoll homes that sit off the lane up stone-lined walkways.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Blueberry Lane
node.description: The lane rises slightly to the northeast as is continues to circle around the edge of the valley. A small circle of simple wooden chairs shelters beneath the boughs of a nearby oak, offering a place to sit at the day's end. Trimmed mounds of blueberry bushes, laden with their deep blue pearls of sweetness, border the green to the southeast.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Gooseberry Loop
node.description: A copse of brown, dried trees blocks all view of the community to the north. The pot-holed path continues to the east, past abandoned knolls covered with patches of dried grass and the occasional tall, green weed. Torn curtains flutter in the breeze through a nearby broken window.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Gooseberry Loop
node.description: Dry, matted grass and tall weeds cover the nearby abandoned knolls. A gooseberry bush near the edge of the path has turned feral from neglect, becoming a wild tangle of thorny branches with nary a single berry in evidence among its browning leaves.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Gooseberry Loop
node.description: Islands of undaunted weeds appear in a sea of bare, parched earth along the path. Broken pieces of furniture lie scattered across the yard of one home, some of them burned, others merely torn apart as if for sport.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Glaysker Lane
node.description: A rounded building with a turf and flower-covered roof sits here at a sharp bend in the lane. The round white door almost seems to provide entry into a small flowery hill. Large beds of purple glaysker and bright yellow oralana flowers border the building.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Lobby
node.description: During performances, the lobby bustles with activity as customers view the souvenirs and necessities for sale displayed within and on top of the counter down one side of the room, and various other items in the glass display cases down the opposite side. A long narrow carpet leads theatergoers toward the archway into the seating area.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Bar
node.description: A long oak bar extends the length of the room, each end decorated with a carved depiction of Glythtide. Neatly stacked behind the bar, ornately labeled barrels line the wall, some with taps in them, others waiting to replace empties. Oak bar stools and small tables fill most of the room, with the exception of a stage in the corner opposite the door. Between the stage and the bar, a doorway reveals stairs leading upward. A matching set of steps leading downward is roped off to limit access.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Backstage
node.description: The men's and women's dressing rooms to the southeast and southwest and the prop storage room directly south are all accessed from this central hub of behind-the-scenes activity, resulting in a hectic atmosphere during rehearsals or performances. All traffic seems to flow to the northeast, where the stage wing awaits performers, musicians, and on occasion, nervous financiers.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Stage Wing
node.description: In contrast to the main backstage area, which is alive with activity when the theater is in use, this stage wing is quiet. Performers and stage hands wait here for their cues to pass through the curtain and onto the stage.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Musicians' Pit
node.description: Stools and music stands wait in rows for use during performances. Facing the stage, the conductor's stand is strategically located to allow for the direction of musicians and vocalists alike. Off to the side, a box holds a bizarre collection of objects to be used for sound effects for productions.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Men's Dressing Room
node.description: Shelves are available for costumes used in the current production, or for storing actors' own clothes during performances. Padded benches and plush carpets provide comfort for those changing, and mirrors above a long narrow table allow performers to apply stage makeup or check their appearance before going to the wings.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Prop Storage
node.description: Shelves and racks line every available portion of wall space, providing ample storage for props and costumes when not in use for the current show. Gaethzen globes brightly light the room, so that needed items can be quickly located.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Women's Dressing Room
node.description: Shelves are available for costumes used in the current production, or for storing actors' own clothes during performances. Padded benches and plush carpets provide comfort for those changing, and mirrors above a long shared vanity allow performers to apply stage makeup or check their appearance before going to the wings.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Stage
node.description: A row of lights illuminates the boards and those who take their place upon them. Dark curtains block sight of the wings.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Smoking Room
node.description: Glass cabinets along the walls display cases of rolled cigars and loose tobacco. Wing chairs of padded green leather face each other in small groupings, each accented with mahogany tables polished to a rich shine. Matching paneling covers exposed portions of the walls, and frosted gaethzen orbs provide a soft light to the room. Thick carpets dampen noise, allowing those who gather to debate the merits of one tobacco over another to do so in comfort and encouraging them to linger.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Apple Blossom Lane
node.description: An old-fashioned country lane wends its way east beneath the sheltering overhang of flowering cherry trees. Tiny thatched-roof cottages and other homes line the lane, surrounded by picket fences and neatly tended flower gardens. The faint sound of children's laughter can be heard from some of the homes.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Gooseberry Road
node.description: The road runs alongside a sparkling brook that splashes as the water tumbles over smooth rocks lining the streambed. Several homes nestle in the low-lying land around the brook, surrounded by neatly tended gardens. A bench swing hangs from a tree branch beside the road, swaying gently in a passing breeze.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Gooseberry Road
node.description: Several homes nestle in a hollow at the base of a hill, sheltered from the elements by tall poplars and fir trees. A brook runs nearby, surrounded by mossy rocks and deep green ferns which thrive in the shady setting. Lush patches of wild lady's slippers bob their pink and purple petals as a breeze gently brushes across the orchids.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Gooseberry Road
node.description: The road rises to the crest of a low hill, giving a view of the nearby town. Farmland spreads out around the village, while neatly thatched cottages and brick homes line the streets.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Gooseberry Road
node.description: Pale white jasmine blossoms dangle amidst deep green waxy leaves on a whitewashed trellis, their fragrant nectar attracting a flock of brightly colored hummingbirds. A low-pitched drone fills the air as chubby bumblebees float amidst the blossoms, their legs covered with a profusion of yellow pollen. A local homeowner has taken advantage of the nearby flowers, erecting a beehive on the lawn to produce his winter's supply of honey.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Gooseberry Road
node.description: A tangled thicket of gooseberry bushes lines the road to the south. Nearby, several small homes are scattered about, some near the road, others set back a ways to offer a modicum of privacy. Cheerful windowboxes filled with pansies and geraniums add a splash of color to the tiny houses.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Apple Blossom Lane
node.description: The lane ends at a shallow pond surrounded by weeping willow trees. A weathered pier juts out over the water, where residents from nearby homes may relax near the cool water in the summertime or catch a fish or two for the evening's meal.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Apple Blossom Lane
node.description: A stunted apple tree stands beside the lane, blackened and broken by a lightning strike. The splintered branches have been carefully trimmed and stacked, drying for use in the winter's fires. Several cottages stand nearby, their neatly cropped lawns and tended gardens evidence of industry on the part of their owners.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Apple Blossom Lane
node.description: Apple blossoms drift in the wind, fallen from the flower-laden branches of the gnarled trees which shade the narrow lane. Neat cottages stand side by side, some of brick, others of weathered cedar shingles, others with whitewashed wooden clapboards. A covered well, gathering place for local housewives, stands beside the road.

node.name: Thipbeet's Tart Boutique, Lobby
node.description: Leading down from the circular door, a small set of hardwood steps guides patrons to the welcoming entrance area of the bakery. Thick, woven rugs cover the dirt floor, enhancing the rustic feel set in place by the handcrafted furniture. Various aromas drift through the room from the bounty of tasty treats available for purchase in the depths of the shop.

node.name: Thipbeet's Tart Boutique, Fabulously Fruity
node.description: Hung from the ceiling, decorative vines dangle painted wooden strawberries and tiny silk blossoms. Orange gingham cloths cover the counter and tables set up around the room, each surface piled high with pastries to tempt the palate. Despite the dirt floor, the area retains an aura of cleanliness and refinement.

node.name: Thipbeet's Tart Boutique, Liquored Loveliness
node.description: Hung from the ceiling, decorative vines dangle stained glass bottles and small brass goblets. White gingham cloths cover the counter and tables set up around the room, each surface piled high with pastries to tempt the palate. Despite the dirt floor, the area retains an aura of cleanliness and refinement.

node.name: Thipbeet's Tart Boutique, Meatlicious Meatiness
node.description: Hung from the ceiling, decorative vines dangle miniature leather steaks and thin strips of paper bacon. Red gingham cloths cover the counter and tables set up around the room, each surface piled high with pastries to tempt the palate. Despite the dirt floor, the area retains an aura of cleanliness and refinement.

node.name: Thipbeet's Tart Boutique, Charmingly Chocolate
node.description: Hung from the ceiling, decorative vines dangle diminutive spotted cows and real cocoa beans. Brown gingham cloths cover the counter and tables set up around the room, each surface piled high with pastries to tempt the palate. Despite the dirt floor, the area retains an aura of cleanliness and refinement.

node.name: Thipbeet's Tart Boutique, Enchanting Exotics
node.description: Hung from the ceiling, decorative vines dangle sparkling gem-dusted leaves and brightly colored feathers. Indigo gingham cloths cover the counter and tables set up around the room, each surface piled high with pastries to tempt the palate. Despite the dirt floor, the area retains an aura of cleanliness and refinement.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Willow Pond Pier
node.description: Brightly painted low wooden chairs sit along the edge of the dock, allowing fishermen to relax as they cast their lines over the side in an attempt to lure the trout that lurk beneath the pilings. Towels lie scattered upon the wooden surface, evidently the property of swimmers cavorting in the pond's cool green waters.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Willow Pond
node.description: Water splashes down a slick rock chute built into the hillside on the far side of the pond, tumbling into the dark green water to send ripples shimmering across the surface. A weathered grey pier juts out into the pond, giving residents a launching point from which to dive. At night, the sound of crickets mingles with the hoarse croaks of frogs serenading the moons.

Water splashes down a slick rock chute built into the hillside on the far side of the pond, tumbling into the dark green water to send ripples shimmering across the surface. A weathered grey pier juts out into the pond, giving residents a launching point from which to dive. During the day, the air is filled with the screams and laughter of children at play.

node.name: Arthe Dale, Low Hillside
node.description: Water bubbles up from a crystal clear spring before overflowing into a smooth rock chute in the hillside. The chute twists and turns as it runs down the slope until it finally ends a few feet above the deep green waters of Willow Pond.

node.name: Swotting Hall, Trader's Pit
node.description: An explosion in a dye factory can best describe this cramped little room at the very back of Swotting Hall. Brightly-colored curtains in asymmetrical patterns pick up the vibrant primary hues used to upholster some plush arm chairs, and a rainbow-inspired throw rug shields the pale wooden floor. A rotund clerk occasionally peers up at the pricing board before making notes in a faded leatherbound journal.

node.name: Swotting Hall, Study Chamber
node.description: Simplicity seems to have been the goal in decorating this room. Plain chairs have been neatly arranged in a half-circle facing the center of the room. Unadorned beige walls and bare windows surround you. Hildegrim Hornbeam stands in the center, dressed in an austere style that matches the decor. She nods curtly at you as you enter.

node.name: Swotting Hall, Trader's Center
node.description: The walls of this large room are painted a rich, deep doeskin tan. Finely detailed tapestries of deep red, midnight blue and forest green cover three of the walls. Several prosperous-looking traders saunter over to a board mounted on the remaining wall. They peruse it quickly and move away to make room for others. A young Halfling lad scurries to the north, a notebook clasped firmly to his chest.

node.name: Bobba's Arms and Armor
node.description: Three Halfling-size figures stand along the entranceway, each clad in a different style of armor with weapon poised to attack. They do not move, however, the room's steady light betraying them as cunning display dummies crafted from straw and wooden poles. Smallish weapon racks and diminutive suits of leather line the walls, indicating the proprietor's select group of clientele.

node.name: Jadewater Mansion, Kitchen
node.description: Bearing more resemblance to a magical workshop than a place to prepare meals, the kitchen has many oddities filling it. Herbs overflow from oak shelves while a cart and counter have food and drink waiting to be served. A small bronze dragon with gaping jaws serves as garbage disposal.

node.name: Her Opulence
node.description: Long, wide and low, this vessel is built for utility, but the hand of luxury can be discerned in the ornately carved walnut railings, down-cushioned benches and the well polished deck. Six lanterns along the ferry's rail fill the boat with a soft light, creating a feeling of closure from the surrounding blackness.

node.name: Crossing, Northeast Gate Battlements
node.description: Straddling the Northeast Gate, the stone battlements overlook the busiest entrance to the city. Stone merlons offer some cover to those fighting, and the embrasures appear designed to accommodate either onager or archer. The cobbled walk only stretches a short distance to the west and south, where it is broken by the tall but unfinished expanse of the town wall.

node.name: Northern Trade Road, Grasslands
node.description: A cloud of flint-dry dust rises on every breeze, making you sneeze. For the most part, you see the grasslands about you in a state of decay and near death. Mountains rising sharply in the south form a counterpoint to others, sharper yet, that loom northwards. Saw-edged peaks and broken crowns indicate their origins as volcanoes in the not-so-distant past.

node.name: Guild Outpost, Caravan Stables
node.note: Caravan Stable Stone Clan|SC Caravan Stable
node.description: Constructed of thick stone walls supporting heavy oak beams, this stable was obviously built with Dwarven stature in mind. Despite its smallness and the earthy smells of its animal inhabitants, it's a surprisingly cheerful place. Brass lanterns hung about at regular intervals light the interior and make it easy to read a large notice chiselled deeply into the stone.

node.name: Stone Clan, Trader's Guild Outpost
node.description: This outpost is built of heavy, massive rockwork in the Dwarven style, plain but durable. Designed for safe storage, as well as easy buying and selling of bulk goods by Guild members, it is crammed and jammed with crates, boxes and packages of all manner and value. A stern-looking Guild trade minister is at hand to expedite transactions and to make sure nothing leaves or arrives without the proper fees and monies being exchanged.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: Rocks are pushed to one side of the road to make a slender path through debris. It looks scarcely traveled, the way lined by sparse vegetation.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: Patterns of leaves and paw prints are barely visible in the walls of stone nearby. The fossilized remains are an eerie reminder of the life trapped forever within the ash.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
