node.description: A withering flower rests to one side of the road. Its dusk-colored leaves flail in the slight breeze, their color the brown of age and decay.

The evening smiles down on a small flower lingering near the road side. It appears withered and dying at first glance, but as the night unfolds, so does a pure white snowblossom - one spot of beauty within a realm of decay and death.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: Splintered wagon wheels lie alongside a corroding iron frame. It appears as if a Trader ran into some difficulty -- difficulty he was unable to recover from.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: A dried watering hole stands forlorn amidst the skeletons of animals large and small. All scraps of flesh have been worn or torn away leaving only the dusty ivory bone beneath.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: The silhouette of the Greater Fist looms in the far distant horizon. The Lesser Fist lingers closer, its shadow rising almost haughtily before you.
Darkness trails over the shadows of both volcanoes - the Greater and Lesser Fists. Standing tall and proud, they serve as silent sentinels beneath the night's unsleeping eye.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: Coarse gravel lines the earth, a bed of sharp stones, like jagged teeth peering out of the earth. Ready to pierce the foot of the unwary traveler, they stand sparkling against the spartan dirt.

node.name: Lava Flow, Rocky Path
node.description: Fronds of wilting palm trees scatter on the ground, the wind blowing them across the loose dirt. Trunks and stalks lie half-buried by ash and crumbling stone.

node.name: Lava Flow, Standing Stones
node.description: Tall stones rise in small circular patterns, their forms eroded by wind and water both. The designs they held have long since faded into invisibility, their meaning now undecipherable.

node.name: Lava Flow, Standing Stones
node.description: Pieces of once-tall pillars lie skewed and broken. Debris from past volcanic eruptions blanket stone and statue, hearth and fallen home.

The dark side of evening seems to linger here, languidly basking over the ruins as if gloating. The shadows seem to tug and pull at the fallen buildings, as if taunting them, whispering seeds of unrest to long-dead spirits.

node.name: Lava Flow, Standing Stones
node.description: The ancient frieze of a tall arch is slowly crumbling to dust, paint and tile flaking off. Burn marks streak the mural, obscuring what images were once there.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Thorns
node.description: Dried and cracking brambles wrapped around a wrought iron fence line the road. Flanking the dusky earth, the brackish thorns peek out from withering branches, daring to jab and stab at passers by.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Thorns
node.description: A heart-shaped wrought iron sculpture is overgrown, writhing vines coiled around it. The thick spike-like thorns appear to pierce the center, the sharp points gleaming with moisture.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Thorns
node.description: A tangled mass of thorny bushes guard the roadside, making passage beyond the slender path impossible. Small birds find ways to hide unscathed amidst the brambles, tiny forms huddled inside small cathedrals of withering vines.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Thorns
node.description: The masses of thorny growths thin to the north. Wrought iron sculptures where vines of roses once grew stand bare, metal corroding and long untended. The eerie shapes stand like hollow souls over the dead ash-covered earth below.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Jade
node.description: Flecks of shattered jade lie strewn amidst the rough gravel of the road. Images etched into the flat panels of rock that were once a busy street are now worn to nothingness, their patterns long forgotten.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Jade
node.description: Slender jade obelisks mottled with dust and ash stand guard over the narrow road. The way is clear, footprints from recent travel constantly being worn over one another in the soft earth below.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Jade
node.description: An ornate jade plant rests amidst a circle of pale white stones. Each leaf is delicately carved from the blushing green stone. Despite being covered in filth, it remains a beautiful work of art.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Jade
node.description: An elaborate golden stand is firmly bolted to the stone of the road. Remnants of a jade-green glass sphere lie in sharp slivers on the surrounding grass. Bits of coarse vegetation grow between the pieces of glass.

node.name: Lava Flow, Path of Jade
node.description: Prickly, spine-covered bushes grow close to the ground. Ripe red fruit tauntingly dangles from behind long, sharp thorns.

node.name: Lava Flow, Wall of Swords
node.description: A tall barrier lines each side of the road, bladed edges topping the polished wooden beams that compose the wall.

node.name: Lava Flow, Wall of Swords
node.description: Wooden panels in the fence are carved into the jagged images of swords and weapons from lands far and near. The barbed metal partitions holding them together make touching the wall a most unpleasant thought.

node.name: Lava Flow, Wall of Swords
node.description: The volcano of the Lesser Fist looms over the barricade. It ominously shadows all below it. A glimpse of something reflective glints from near the maw of the fortress.

node.name: Lava Flow, Way of Swords
node.description: Ashes and dust coat the stone wall, covering the rock with a granulated layer of grey that abates only near an inset bronze plaque. A sparkling crystal hand is attached over the polished metal, also clear of the choking dust.

node.name: Lava Flow, Esouvar's Rest
node.description: The signs of ancient battle mark the area. A tall statue, at least thirty feet in height, towers far above the parched landscape. Eyes of faceted blue crystal sparkle brightly from the ash-streaked marble face.

node.name: Lava Flow, Esouvar's Rest
node.description: A red-veined marble fountain proudly shimmers with droplets of clear, cool water. Small flameroses grow up its sides, their tender green tendrils bearing small jade-green leaves that perfume the air with a heady scent.

node.name: Lava Flow, Garden of Ash
node.description: Once a lovely garden, little remains of its original beauty. Recent plantings line the roadside, clippings and trees freshly cultivated in an attempt to renew the land.

node.name: Lava Flow, Garden of Ash
node.description: A delicate moonflower bush, petals closed as the flowers sleep during the day, stands encircled by an almost fragile iron trellis. The clean area and well-tended soil betray an unseen caretaker overseeing the beautiful plant.
The soft blue-white blossoms of a moonflower bush open their luminous faces to the night sky.

node.name: Lava Flow, Garden of Ash
node.description: The long shadow of the Lesser Fist of Heaven dominates the small garden. The formidable fortress to the west rises high above the ground below, with the silhouette of the Greater Fist behind it towering yet farther into the reaches of the sky.

node.name: Lava Path, Dwindling Way
node.description: A volcano lies to the west. Fortified and well-guarded, it serves as the Fortress of the Crystal Hand. The dark path, made from hardened lava, is streaked with veins of polished obsidian that glisten with a dull satin sheen.

node.name: Lava Path, The Stone Stairway
node.description: A large stone staircase winds its way down the front of the volcano, carved into the face of the rock. A glimmering crystal formation to the west seems to catch the scarce light, glowing with a scintillating aura.

node.name: Outside the Fortress, Obsidian Doors
node.description: The door to the volcanic fortress is comprised of two enormous obsidian panels, both ornately carved. The slender path, chiseled from the lava, leads to a large stone staircase descending to the ground below. Embedded in the dense rock above the entrance rests a crystal hand encircled by angular runes.

Shadows of night embrace the stalwart doors leading into the fortress. The dark obsidian panels glisten with the light of the crystal hand set into the volcanic rock above them, their spiraling patterns and angular runes shimmering in the sparse illumination. A spartan staircase travels down the face of the stone walls.

The once mighty obsidian doors are fallen, shattered, and the way clogged with ruin. All that remains of its former occupants are bits of bone and the remnants of a large crystal hand, scattered when it was dashed to the ground. A spartan staircase, chiseled from lava, winds down the face of the stony wall.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Atrium
node.description: Light floods in from above, the only outlet to the distant skies being the gaping mouth of the volcano. The slender outline of a catwalk is thrown against the canvas of the sky, a barely noticeable line.
The night sky peeks through the mouth of the volcano, the crystal dome sparkling far above. A quiet settles over the atrium, a serene calmness that drifts through the air and the soul.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Atrium
node.description: A statue carved from a pale grey rock rests inside a circular path of dark stones at the center of the atrium. Offerings of flowers and incense are left before it, testament to the monks' ever-enduring memories. A rough obsidian path leads west toward the Guild library.
The coolness of evening drapes itself around the atrium and mottled shadows are cast over a tall marble statue. Burning incense drifts through the air, its heady scent almost dizzying.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Weapon Salle
node.description: Racks upon racks of weapons line the walls, most staves or keen-edged spears. Some blades, well-polished and edged, gleam from among their wooden, practice counterparts. The floor is clean and well-kept, the signs of monks recently training lingering about.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Rough Stairway
node.description: A tall stairway carved into the rock of the volcano winds its way precariously upwards, leading to a slender catwalk far above. It appears impossibly steep, but several monks ascend the way with no problem.

node.name: On the Catwalk
node.description: The skies open above, visible through a crystal dome capping the volcano. Daylight makes the slender catwalk seem extremely treacherous as it stretches most precariously over the vast expanse below.
The dark evening blankets the slender catwalk masking its treacherous positioning as it stretches most precariously over a vast expanse of darkness.

node.name: On the Catwalk, Above the Foyer
node.description: The thin platform extends further west, the expansive sky above seeming close indeed. The crystal dome capping the volcano exposes the vast horizon, hiding nothing.

The heavenly bodies dance and spiral, taunting the mortal hand to step from the catwalk just an inch closer. The night sky descends over the crystal dome and through it, stars surrounding you, close enough to seemingly touch them.

node.name: Platform's Edge, Seat of the Guildmaster
node.description: A large circular stone platform rests suspended in mid-air over the center of the volcano. The precarious catwalk extends to its edge.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Stone Garden
node.description: Small iridescent grey rocks carpet the rough lava floor. They are meticulously raked into ornate spiraling patterns. A slender obsidian walkway winds geometrically through the garden, dividing the crushed stone into abstract triangular shapes.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Stone Garden
node.description: A dark walkway of obsidian frames the field of grey crushed stone at the center of the room. Monks wander along the path, heads bowed in quiet contemplation.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Meditation Room
node.description: The walls and ceiling are featureless grey rock with a smooth polished surface. Dark linen pillows, flat and hard to the touch, are placed around the area. A small censer lets the potent scent of sweet incense drift lazily about.

node.name: Inside the Fortress, Guild Library
node.description: Monks kneel and sit on the charcoal gunny pillows scattered about the room. In hushed whispers, they read and debate combative and mystical theory alike. Glowing orbs of polished crystal illuminate the room, providing a gentle light for study and the gaining of wisdom.

node.name: Library, Archive Room
node.description: The silence of the archives is broken only by the soft sound of scratching pens as monks work copying ancient texts that have begun to decay. Files, treatises and endless scrolls of parchment line the bookcases to aid visitors in their researches.

node.name: Archive Room, Museum Foyer
node.description: The foyer to the Guild museum is sparsely decorated. Featureless walls of polished lava rise up to the crystal dome, the edge of the catwalk barely in sight. A winding spiral staircase descends into the stronghold below.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hallway Foyer
node.description: An elegant staircase made from polished stone spirals upwards to the main level. A passage north leads to a series of catacombs carved into the base of the volcano.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: The chambers of the museum appear to be carved from the basalt rock of the volcano. A dark indigo silk runner lines the cold stone of the floor. Silver sconces embracing small orbs of glowing tzgaa line the walls.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: Three panels of cloth hang from the walls depicting various scenes from the Guild's past. One notable portrayal is that of Katzel's execution.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: A bold bright blue banner hangs above this exhibit. Older monks pass by, nodding and winking at each other, the occasional one bowing reverently towards the large painting on display.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Promenade
node.description: Tapestries and paintings from various provinces of Elanthia cover the walls in this area. Sculptures and other remnants from past civilizations attest to their age.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: Swaths of velvet lie draped over this exhibit, one curtain drawn back to reveal a cracked oval mirror. Ropes cordon off the display. Most people lower their eyes as they pass, not daring to look, nervously shuffling onward.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: This room is plain and spartan, containing only an enclosed glass case bearing a treasure from ancient days. Even the obsidian walls are featureless, the black rock smooth and polished. A silverwillow sign hangs from delicate chains over the display.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: A large contraption, composed of many gears and glassine parts, focuses one thick crystal lens over an almost invisible specimen. A sliver of something almost imperceptably small glitters beneath.

node.name: Beneath the Fortress, Hall of Relics
node.description: A large glass panel flanks the wall, parchment pages held securely in place behind the protective display. A small brass plaque is tacked to the wall beneath it.

node.name: Ith'Draknari Halls, Entry Chamber
node.note: Monks of the Crystal Hand|Crystal Hand
node.description: Pillars of stone, decorated in simple hues of red and gold, hold the low, flat ceiling in place. Bells and tassels dangle from dry pine poles that crisscross between the columns, turning the area above into an elaborately textured contrast to the smoothness of the stone. A large bowl carved from ivory-hued alabaster rests in the center of the room, the air surrounding it strangely cool.

node.name: Ith'Draknari Halls, Passage of the Self
node.description: The faceless stone walls of the chamber are lined by copper statues, each one representing a member of the eleven races. Along the southeastern and southwestern walls, the original seven are arranged in a curving row, facing north towards the remaining four. Occasionally, a monk walks through, pausing to carefully dust off each of the statues in turn before journeying on.

node.name: Ith Draknari Halls, Passage of the Stairway to Enlightenment
node.description: Thousands of golden yellow tassels shift back and forth as they hang from the ceiling, moving in unison with a gentle draft. An orange sunset fills the western wall, forever frozen in its painted descent below an unreal horizon. Leading up to the center of the mock solar orb is a carefully stacked pile of white granite, arranged like stairs. Their destination is nowhere, stopping at the solid, but brilliantly painted rock.

node.name: Ith Draknari Halls, Passage of the Foundation of Identity
node.description: Painted wooden panels adorn every wall, depicting crowds of silhouettes and ghostly images. Many of the murals show individuals ascending mountains, or pointing at the stars and moons as they teach the figures around them. A real monk passes through every once in a while to brush off the art and to check the status of the goods arranged for purchase.

node.name: Ith Draknari Halls, Chamber of the Burning Truth
node.description: The air is intensely heated due to the fires burning within three large stone troughs around the chamber. Two of the fiery containers flank an alcove in the back wall and the copper hand that rests within. Where the walls are not covered with soot or candle-covered shelves, the green flames and red letters that have been painted upon them are clearly visible.

node.name: Ith'Draknari Halls, Passage of the Sky
node.description: Images of clouds swirling endlessly in peaceful currents of wind cover the walls, some painted and others made of tattered wool glued upon the stone. Long horsehair tassels hang from the corners of the room, their ends drifting across the floor in the gentle breezes that descend from the open ceiling.

node.name: Ith'Draknari Halls, Passage of the Eternal Ocean
node.description: A light blue shade has been dabbed over the walls, blended into a frothy white as it reaches the ceiling, which itself is painted to appear as a midnight sky. To augment the stars upon that ebony background, delicate shards of crystal have been inlaid upon each of the constellations' key points. With the exception of these gems, only a few pale tassels adorn the ceiling.

node.name: Forest Path
node.description: Signs of sickening cling to the trees and the whisper of unseen creatures moving about alerts you to the fact that you are not alone. The ground is a blasted, black color, and dry stalks of grass that hold no promise of life poke up from the barren earth. To the northwest clamber a set of mountains that look less than a mile away, if that.

node.name: Forest Path
node.description: The trees that grow here just barely comprise a forest, their tortured, claw-like branches scraping the sky and rendering them so malformed it is impossible to tell what type of tree they are. A matted layer of thick, molding leaves cover the floor, filling the air with a miasma-like stench that makes your stomach cringe.

node.name: Forest Path, Rocky Shore
node.description: The trees grow unsteadily along this rocky patch of ground, and in many places they have fallen. The lapping of water greets your ears to the west, and glancing in that direction you can see a small lake the color of dull lead, its shores reaching all the way to the edge of a mountain range that makes an ugly black slash across the horizon.

node.name: Forest Path, Rocky Shore
node.description: The trees cling to a tedious life along the path that winds around the shore of the Silverwater Lake. The ground is firmly packed, and ruts dig deeply into the earth on either side, remnants of a once thriving community. The dead slap of water against water brings an eerie echo up from the lake shore.

node.name: Forest Path, Rocky Shore
node.description: A shattered wood beam crosses your path here, the remnants of a house that has now long since vanished. Fragments of rocks lie scattered across the ground, turning treacherously underfoot. The ground creates odd embankments, as if the hand of a god pushed it back with one quick, idle brush.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Entrance
node.description: A jagged rip lies flush against the ebony mountainside, a layer of darkness against blackness against night. Fine onyx sand lines the ground, its surface riddled with deep gouges, shattered glass, and broken support beams. From within the mine's entrance you can hear odd snickering noises.

A jagged rip in the mountainside marks the entrance to the Silverwater Mines. Broken support beams, shattered lanterns, and deep gouges in the fine sand that lie around the opening are all that remain of a once prosperous establishment. You can barely make out what lies beyond, save for a few dark shapes and odd snickering noises.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Strange noises bounce off the ragged stone ceiling, amplified by the quiet air of the night. The dark is so thick that you can hardly see ahead, and the only thing clueing you toward the exit is the lapping sound of the lake shore coming from the south. To the north the tunnel is choked with debris, but maneuverable.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Luminescent fungi on the walls manages to lend light to this small, damp chamber. Deep gouges cut through the ground, leaving glassy tracks and making the floor uneven.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: A rusting steel track is embedded into the cave floor here, running east ten feet before vanishing behind a wall of solid rock. It is apparent from the stops at the visible end of the track that it began here, but hard to determine how it came to go through a wall, or how a wall came to grow up around it. In the distance a repetitious dripping sound echoes through the cavern, doing nothing for the nerves.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: The mine opens up into a somewhat larger room here, the walls extending up some fifty feet before shading off into darkness. In the center of the chamber is a deep shaft that plunges as far down as the walls climb up. The floor is oddly free of the debris that litters the rest of the mines.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Broken stones, abandoned tools, and wooden beams choke this bottleneck passageway. The smooth stone walls rise up to either side, constricting movement and creating a pretty place for an ambush.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: The tunnel dead-ends here, choked by a wall of rubble and stone that blocks all further passage. Chunks of rock lie strewn around you, and from beyond the stones you can hear a faint snickering sound. A fine layer of dust lies over everything, and here and there you notice the faint tracings of footprints.

node.name: Wilderness, Clearing
node.description: The trees and undergrowth stop abruptly at the edge of this small clearing, the hard, cracked soil underfoot showing no sign of vegetation. A broken cart lies near a cold fire pit in the center of the clearing, several pieces of unused firewood poking their heads over its splintered sides. A small cave leads into the rocky hillside.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Shaft
node.description: The smooth walls of the mine shaft rise up to either side, a glossy black color. Some fifty feet of sheer wall rests between this platform, the opening above, and the next platform below.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Shaft
node.description: The smooth walls of the mine shaft rise up to either side of you, a glossy black color. Some fifty feet of sheer wall rests between the platform you stand on, the one above you, and the next platform below.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Shaft
node.description: The smooth walls of the mine shaft rise up to either side of you, a glossy black color. Some fifty feet of sheer wall rests between the platform you stand on, the one above you, and the mine floor far below.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Cavern of Glass
node.description: This room is breathtakingly massive in size. The walls shimmer like sheer glass, and the floor itself is made of a black, bubbled obsidian. Cut into the low ceiling is a narrow opening that leads up to an abandoned mine shaft. Faint light trickles through it, the only illumination and the one thing that still connects the cavern to the world that waits outside it.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Cavern of Glass
node.description: A monstrous image awaits you here: the backside of a Human, preserved in the glass. Shoved face-first into the obsidian walls, it is hard to tell what this hapless man's last expression was, but a guess would estimate that it was not a happy one. Fickle light from the west plays off the pristine white of his clothing, preserved forever within the opaque surface.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: The floor of this bell-shaped room is smooth and level and so free of debris that it warrants suspicion. An arching roof of smooth rock flies up overhead, fading off into the cave's natural darkness. A pale greenish light from the north fills the cavern partially, becoming gradually watered down and consumed as it tries to reach south.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Twin pillars of limestone divide the center of the tunnel into three graceful arches of equal size. The fancy that these creations are of nature is shattered when you notice the glowing emeralds inset at the top of each arch, filling the room with a feverish green glow that reflects starkly off the limestone. Toward the south the tunnel opens up more, which is compensated for by its narrowing to the north.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: The steady drip drip drip of water echoes in from somewhere close, but for some reason you cannot divine the direction the sound is coming from. The unsettling rhythm it sets is more than grating on the nerves. Toward the south you can see the faint shine of the eerie green light that fills all the tunnels, while toward the west the shadows thicken and seem to draw into themselves.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Large chunks of rocks lie thrown about here, natural born ruins of Hodierna's heart. The tunnel twists at a right angle ahead, moving with the sharp grace of the World Dragon itself.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Rubble
node.description: Mounds of clutter and rubble lie packed around this room, the remains of a mining site that was abandoned before it could be properly dealt with.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Gentle Slope
node.description: The floor climbs slowly upward toward the south and west while the roof remains level, lending an appearance of awkwardness to the tunnel. Rough shapes protrude from the walls, and it is only after a moment of staring that you realize the shapes bear a strong resemblance to Human faces, mouths wide open in shock and terror, and Human arms, desperately trying to claw their way out through a grave of stone.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Desolate Cavern
node.description: This underground chamber is filled with a pale, eerie green light that comes from no visible source. Broken bits of stone, mangled remains of bodies, and rotting mementos of a past now scattered and gone are the only sign that this was once an active mining site.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Desolate Cavern
node.description: A massive cavern yawns open about you, endlessly huge. The ceiling and floors are lined in jagged stumps that were once whole stalactites and stalagmites, and shattered skeletal remains lie strewn about. A deathly silence hangs heavy in the air, like a palpable curtain waiting to be drawn back. The walls are scratched by claw marks, and the whole panorama hearkens to a raging tempest that whirlwinded through, tearing all within its path to shreds.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Broken bits of pottery, discarded mining picks, and remains of clothing and rags lie scattered about the floor. The rock walls climb up around you, sealing out sound and lending a cramped feeling to the air.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Tunnel
node.description: Old rusting hooks are still embedded in the rough walls of the tunnel, though they hold little but air these days. Lichen grows in small clumps on the walls, filling the room with a fitful, unearthly illumination. Scintillating out of the corner of your eye, minerals glitter in a Fae sugar-coating on the rocks and stones.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Alcove
node.description: This alcove, tucked away from the rest of the mine, sits like a lost child between the two wider service tunnels. The floor holds a scattering of dirt across its surface along with an assorted collection of rubble. A small shelf has been carved into one of the walls, its surface all but hidden by the shadows.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Cavern of Glass
node.description: The west side of the cave slopes gradually downward, ending in a gentle curve where it meets the floor and creating a small cup in which subterranean water has begun to pool. A sickly green glow -- the color of a wounded forest -- emanates from the water, casting the room in its light.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, A Sheltered Ledge
node.description: Set back from the rest of the shaft, this recessed ledge appears to have been safe enough for miners to set up a few bunks for sleeping in. Sadly, all that remains of the cots are a rusting iron frame and clinging tatters of rotting canvas.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Along the Ladder
node.description: The steady drip of water trickling down the sides of the smooth obsidian walls reverberates with a cascade of echoes throughout the dark shaft. Creaking loudly with any weight placed upon its shabby rungs, the old ladder adds readily to the strange music. The absence of a few rungs requires the use of nearby handholds eroded out of the otherwise slick surface of the rock.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Along the Ladder
node.description: Damp and dark, the narrow shaft forms a perfect environment for the propagation of various types of lichen that cling in crusty patches to the surface of the smooth walls. Even the rickety old ladder with its missing rungs is not immune to their scaly invasion. Only a few fragile handholds formed of jagged rock protruding from the slick surface bring any hope of retreat.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Along the Ladder
node.description: Every few seconds, harsh creaks reverberate through the shaft as a wooden platform attached to a thick steel cable whizzes past. Anyone foolish enough to attempt this climb along the ladder would be wise to keep themselves plastered closely against the smooth wall. Overhead, a small niche is crudely chiseled into the surface of the rock.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Along the Ladder
node.description: Traces of minerals embedded in the obsidian walls reflect faint beams of light that occasionally filter down the narrow shaft. The dim rays provide just enough light to reveal a series of illegible markings scratched into the wall, much like fingernails that have missed their reach.

node.name: Silverwater Mines, Along the Ladder
node.description: Every sound is magnified tenfold in the hollowness of the dank shaft, including the occasional scream from less capable climbers below. Looking as though it might fall from the rotted wood at any moment, an old oil lamp hanging from one of the few remaining rungs of the ladder proves that others have also attempted this climb up the shaft. The obvious lack of any further handholds, either man-made or natural, makes it clear that retreat is now the only possible means of escape.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Grotto
node.description: A slight breeze mingles fresh, damp air from the outside with the musty dryness of this ancient cave. The ground rises slightly as it heads north into the center of the lair.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Grotto
node.description: An array of intertwining crystalline vines laces the jagged rock walls, their smooth, dry surfaces gleaming dully in the ambient light. Crude steps chiseled into the walls lead up to a wide stone ledge. A fine patina of dust covers the floor, roiling into brown clouds with the slightest disturbance.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Fire Pit
node.description: Rows of stacked stones surround a deep firepit in the center of the dirt floor. A mass of ash, pieces of blackened wood and small bits of fire-greyed bone fill the pit, their presence adding a slight scent of char to the air. Several large stone benches line the walls, chiseled from the cave's native limestone.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Grotto
node.description: Ambient light dances across the face of a large crystalline formation that stretches from floor to ceiling, teasing ever-changing shadows across the room. To the left of the crystals, a flow of smooth limestone has shaped itself into a natural staircase leading up to the rock lip encircling the chamber.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Grotto
node.description: Milky-white deposits of limestone cascade down the northwest wall in formation created long ago but long since dried and dead. A casualty of the near-total darkness, a spindly, single-leafed stalk hangs limply over the edge of a cracked clay pot that squats near one of the doors set into the walls of the cavern.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Grotto
node.description: Velvety limestone draperies flow down the far wall, adding a superficial appearance of softness to the rock's surface. A number of flat, grey stones have been stacked into a tower of precarious steps leading up to a wide rock lip that encirles the entire cavern.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Grotto
node.description: Silent stalactites glint far overhead with an eerie iridescence that lights the entire cavern in a pale, green glow. A pile of large boulders along one wall give shelter to a tiny opening nestled in the rock face.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Karik Rim
node.description: A stream of cool water trickles from a narrow crack in the rock wall and onto the floor, forming a small pool. An even smaller rivulet dribbles from the other side of the pool, spreading across the nearby rock to evaporate into the warm, dry air.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Karik Rim
node.description: A painting of a huge, four-legged creature dominates the near wall of this section of the chamber. A plethora of runic symbols encircle the figure, interspersed between them the outlines of several large handprints. The entire piece has been painted in the same, unvarying ochre hue.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Karik Rim
node.description: A pile of discarded skulls and bones lies at the base of one wall, gleaming dully in the dim light. The walls here are stained a smokey grey, darker near the lower areas where an abandoned firepit is slowly being consumed by the steady accumulation of dust on the cavern's floor.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Karik Rim
node.description: This large stone ledge, wide enough for a yak caravan to travel, circles the entire rim of the cavern. A series of crude drawings have been sketched along the walls, their images showing miniature Gor'Togs standing in an endless battle against creatures frozen in time.

node.name: Gazit Lair, Karik Rim
node.description: A row of stalagmites form a natural railing along the lip of the stone walkway underfoot, lending a modicum of protection against falling to the cavern floor below. The air is slightly warmer here than the rest of the cave.

node.name: Silverwater Lake, Shore
node.description: The dull, listless waters of Silverwater Lake spread out before you, a rippling matte mirror. Except for the choppy slap of the waves against the black sands of the shore, the lake is quiet and devoid of any sign of fish or wildlife.

node.name: Silverwater Lake, Shore
node.description: A steep bank of rocks and dirt climbs up to the east, creating a short but unclimbable wall. To the west the water of Silverwater Lake thrashes in its death throes, sucking away at the pebbled sands of the shore. The stillness is unsettling, and a little frightening.

node.name: Silverwater Lake, Shore
node.description: Quarry piled along the shore and the remnants of a deep channel that leads up to the mines indicates that this may have once been the place where the miners dumped the remains of the day's excursions. A fine, gritty layer of black covers everything, and the water is noticeably darker by comparison to the rest of the lake.

node.name: Silverwater Lake, Shore
node.description: The shoreline becomes more and more rocky until it finally turns into the treacherous mountainside. Tall and majestic, the range cups the lake in a halfmoon shape. An earthquake from time immemorial has split the part of the mountain's side that faces Silverwater, leaving a sheer wall of granite that dives straight down into the water with reckless abandon. A splendid and awe-inspiring cataract topples aimlessly over the straightest cliff, feeding the lake but never dispelling its grim hue.

node.name: Fillop's Knollshop
node.description: The dark earth walls of this round chamber are lined with fine green mosses and delicate white starflowers. Her black eyes sparkling above rosy apple cheeks, a bustling Halfling woman beams brightly at her customers as she combines the latest gossip with an expert patter about the quality knoll landscapes she purveys.

node.name: Fillop's Finest Knolls
node.description: Nestling within a spacious antechamber, the root-lined walls of Fillop's more exclusive gallery are hung with hundreds of tiny glass jars, each containing a brightly-glowing firefly. The gentle yellow light softly illuminates the rotund proprietor's cheery smile as he enthusiastically discusses the custom landscapes he creates for Halflings of a higher class.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Bungles's Backyard
node.description: A cobblestone walk lined with lush taffelberry bushes points the way to a large greenhouse nestled amid colorful thornberry shrubs and maiden tress vines. Brightly painted wooden benches are scattered around a small pond that rests at the base of a large mound dotted with fiddlehead ferns. The greenhouse's glass door has been cheerfully painted with colorful flowers of all shapes and sizes.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Bungles's Greenhouse
node.description: Warm damp air heavy with the smell of moist earth and intermingled with the scent of blooming flowers permeates the area. Rickety tables, overburdened with heavy clay pots bearing yellow gardenias, snapdragon stalks, and black orchids, are sprinkled throughout the room and almost obscure an ivy-covered screen that leads to a small work area. Centered strategically with the best available light sits a sturdy oak table bearing a huge potted bibbleberry bush.

node.name: Berry Knolls, Open Field
node.description: At the top of the mound, a large open field emerges. Speckled with occasional gooseberry, thimbleberry, and mintberry bushes, it provides a perfect area for picnics or fairs. Pink clover and sweet woodruff cover the ground profusely, marred only by several tamped down patches indicating where tents and wagons have previously rested.

node.name: Lava Forge, Lobby and Book Store
node.description: Dust drifts through the archway over the cooled lava floor and piles in the corners of the stone building. A bored Human attendant relaxes on a stool near a leather curtain that closes off the rest of the forge.

node.name: Lava Forge, Supplies
node.description: A rickety wooden table stands near a battered rack that leans against the granite wall. A Human smithy attendant, looking rather harried, watches people pass by as he restocks the supplies.

node.name: Lava Forge, Maker's Mark Ordering
node.description: Away from the din of the main forging area, this small room carved out of the hardened lava serves as a respite from the hustle and bustle of the busy lobby. Future master smiths plot their technique choices as they study charts detailing their future career options. All the while, master smiths deliberate over the design of their soon to be made new master crafter's mark.

node.name: Lava Forge, Tool Store
node.description: Throughout this cavernous room the floor has been scuffed and scratched as boxes and crates of components needed for finally assembly of the various forged items have been hauled into place. Groans can be heard often because restocking is constantly in progress.

node.name: Lava Forge, Foundry
node.description: Windows high up in the stone walls provide just a hint of fresh air over the stench of burning coal and molten metal. Supported by chains from a wooden beam, a heavy ceramic crucible swings over the fire or over to the molds lined against the wall.

node.name: Lava Forge, Foundry
node.description: Heat from the coal-fed fire is absorbed and radiated back by the hardened lava floor, while over the flames a battered iron crucible dangles from chains attached to a granite beam that stretches to the molds arrayed along the wall.

node.name: Lava Forge, Foundry
node.description: The scent of overheated metal hangs thickly in the air, adding to the discomfort of the heat of the coal-stoked fire in the firepit. Suspended from a thick wooden beam, an obsidian crucible swings, with effort, between the molds lined up against the wall and the fire.

node.name: Lava Forge, Forge
node.description: A massive iron anvil crouches in the center of the black floor. Against the wall, a glowing iron forge awaits things to heat, casting a reddish glow over the room. Small windows high in the wall draw some of the heat outside to mingle with the dusty air.

node.name: Smelting and Grinding Area
node.description: Metal shrieks against stone as the grindstones spin. The industrious forge attendants, who bustle about while seeming not to move, keep the black, pitted lava floor clean. Muffled pounding sounds from elsewhere in the forge, and a wall of heat comes from the foundry to the northeast, but this grinding room is a relative oasis of coolness in the granite building.

node.name: Lava Forge, Forge
node.description: The hard ash-speckled lava floor is hot to the touch, not from the nearby volcano but from the fires within the glowing forge near the south wall. Sparks fly as hammers strike heated metal on a battered anvil against the north wall. The clanging bounces around the small room until the granite walls seem to ring in harmony.

node.name: Forge and Grinding Area
node.description: A scream greets the newcomer to this area. The source is not the apprentice at one of the grindstones along the perimeter of the room, but the blade he is grinding. Other apprentices keep the grindstone spinning, panting with the effort.

node.name: Lava Forge, Forge
node.description: Silent figures in robes flit from room to room, apprentices bent on their labors. Here, a black anvil set on an oak base stands near one wall, opposite a hulking iron forge. Waves of heat wash across the room to be absorbed by the granite walls.

node.name: Smelting and Grinding Area
node.description: A row of grindstones circles the granite-walled room. A few robed Humans work in tandem to spin a grindstone while another carefully presses an unfinished blade against the stone, causing sparks to scatter over the pitted floor. The scraping of the metal reverberates along the walls.

node.name: His Daring Exploit
node.description: Most of the passengers on this low riding barge have descended into quiet conversation, not wishing to stir the night. A single lantern, swinging from the fore rail, pushes its dull gold rays across the dark water.

node.name: Paper Mill, Upper Chutes
node.description: Cut blocks of wood, trimmed of all their bark, are piled in neat stacks all around this area. A large saw lies suspended over a nearby cutting table, looking heavy enough to require four people to use. Several discarded pieces of half-folded origami lie next to a wooden bench, as if their creator became disinterested halfway through the project.

node.name: Paper Mill, Upper Chutes
node.description: The center of this room is dominated by a large metallic grinder, apparently used to turn logs of wood into chips for papermaking. A large half-covered hole near the grinder shows an enormous pile of cut wood chips in the room below. Near the southern wall, a second chute lies open, apparently made for dumping discarded bark and other waste into the scrap yard.

node.name: Paper Mill, Rooftop
node.description: The slightly slanted rooftop of the paper mill is covered with piles of sawdust, creating little piles of powder that resemble dirty snow. Jet black tiling peeks through the heavy layer of dust occasionally, in vague shapes that sometimes resemble footprints. A sizable storm drain edges the roof, likely used to collect runoff water to be used for other purposes.

node.name: Paper Mill, Rooftop
node.description: This small area of the rooftop is relatively bare except for an empty bird's nest tucked into one corner of the storm drains. A few bits of eggshell still remain inside the random-looking bundle of twigs and bark. The roof is fairly flat in this area, only a slight angle directing rainwater into the trough lining its edge.

node.name: DiSilveron, Front Gate
node.description: Grand alabaster lions flank a regal wrought-iron gate that is accented in heavy silver leaf. To either side of these gargantuan works of art are high hedges of jasmine intertwined with woodrose, which continue on for several yards before banking out of sight. A silver-tinged, multi-gabled roof is visible just above the hedges.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Storage
node.description: Crates of food are stacked in this place, leaving very little room to move about. Some of the crates are marked "For Cats Only", obviously nourishment for familiars when the season grows too cold for them to hunt on their own. A counter on one wall is piled with odds and ends not yet packed away for storage.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Storage
node.description: A small space has been set aside in the guild for the storage of goods. Numerous crates are stacked up against the walls leaving an open area in the center of the room. The room is dimly lit by a small lantern which sits atop a wooden box near the wall opposite an iron door. Behind the box sits an apprentice, his eyes focused intently on a ledger before him.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Warrens
node.description: This small cavern is filled with ledge upon ledge perfectly suited to fit the varied bodies of familiars. A small stone in the center of the room glows with a subdued red light, providing heat for those incarnated into cold-blooded bodies.

node.name: Yulugri Wala, Floor Seating
node.description: Bright red upholstered seats allow guests to sit in comfort for the performances. This section of the floor seating provides few frills, but does allow a clear view of the stage -- as long as the occupants of the seats farther forward are not too tall.

node.name: Deep Forest, Dilapidated Cabin
node.description: The trees thin slightly here, opening up around the ruins of a cabin. The vine-choked structure struggles to stand under the weight of a fallen tree, with the occasional foreboding creak emanating from its boards. Off to one side, a pile of rocks marks the location of a crumbling well.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin
node.description: A strong odor of rotting vegetation fills this small cabin, despite planks missing at varying intervals leaving the area open to the outside. Dead branches reach through the broken ceiling above like long, bony fingers, in contrast to the tender seedlings pushing up through the floorboards. A small, rotting area rug is pulled back in one corner, revealing a trapdoor.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Basement
node.description: A rusted lantern hanging from above shines a gentle glow over this space, which is little more than a cave carved in the vague shape of a room. Makeshift tables and shelves line the walls, covered with an assortment of gears and metal scraps. Heavy wooden supports stand at the north and south ends of the area, framing parts of the cavern that were left in their natural states.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: The rough rock forms a jagged arch overhead that curves to the south and northeast along the tunnel. Piles of stones line the sides of the path, each scarred by chisel marks.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: The path curves sharply to the southwest and southeast, hugging a cluster of stalactites and stalagmites. A gear is deeply embedded in the rock, almost appearing as though it was naturally formed along with the stone.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: Deep gouges are cut in the walls, like scars in the stone, forming clean furrows as though the tool used was slicing through clay instead of hard rock. A ruddy stain, vaguely resembling a handprint, mars the surface alongside the gash.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: Curving gently, the tunnel is shaped in such a way that it makes it difficult to tell which directions various skittering noises are coming from. Overhead, roots squeeze through cracks, further dampening sounds.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: The coolness of the air is heightened by the addition of moisture and creating a scent similar to dust after the rain. Droplets of water cling to the stone walls, making them look as though they're perspiring.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: Cracks spread across the stone walls in an intricate cobweb pattern, as if something with massive strength punched the rock. A small clump of lichen clings to one of the fractures, following the jagged line like a tiny, greenish lightning bolt.

node.name: Dilapidated Cabin, Tunnel
node.description: A deep shelf is carved into the wall, in which is stored locked chests bound by chains. Strange symbols are crudely etched into the rock wall above each one, though their relation is unclear.

node.name: The Bardess' Fete, Deck
node.description: Silken rigging suspends the sweeping teak sloop's deck from the semi-rigid envelope above. Shaded silk-cushioned benches along the bow's rail offer comfort and a spectacular view from the ship. A cylindrical copper device, about the size of a large bread oven, snakes a half dozen tubes upward into the bottom of the segmented balloon. Aft of the device, the quarterdeck rises to elevate the ship's wheel, while beyond, a cherrywood door marks the entrance to a small cabin. To the left of the door hangs a framed painting, and to the right is a small porthole.

node.name: Foothills, Rocky Pass
node.description: Cracked boulders cast long shadows over the narrow path that carefully picks its way through the rocky outcrops and mossy slopes of the rolling hillside. Loose scree covers the ground, marking the trail's track and lending a subtle treachery to it at the same time.

Cracked boulders cast ugly, malformed shadows over the narrow path that carefully picks its way through the rocky outcrops and mossy slopes of the rolling hillside. The trail is all but lost in the night, the glint of minerals in the scree that is scattered over the overgrown track the only indicator that you are not lost in a world of darkness.

node.name: Foothills, Rocky Pass
node.description: The shoulders of the hillside shove up close to each other, the steep slopes lending no purchase and instilling a sense of claustrophobia. Tender shoots of grass poke up between the cracks in the fractured stones that are crammed into the looming hills, their greyed and weathered surface resembling the rotting teeth of a grinning giant.

node.name: Foothills, Rocky Pass
node.description: Densely packed scrub and the rise of a few hardy and wind-twisted trees skirt the narrow pass. The shadow of the jealous hillside swallows all that lies in its grip, leaving little purchase for sunlight. Scattered bird calls echo between the tiny valleys created by the insurmountable slopes, belying the emptiness that fills in the gaps the pass has created.

Densely packed scrub and the rise of a few hardy and wind-twisted trees skirt the narrow pass. The night is enhanced by the looming presence of the tyrannical hillside that casts its long, looming shadow over all who dare step foot beneath it. The breathy thunder of wingbeats floats through the air as bats and birds of prey go about their business.

node.name: Foothills, Rocky Pass
node.description: The hillside fans outward to the west and narrows into a cramped pass to the east. The gentle slope of a valley sweeps up to meet the pass, the green grass short and spikey and surprisingly lush.

node.name: Wooded Hills, East Slope
node.description: The smooth surface of the slope curves gently in a wave of smooth, blood dark grass. Due to a thick mist, the valley floor is inscrutable save for the flash of odd architectural protrusions that claw upwards in a futile attempt to escape the darkness.

The smooth surface of the slope curves gently in a wave of glass green foliage. A mist demurely hides the valley floor from prying eyes, offering only teasing glimpses of the tops of jagged marble structures and obelisks that happen to escape its swirling grey clutches. Overhead, the sky is obscured by the rise of stoney hills as the footrail travels restlessly up and down the hillside.

node.name: Vale, Journalai Outskirts
node.description: A glowing white marble marker lies in two whole pieces, its rune-covered surface rendered illegible from years of work by eolian forces. Despite the presence of ivy and lichen on the other marble architecture in the area, the marker remains remarkably clear of encroaching foliage. The darkened hillside that cups the valley flows gently down to the foot of the toppled stone giant, treating it with more deference than the city's conquerers and subsequent plunderers did.

A massive white marble marker lies in two whole pieces, its rune-covered surface rendered illegible from years of work by eolian forces. Despite the presence of ivy and lichen on the other marble architecture in the area, the marker remains remarkably clear of encroaching foliage. The hillside that cups the valley flows gently down to the foot of the toppled stone giant, treating it with more deference than the city's conquerers and subsequent plunderers did.

node.name: Wooded Hills, East Slope
node.description: Springy aspens, shimmering maples, and rampant wild rose vines nervously huddle along the sides of the slope, hedging in the vale floor with a barrier that is at times impenetrable and at other times suspiciously thin. The hoots of gloom-loving owls and the cackle of corbies haunt the treetops, weaving in and out of the all-blanketing mist like lost souls.

node.name: Wooded Hills, Top of Hill
node.description: Trees and other vegetation clear out at the top of the hilltop, creating a bare space whipped by the wind and weather. Bare rocks fight with lichens and other hardy species to cling to the slope. The clearing allows a more expansive view across the valley and the further reaches, showing glimpses of abandoned ruins in the distance.

node.name: Wooded Hills, East Slope
node.description: Heavy, black-leafed bushes cluster around the trees that form the overgrown barrier of the Journalai Vale. The air is bone-numbingly chill here, cutting through the thickest clothing to bite at the very soul. Down the slope, the lonely and broken remains of the city just barely push up through the mist.

node.name: Vale, Journalai Outskirts
node.description: The vale meets up with the steep curve of the hills that protect it here. The occluding mists combine with the darkness to create a powerfully limited range of vision. Faint grunts and other unidentifiable sounds come from above, soft but nonetheless insidious.

The vale meets up with the steep curve of the hills that protect it here. Though the occluding mist limits vision, the faint outlines of dark trees can be detected bordering the top of the hill, creating a tangible boundary between the ruins and the hinterland that surrounds it. Hazy figures move like ghostly shadows through the wilderness, a hint of something sinister amidst the cemetary-like stillness of the dead city.

node.name: Vale, Journalai Ruins
node.description: A cracked and perilous-looking pylon marks the gateway into the city, its lintel carved with the defaced visage of an unknown goddess who yet beckons all to pass beneath her with outspread arms. Moss, ivy, and lichen have crept steadily into the cracks in the gateway, slowly nibbling away at what must have once been a proud testimony to some artisan's genius. The collapsed rubble that was once the outer curtain of the city's walls yet serves as a barrier.

node.name: Foothills Cave, Front
node.description: Gnawed and broken bones litter the cavern's entrance, some so old they shatter at a touch, others so new that they still have bits of meat rotting on them. Set into the deep dirt floor are a number of depressions covered with coarse hair that appear to be sleeping spots for the denizens of this spacious cave. A deep musky odor pervades the space, further testimony to the bestial nature of the inhabitants.

node.name: Foothills Cave, Back
node.description: Sloping downwards towards the back of the cave, the rocky ceiling merges with the slate floor and cuts off all further progress underground. Dirt has drifted into the crevices and corners, adding to the cramped feeling at the edges of the cavern. There are fewer signs of the inhabitants here, perhaps because they find it more cramped than the entrance.

node.name: Wooded Hills, Rocky Glade
node.description: Cupped within the hills, this small glade is strewn with boulders and rocks amongst the swaying grasses of the dell's floor. Towering trees rim the area, enclosing it within the forest's welcoming embrace.

node.name: Wooded Hills, Rocky Glade
node.description: Bending in the slightest breeze, some cattails mark a small declivity that gathers moisture from the surrounding hillsides. Birds flit from the forest's edge to the puddle, their cries filling the daytime sky with song and noise.

node.name: Wooded Hills, Rocky Glade
node.description: Swaying grasses fill the space between the trees, hiding any movement of small animals near the ground. A few boulders peek above the vegetation, their glossy black surfaces gleaming in any available light.

node.name: Wooded Hills, Rocky Glade
node.description: Standing alone in the swaying grasses, a giant oak tree spreads its limbs widely in the glade. An interloper from the surrounding forested hillsides, the sprawling branches provide ample space for nesting birds.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Footpath
node.description: Puffs of ash rise from the ground with every footfall or breath of wind. A winding path runs between the drifts of cinders that obscure the once-thriving valley. An occasional whiff of sulfur is carried on the breeze from the distant volcanoes.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Footpath
node.description: Cloven footprints overlap on the trail, marking the passage of many animals through this ash-choked valley. A few rotting stumps stand above the volcanic debris littering the hillsides. Occasional breezes stir the ash into movement that helps pile the drifts higher.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Stumpy Field
node.description: Tracks carpet the ground while a few stumps stand next to fallen logs.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Abandoned Woodlot
node.description: What was once a grove of trees is now a tangle of downed logs, decaying stumps, and drifts of the choking ash that destroyed the area after a volcanic eruption. The air is heavy with the odors of burnt wood and sulfur while the colorless drifts of ash blanket the ground. The imprints of myriad cloven hooves are the only sign of life throughout this grey expanse.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Stumpy Field
node.description: What was once a sheltered forest snuggled up against a hillside is now a barren expanse of ash with just a few decomposing stumps sticking above the leaden-colored debris. The once-verdant hillsides are likewise carpeted with volcanic detritus, although one trail leading around a hill is free of rubble and could provide a way to scramble up the hill.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Footpath
node.description: The stench of rotting eggs fills the area, carried from the western mountains and the volcanic Fists of Heaven that dominate the range. Beside the game trail, a lone tree stands leafless and dead, a victim of the distant volcano's eruption and destruction.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Ash-covered Ledge
node.description: Curling around the barren hillside, a narrow ledge is a welcome area free of the ever-present ash and cinders of the area. A few spots of volcanic debris are scattered across the otherwise-bare rock. The higher vantage point affords a better view of the western mountains and the twin cones of the Fists of Heaven.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Hillside
node.description: Winding across the ash-covered hillside, cloven hoofprints cover a narrow game trail that testifies that not everything in this valley is dead. An occasional cinder breaks free of the neighboring debris and rolls down the slope, each one leaving a meandering line in the ash.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Hillside
node.description: Views across the valley reveal a monotonous panorama of destruction and ruin. Ash covers everything in a choking blanket of monochromatic grey. Rotting logs and stumps mark where there were once thriving groves of trees before the volcanoes to the west erupted and smothered out most vegetation.

node.name: Watchtower, Command Center
node.description: Thick wooden beams line the room, supporting large, smooth stones that make up the walls and ceiling. Arranged in a semi-circle are some basic oaken chairs that face a massive table covered with maps of the local area and a pot of roasted coffee. A well-worn footlocker is pushed against one wall, the surface stained from years serving as a makeshift table. A wide stone staircase affixed to the wall offers access to the roof.

node.name: Watchtower, Recreation Room
node.description: Mirroring the architecture of the rest of the tower, thick wooden beams rise from floor to ceiling to provide solid support for the roof above. Mounted prominently against one wall is a well-worn dartboard whose surface and the wall surrounding it bear numerous puncture marks. Running the entire span of the room is an impressive bar with numerous bottles of various alcohol stacked behind it, all in different degrees of consumption and labeled with 'Property of the Northern Watch'. The room serves as a comfortable yet lively retreat, where defenders can unwind and enjoy moments of camaraderie.

node.name: Watchtower, Roof
node.description: The tower offers a commanding view of the surrounding countryside. Through the crenelations in the wall, you can look out for miles in any direction. A strange apparatus in the center of the roof appears to be some sort of signalling device.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Trail
node.description: The atmosphere is heavy with the scents of smoldering wood and sulfur, as the desolate landscape is shrouded in a colorless layer of ash. Once trees thrived in the valley, but now they stand lifeless and scorched, victims of the nearby volcanoes. The game trail twists among the stumps as if it was a serpent chasing prey.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Trail
node.description: Here and there, a handful of decaying stumps rise above the volcanic detritus that litters the ground, their silent forms mute testimony to the destructive power of the nearby Fists of Heaven. Every breath of breeze causes small puffs of ash to rise listlessly from the ground, but the ash soon settles back as if the effort to break free was too much.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Trail
node.description: A once-thriving grove of trees has transformed into a chaotic maze of fallen logs, decomposing stumps, and heaps of ash that engulfed the region in the aftermath of a volcanic eruption. The trail splits here, branching in many directions as if unsure of which is the best exit from this desolate landscape. Now and then, a faint hint of sulfur drifts on the breeze, a distant reminder of the active volcanoes in the vicinity.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Trail
node.description: Once, a sheltered forest thrived here, but now, it lies transformed into a desolate stretch of ash, with only a handful of decaying stumps protruding from the leaden-hued wreckage. Occasionally something drops from the bare branches, sending a small puff of ash up from the ground where it lands.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Cliff
node.description: Ash and debris from the nearby volcanoes blankets the ground, choking the vegetation and muffling sound. A short cliff rises above the dead trees, its sheer face sporting a few handholds that could allow a daring adventurer to ascend the cliff.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Trail
node.description: A pervasive odor of putrid eggs saturates the vicinity, emanating from the western mountains and the towering volcanic peaks known as the Fists of Heaven that command the horizon. Cloven hoofprints on the game trail give evidence of some life still clinging to this ashen desert.

node.name: Ashen Valley, Deadfall
node.description: Heaped in large stacks, decaying logs and limbs block the trail. The hoofprints mill about in the ash, indicating the confusion of the area's denizens when faced with the obstacle. The odor of decay has driven out the sulfur scents that normally permeate this desolate valley.

node.name: Deep Forest, Derelict Garden
node.description: What was once a garden lies in disarray, its beds little more than outlines in the soil. A few twisted stakes jut up from the earth, tangled with brittle vines long gone to seed. Scattered stones trace the faint remains of a boundary wall, half-buried beneath moss and leaf litter.

node.name: Deep Forest, Collapsed Shed
node.description: Near the edge of the clearing, a small outbuilding has given way to time. Its sagging roof folds inward, beams rotted through and swallowed by creeping ivy under the open sky. Rusted tools jut from the debris, their edges dulled and spotted, as if left in place on the last day they were used.
